hadiths.by: Narrated by Abdullah bin Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Once Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) gave a letter to a person and ordered him to go and deliver it to the Governor of Bahrain. (He did so) and the Governor of Bahrain sent it to Chousroes, who read that letter and then tore it to pieces. (The sub-narrator (Ibn Shihab) thinks that Ibn Al-Musaiyab said that Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) invoked Allah against them (saying), 'May Allah tear them into pieces, and disperse them all totally.')

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Once the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) wrote a letter or had an idea of writing a letter. The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) was told that they (rulers) would not read letters unless they were sealed. So the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) got a silver ring made with 'Muhammad Allah's Apostle' engraved on it. As if I were just observing its white glitter in the hand of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Waqid Al-Laithi (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: While Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) was sitting in the mosque with some people, three men came. Two of them came in front of Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) and the third one went away. The two persons kept on standing before Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) for a while, then one of them found a place in the circle and sat there, while the other sat behind the gathering, and the third one went away. When Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) finished his preaching, he said, 'Shall I tell you about these three persons? One of them betook himself to Allah, so Allah took him into His grace and mercy and accommodated him, the second felt shy from Allah, so Allah sheltered him in His mercy (and did not punish him), while the third turned his face from Allah and went away, so Allah turned His face from him likewise.'

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdur Rahman bin Abi Bakra's father (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Once the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) was riding his camel and a man was holding its rein. The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) asked, 'What is the day today?' We kept quiet, thinking that he might give that day another name. He said, 'Isn't it the day of Nahr (slaughtering of the animals of sacrifice)?' We replied, 'Yes.' He further asked, 'Which month is this?' We again kept quiet, thinking that he might give it another name. Then he said, 'Isn't it the month of Dhul-Hijja?' We replied, 'Yes.' He said, 'Verily! Your blood, property, and honor are sacred to one another (i.e. Muslims) like the sanctity of this day of yours, in this month of yours, and in this city of yours. It is incumbent upon those who are present to inform those who are absent because those who are absent might comprehend (what I have said) better than the present audience.'

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) used to take care of us in preaching by selecting a suitable time, so that we might not get bored. (He abstained from pestering us with sermons and knowledge all the time).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Facilitate things to people (concerning religious matters), and do not make it hard for them and give them good tidings and do not make them run away (from Islam).'

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Wail (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: 'Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him) used to give a religious talk to the people on every Thursday. Once a man said, 'O Aba 'Abdur-Rahman! (By Allah) I wish if you could preach us daily.' He replied, 'The only thing which prevents me from doing so, is that I hate to bore you, and no doubt I take care of you in preaching by selecting a suitable time just as the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) used to do with us, for fear of making us bored.'

hadiths.by: Narrated by Muawiya (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I heard Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) saying, 'If Allah wants to do good to a person, He makes him comprehend the religion. I am just a distributor, but the grant is from Allah. (And remember) that this nation (true Muslims) will keep on following Allah's teachings strictly and they will not be harmed by any one going on a different path till Allah's order (Day of Judgment) is established.'

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: We were with the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and a spadix of date-palm tree was brought to him. On that he said, 'Amongst the trees, there is a tree which resembles a Muslim.' I wanted to say that it was the date-palm tree but as I was the youngest of all (of them) I kept quiet. And then the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'It is the date-palm tree.'

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abdullah bin Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Do not wish to be like anyone except in two cases. (The first is) A person, whom Allah has given wealth and he spends it righteously; (the second is) the one whom Allah has given wisdom (the Holy Qur'an) and he acts according to it and teaches it to others.'

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: That he differed with Hur bin Qais bin Hisn Al-Fazari regarding the companion of (the Prophet) Moses. Ibn 'Abbas said that he was Khadir. Meanwhile, Ubai bin Ka'b (may Allah be pleased with him) passed by them and Ibn 'Abbas called him, saying 'My friend (Hur) and I have differed regarding Moses' companion whom Moses asked the way to meet. Have you heard the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) mentioning something about him? He said, 'Yes. I heard Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) saying, 'While Moses was sitting in the company of some Israelites, a man came and asked him. 'Do you know anyone who is more learned than you?' Moses replied: 'No.' So Allah sent the Divine Inspiration to Moses: 'Yes, Our slave Khadir (is more learned than you.)' Moses asked (Allah) how to meet him (Khadir). So Allah made the fish as a sign for him and he was told that when the fish was lost, he should return (to the place where he had lost it) and there he would meet him (Al-Khadir). So Moses went on looking for the sign of the fish in the sea. The servant-boy of Moses said to him: Do you remember when we betook ourselves to the rock, I indeed forgot the fish, none but Satan made me forget to remember it. On that Moses said: 'That is what we have been seeking? (18.64) So they went back retracing their foot-steps, and found Khadir. (And) what happened further to them is narrated in the Holy Qur'an by Allah. (18.54 up to 18.82)'

There was no wall in front of him and I passed in front of some of the row while they were offering their prayers. There I let the she-ass loose to graze and entered the row, and nobody objected to it.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Aiyub Al-Ansari (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "If anyone of you goes to an open space for answering the call of nature...

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abdullah bin Umar (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: People say, "Whenever you sit for answering the call of nature, you should not face the Qibla...

hadiths.by: Narrated by Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: The wives of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) used to go to Al-Manasi...

hadiths.by: Narrated by Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said to his wives, "You are allowed to go out to answer the call of nature."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abdullah bin Umar (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I went up to the roof of Hafsa's (may Allah be pleased with her) house...

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abdullah bin Umar (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Once I went up the roof of our house and saw Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) answering the call of nature while sitting over two bricks facing Bait-ul-Maqdis (Jerusalem). (See Hadith No. 147).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Whenever Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) went to answer the call of nature, I along with another boy used to accompany him with a tumbler full of water. (Hisham commented, "So that he might wash his private parts with it.")

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Whenever Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) went to answer the call of nature, I along with another boy from us used to go behind him with a tumbler full of water.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Whenever Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) went to answer the call of nature, I along with another boy used to carry a tumbler full of water (for cleaning the private parts) and an 'Anza (spear-headed stick).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Qatada (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Whenever anyone of you drinks water, he should not breathe in the drinking utensil, and whenever anyone of you goes to a lavatory, he should neither touch his penis nor clean his private parts with his right hand."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Qatada (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Whenever anyone of you makes water he should not hold his penis or clean his private parts with his right hand. (And while drinking) one should not breathe in the drinking utensil."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I followed the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) while he was going out to answer the call of nature. He used not to look this way or that. So, when I approached near him he said to me, "Fetch for me some stones for cleaning the privates parts (or said something similar), and do not bring a bone or a piece of dung." So I brought the stones in the corner of my garment and placed them by his side and I then went away from him. When he finished (from answering the call of nature) he used them.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) went out to answer the call of nature and asked me to bring three stones. I found two stones and searched for the third but could not find it. So I took a dried piece of dung and brought it to him. He took the two stones and threw away the dung and said, "This is a filthy thing."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) performed ablution by washing the body parts only once.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abdullah bin Zaid (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) performed ablution by washing the body parts twice.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Humran (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: (the slave of 'Uthman (may Allah be pleased with him)) I saw 'Uthman bin 'Affan (may Allah be pleased with him) asking for a tumbler of water (and when it was brought) he poured water over his hands and washed them thrice and then put his right hand in the water container and rinsed his mouth, washed his nose by putting water in it and then blowing it out. then he washed his face and forearms up to the elbows thrice, passed his wet hands over his head and washed his feet up to the ankles thrice. Then he said, "Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said 'If anyone Performs ablution like that of mine and offers a two-rak'at prayer during which he does not think of anything else (not related to the present prayer) then his past sins will be forgiven.'" After performing the ablution 'Uthman (may Allah be pleased with him) said, "I am going to tell you a Hadith which I would not have told you, had I not been compelled by a certain Holy Verse (the sub narrator 'Urwa said: This verse is: 'Verily, those who conceal the clear signs and the guidance which we have sent down...)" (2:159). I heard the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) saying, 'If a man performs ablution perfectly and then offers the compulsory congregational prayer, Allah will forgive his sins committed between that (prayer) and the (next) prayer till he offers it.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "If anyone of you performs ablution he should put water in his nose and then blow it out and whoever cleans his private parts with stones should do so with odd numbers. And whoever wakes up from his sleep should wash his hands before putting them in the water for ablution, because nobody knows where his hands were during sleep."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "If anyone of you performs ablution he should put water in his nose and then blow it out and whoever cleans his private parts with stones should do so with odd numbers. And whoever wakes up from his sleep should wash his hands before putting them in the water for ablution, because nobody knows where his hands were during sleep."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abdullah bin Amr (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) remained behind us on a journey. He joined us while we were performing ablution for the 'Asr prayer which was over-due and we were just passing wet hands over our feet (not washing them thoroughly) so he addressed us in a loud voice saying twice or thrice, "Save your heels from the fire."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Humran (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: (the freed slave of 'Uthman bin 'Affan (may Allah be pleased with him)) I saw 'Uthman bin 'Affan (may Allah be pleased with him) asking (for a tumbler of water) to perform ablution (and when it was brought) he poured water from it over his hands and washed them thrice and then put his right hand in the water container and rinsed his mouth and washed his nose by putting water in it and then blowing it out. Then he washed his face thrice and (then) forearms up to the elbows thrice, then passed his wet hands over his head and then washed each foot thrice. After that 'Uthman (may Allah be pleased with him) said, "I saw the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) performing ablution like this of mine, and he said, 'If anyone performs ablution like that of mine and offers a two-rak'at prayer during which he does not think of anything else (not related to the present prayer) then all his past sins will be forgiven.'"

hadiths.by: Narrated by Muhammad Ibn Ziyad (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I heard Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) saying as he passed by us while the people were performing ablution from a utensil containing water, "Perform ablution perfectly and thoroughly for Abul-Qasim (the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)) said, 'Save your heels from the Hell-fire.'"

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Ubaid Ibn Juraij (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I asked 'Abdullah bin 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him), "O Abu 'Abdur-Rahman! I saw you doing four things which I never saw being done by anyone of you companions?" 'Abdullah bin 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) said, "What are those, O Ibn Juraij?" I said, "I never saw you touching any corner of the Ka'ba except these (two) facing south (Yemen) and I saw you wearing shoes made of tanned leather and dyeing your hair with Hinna; (a kind of dye). I also noticed that whenever you were in Mecca, the people assume Ihram on seeing the new moon crescent (1st of Dhul-Hijja) while you did not assume the Ihram till the 8th of Dhul-Hijja (Day of Tarwiya). 'Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him) replied, "Regarding the corners of Ka'ba, I never saw Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) touching except those facing south (Yemen) and regarding the tanned leather shoes, no doubt I saw Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) wearing non-hairy shoes and he used to perform ablution while wearing the shoes (i.e. wash his feet and then put on the shoes). So I love to wear similar shoes. And about the dyeing of hair with Hinna; no doubt I saw Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) dyeing his hair with it and that is why I like to dye (my hair with it). Regarding Ihram, I did not see Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) assuming Ihram till he set out for Hajj (on the 8th of Dhul-Hijja)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Um-'Atiya (may Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: That the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) at the time of washing his deceased daughter had said to them, "Start from the right side beginning with those parts which are washed in ablution."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) used to like to start from the right side on wearing shoes, combing his hair and cleaning or washing himself and on doing anything else.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Saw Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) when the 'Asr prayer was due and the people searched for water to perform ablution but they could not find it. Later on (a pot full of) water for ablution was brought to Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him). He put his hand in that pot and ordered the people to perform ablution from it. I saw the water springing out from underneath his fingers till all of them performed the ablution (it was one of the miracles of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Sirrn (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I said to 'Ablda, "I have some of the hair of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) which I got from Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) or from his family." 'Abida replied. "No doubt if I had a single hair of that it would have been dearer to me than the whole world and whatever is in it."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: When Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) got his head shaved, Abu-Talha (may Allah be pleased with him) was the first to take some of his hair.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "If a dog drinks from the utensil of anyone of you it is essential to wash it seven times."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "A man saw a dog eating mud from (the severity of) thirst. So, that man took a shoe (and filled it) with water and kept on pouring the water for the dog till it quenched its thirst. So Allah approved of his deed and made him to enter Paradise." And narrated Hamza bin 'Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him): My father said. "During the lifetime of Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him), the dogs used to urinate, and pass through the mosques (come and go), nevertheless they never used to sprinkle water on it (urine of the dog.)"

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Adi bin Hatim (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I asked the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) (about the hunting dogs) and he replied, "If you let loose (with Allah's name) your tamed dog after a game and it hunts it, you may eat it, but if the dog eats of (that game) then do not eat it because the dog has hunted it for itself." I further said, "Sometimes I send my dog for hunting and find another dog with it. He said, "Do not eat the game for you have mentioned Allah's name only on sending your dog and not the other dog."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "A person is considered in prayer as long as he is waiting for the prayer in the mosque as long as he does not do Hadath." A non-Arab man asked, "O Abii Huraira! What is Hadath?" I replied, "It is the passing of wind (from the anus) (that is one of the types of Hadath)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abbas bin Tamim (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: My uncle said: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "One should not leave his prayer unless he hears sound or smells something."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ali (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I used to get emotional urethral discharges frequently and felt shy to ask Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) about it. So I requested Al-Miqdad (may Allah be pleased with him) to ask (the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)) about it. Al-Miqdad (may Allah be pleased with him) asked him and he replied, "One has to perform ablution (after it)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Zaid bin Khalid (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I asked 'Uthman bin 'Affan (may Allah be pleased with him) about a person who engaged in intercourse but did no discharge. 'Uthman (may Allah be pleased with him) replied, "He should perform ablution like the one for an ordinary prayer but he must wash his penis." 'Uthman (may Allah be pleased with him) added, "I heard it from Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him)." I asked 'Ali (may Allah be pleased with him) Az-Zubair (may Allah be pleased with him), Talha (may Allah be pleased with him) and Ubai bin Ka'b (may Allah be pleased with him) about it and they, too, gave the same reply.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Messenger (peace be upon him) sent for an Ansari man who came with water dripping from his head. The Prophet (peace be upon him) said, 'Perhaps we made you hurry?' The man replied, 'Yes.' The Prophet (peace be upon him) then said, 'If you are forced to hurry (during intercourse) or you do not ejaculate, then ablution is sufficient for you.' (This ruling was later abrogated, and full bathing became obligatory).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Usama bin Zaid (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: When Allah's Messenger (peace be upon him) departed from 'Arafat, he turned toward a mountain path where he answered the call of nature. After he finished, I poured water for him, and he performed ablution. I asked, 'O Messenger of Allah, will you offer the prayer?' He replied, 'The place of prayer (Musalla) is ahead of you (in Al-Muzdalifah).'

hadiths.by: Narrated by Al-Mughira bin Shu'ba (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I was with the Prophet (peace be upon him) on one of his journeys. He went out to relieve himself, and after he returned, I poured water for him and he performed ablution. He washed his face, forearms, and passed his wet hands over his head and over his leather socks (Khuffain).

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdullah bin 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I stayed overnight in the house of Maimuna, the wife of the Prophet (peace be upon him) and my aunt. I laid down on the edge of the cushion while Allah's Messenger (peace be upon him) and his wife lay lengthwise on it. The Prophet (peace be upon him) slept until the middle of the night, then woke up, rubbed the traces of sleep from his face with his hands, recited the last ten verses of Surah Al-Imran, went to a hanging water skin, performed a perfect ablution, and then stood up to offer prayer.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Asma' bint Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: I came to 'Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her), the wife of the Prophet (peace be upon him), during a solar eclipse. The people were standing in prayer, and she was praying too. I asked her, 'What is happening with the people?' She pointed towards the sky and said, 'Subhan Allah!' I asked, 'Is there a sign?' She replied, 'Yes.' So I stood for prayer until I fainted and later poured water over my head. After the prayer, the Prophet (peace be upon him) praised and glorified Allah and said, 'Just now I saw something I had never seen before at this place — Paradise and Hell.'

hadiths.by: Narrated by Yahya Al-Mazini (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: A man asked 'Abdullah bin Zaid, the grandfather of 'Amr bin Yahya, 'Can you show me how the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) performed ablution?' 'Abdullah bin Zaid replied in the affirmative and asked for water. He poured water on his hands and washed them twice, rinsed his mouth thrice, and washed his nose by putting water in and blowing it out thrice. Then he washed his face thrice, washed his forearms up to the elbows twice, wiped his head by moving his wet hands from front to back and back to front, and washed his feet up to the ankles.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Amr (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: My father saw 'Amr bin Abi Hasan asking 'Abdullah bin Zaid about the ablution of the Prophet (peace be upon him). 'Abdullah asked for an earthenware pot of water, then in front of them performed ablution like the Prophet (peace be upon him). He washed his hands three times, rinsed his mouth and nose with three handfuls of water, washed his face three times, his forearms twice, wiped over his head once from front to back and back again, and then washed his feet up to the ankles.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Juhaifa (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Messenger (peace be upon him) came to us at noon, and water for ablution was brought to him. After he performed ablution, the people collected the leftover water and began wiping it over their bodies. The Prophet (peace be upon him) prayed two units of Zuhr and two units of Asr with a short spear placed in front of him as a Sutrah (barrier).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Shihab (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Mahmud bin Ar-Rabi', on whose face the Prophet (peace be upon him) once spat water from his mouth from a well when he was a child, and 'Urwah (on the authority of Al-Miswar and others) testified that whenever the Prophet (peace be upon him) performed ablution, his companions would almost fight to collect the remaining water.

hadiths.by: Narrated by As-Sa'ib bin Yazid (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: My aunt took me to the Prophet (peace be upon him) and said, 'O Messenger of Allah, this son of my sister is ill in his legs.' The Prophet (peace be upon him) passed his hand over my head and prayed for me, then performed ablution. I drank from the remaining water. I stood behind him and saw the Seal of Prophethood between his shoulders — it was like the button of a small tent (or the egg of a partridge).

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Amr bin Yahya (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: On the authority of his father: 'Abdullah bin Zaid poured water on his hands from a vessel and washed them, rinsed his mouth and cleaned his nose with one handful of water, repeating that three times. He then washed his forearms up to the elbows twice, wiped over his head forwards and backwards, and washed his feet up to the ankles. He said, 'This is how Allah's Messenger (peace be upon him) performed ablution.'

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Amr bin Yahya (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: My father said: 'I saw 'Amr bin Abi Hasan asking 'Abdullah bin Zaid about the ablution of the Prophet (peace be upon him). 'Abdullah asked for a pot of water and performed ablution in front of them: he washed his hands three times, rinsed his mouth and nose with three handfuls of water, washed his face three times, washed his forearms up to the elbows twice, wiped over his head front to back, and washed his feet up to the ankles.'

hadiths.by: Narrated by Wuhaib (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: He (the Prophet (peace be upon him), in narration 191 above) had passed his wet hands over his head.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (peace be upon him) came to visit me while I was sick and unconscious. He performed ablution and sprinkled the remaining water on me. I regained consciousness and said, 'O Messenger of Allah! To whom will my inheritance go as I have no parents or children?' Then the verses of inheritance (Fara'id) were revealed.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: At the time of prayer, those who lived nearby left to perform ablution at home, while others remained. A small container (Mikhdab) with water was brought to the Prophet (peace be upon him). Though it was not wide enough for a hand to spread inside, everyone performed ablution from it. (The sub-narrator said: 'We asked Anas, “How many were you?” He said, “Eighty or more.”' This was one of the miracles of the Prophet (peace be upon him)).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Once the Prophet (peace be upon him) asked for a tumbler of water. He washed his hands and face in it, then spat a mouthful of water back into it.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abdullah bin Zaid (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Once Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) came to us and we brought out water for him in a brass pot. He performed ablution thus: He washed his face thrice, and his forearms to the elbows twice, then passed his wet hands lightly over the head from front to rear and brought them to front again and washed his feet (up to the ankles).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: When the ailment of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) became aggravated and his disease became severe, he asked his wives to permit him to be nursed (treated) in my house. So they gave him the permission. Then the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) came (to my house) with the support of two men, and his legs were dragging on the ground, between 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him), and another man. 'Ubaid-Ullah (the sub narrator) said, "I informed 'Abdullah bin 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with them) of what 'Aisha said. Ibn 'Abbas said: 'Do you know who was the other man?' I replied in the negative. Ibn 'Abbas said, 'He was 'Ali bin Abi Talib (May Allah be pleased with him)." 'Aisha further said, "When the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) came to my house and his sickness became aggravated he ordered us to pour seven skins full of water on him, so that he might give some advice to the people. So he was seated in a Mikhdab (brass tub) belonging to Hafsa (May Allah be pleased with her), the wife of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him). Then, all of us started pouring water on him from the water skins till he beckoned to us to stop and that we have done (what he wanted us to do). After that he went out to the people."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: (on the authority of his father) My uncle used to perform ablution extravagantly and once he asked 'Abdullah bin Zaid (May Allah be pleased with him) to tell him how he had seen the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) performing ablution. He asked for an earthen-ware pot containing water, and poured water from it on his hands and washed them thrice, and then put his hand in the earthen-ware pot and rinsed his mouth and washed his nose by putting water in it and then blowing it out thrice with one handful of water; he again put his hand in the water and took a handful of water and washed his face thrice, then washed his hands up to the elbows twice, and took water with his hand, and passed it over his head from front to back and then from back to front, and then washed his feet (up to the ankles) and said, "I saw the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) performing ablution in that way."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) asked for water and a tumbler with a broad base and no so deep, containing a small quantity of water, was brought to him whereby he put his fingers in it." Anas further said, 'I noticed the water springing out from amongst his fingers." Anas added, 'I estimated that the people who performed ablution with it numbered between seventy to eighty."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) used to take a bath with one Saor up to five Mudds (1 Sa'= Mudds) of water and used to perform ablution with one Mudd of water.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) passed wet hands over his Khuffs." 'Abdullah bin 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) asked Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) about it. 'Umar replied in the affirmative and added, "Whenever Sa'd narrates a Hadith from the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him), there is no need to ask anyone else about it."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Once Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) went out to answer the call of nature and I followed him with a tumbler containing water, and when he finished, I poured water and he performed ablution and passed wet hands over his Khuffs.

hadiths.narrator: Ja'far bin Amr bin Umaiya Ad-Damri
hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: My father said, "I saw the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) passing wet hands over his Khuffs."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: My father said, "I saw the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) passing wet hands over his turban and Khuffs (leather socks)."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: My father said, "Once I was in the company of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) on a journey and I dashed to take off his Khuffs. He ordered me to leave them as he had put them on after performing ablution. So he passed wet hands over them.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) ate a piece of cooked mutton from the shoulder region and prayed without repeating ablution.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: My father said, "I saw Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) taking a piece of (cooked) mutton from the shoulder region and then he was called for prayer. He put his knife down and prayed without repeating ablution."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: In the year of the conquest of Khaibar I went with Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) till we reached Sahba,' a place near Khaibar, where Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) offered the 'Asr prayer and asked for food. Nothing but Sawrq was brought. He ordered it to be moistened with water. He and all of us ate it, and the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) got up for the evening prayer (Maghrib prayer), rinsed his mouth with water and we did the same, and he then prayed without repeating the ablution.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) ate (a piece of) mutton from the shoulder region and then prayed without repeating the ablution.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) drank milk, rinsed his mouth and said, "It has fat."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "If anyone of you feels drowsy while praying he should go to bed (sleep) till his slumber is over because in praying while drowsy one does not know whether one is asking for forgiveness or for a bad thing for oneself."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "If anyone of you feels drowsy while praying, he should sleep till he understands what he is saying (reciting)."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) used to perform ablution for every prayer." I asked Anas, "What did you used to do?" Anas replied, "We used to pray with the same ablution until we break it with Hadath."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: In the year of the conquest of Khaibar I went with Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) till we reached As-Sahba' where Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) led the 'Asr prayer and asked for the food. Nothing but Sawiq was brought and we ate it and drank (water). The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) got up for the (Maghrib) Prayer, rinsed his mouth with water and then led the prayer without repeating the ablution.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Once the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him), while passing through one of the graveyards of Medina or Mecca heard the voices of two persons who were being tortured in their graves. The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "These two persons are being tortured not for a major sin (to avoid)." The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) then added, "Yes! (they are being tortured for a major sin). Indeed, one of them never saved himself from being soiled with his urine while the other used to go about with calumnies (to make enmity between friends). The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) then asked for a green leaf of a date-palm tree, broke it into two pieces and put one on each grave. On being asked why he had done so, he replied, "I hope that their torture might be lessened, till these get dried."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Whenever the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) went to answer the call of nature, I used to bring water with which he used to clean his private parts.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) once passed by two graves and said, "These two persons are being tortured not for a major sin (to avoid). One of them never saved himself from being soiled with his urine, while the other used to go about with calumnies(to make enmity between friends)." The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) then took a green leaf of a date-palm tree, split it into pieces and fixed one on each grave. They said, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him)! Why have you done so?" He replied, "I hope that their punishment might be lessened till these (the pieces of the leaf) become dry."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) saw a Bedouin making water in the mosque and told the people not to disturb him. When he finished, the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) asked for some water and poured it over (the urine).

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: A Bedouin stood up and started making water in the mosque. The people caught him but the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) ordered them to leave him and to pour a bucket or a tumbler of water over the place where he had passed the urine. The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) then said, "You have been sent to make things easy and not to make them difficult."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said as above (219).

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: A Bedouin came and passed urine in one corner of the mosque. The people shouted at him but the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) stopped them till he finished urinating. The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) ordered them to spill a bucket of water over that place and they did so.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: (the mother of faithful believers) A child was brought to Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) and it urinated on the garment of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him). The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) asked for water and poured it over the soiled place.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: I brought my young son, who had not started eating (ordinary food) to Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) who took him and made him sit in his lap. The child urinated on the garment of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him), so he asked for water and poured it over the soiled (area) and did not wash it.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Once the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) went to the dumps of some people and passed urine while standing. He then asked for water and so I brought it to him and he performed ablution.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and I walked till we reached the dumps of some people. He stood, as any one of you stands, behind a wall and urinated. I went away, but he beckoned me to come. So I approached him and stood near his back till he finished.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari (May Allah be pleased with him) used to lay great stress on the question of urination and he used to say, "If anyone from Bani Israel happened to soil his clothes with urine, he used to cut that portion away." Hearing that, Hudhaifa (May Allah be pleased with him) said to Abu Wail, "I wish he (Abu Musa) didn't (lay great stress on that matter)." Hudhaifa added, "Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) went to the dumps of some people and urinated while standing."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: A woman came to the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and said, "If anyone of us gets menses in her clothes then what should she do?" He replied, "She should (take hold of the soiled place), rub it and put it in the water and rub it in order to remove the traces of blood and then pour water over it. Then she can pray in it."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: Fatima bint Abi Hubaish (May Allah be pleased with her) came to the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and said, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) I get persistent bleeding from the uterus and do not become clean. Shall I give up my prayers?" Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) replied, "No, because it is from a blood vessel and not the menses. So when your real menses begins give up your prayers and when it has finished wash off the blood (take a bath) and offer your prayers." Hisham (the sub-narrator) narrated that his father had also said, (the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) told her): "Perform ablution for every prayer till the time of the next period comes."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: I used to wash the traces of Janaba (semen) from the clothes of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and he used to go for prayers while traces of water were still on it (water spots were still visible).

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: as above (229).

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: I asked 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) about the clothes soiled with semen. She replied, "I used to wash it off the clothes of Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) and he would go for the prayer while water spots were still visible."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: I heard Sulaiman bin Yasar (May Allah be pleased with him) talking about the clothes soiled with semen. He said that 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) had said, "I used to wash it off the clothes of Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) and he would go for the prayers while water spots were still visible on them."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: I used to wash the semen off the clothes of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and even then I used to notice one or more spots on them.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "Some people of 'Ukl or 'Uraina tribe came to Medina and its climate did not suit them. So the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) ordered them to go to the herd of (Milch) camels and to drink their milk and urine (as a medicine). So they went as directed and after they became healthy, they killed the shepherd of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and drove away all the camels. The news reached the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) early in the morning and he sent (men) in their pursuit and they were captured and brought at noon. He then ordered to cut their hands and feet (and it was done), and their eyes were branded with heated pieces of iron, They were put in 'Al-Harra' and when they asked for water, no water was given to them." Abu Qilaba said, "Those people committed theft and murder, became infidels after embracing Islam and fought against Allah and His Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him)."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Prior to the construction of the mosque, the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) offered the prayers at sheep-folds.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) was asked regarding ghee (cooking butter) in which a mouse had fallen. He said, "Take out the mouse and throw away the ghee around it and use the rest."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) was asked regarding ghee in which a mouse had fallen. He said, "Take out the mouse and throw away the ghee around it (and use the rest.)"

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "A wound which a Muslim receives in Allah's cause will appear on the Day of Resurrection as it was at the time of infliction; blood will be flowing from the wound and its color will be that of the blood but will smell like musk."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "We (Muslims) are the last (people to come in the world) but (will be) the foremost (on the Day of Resurrection)." The same narrator told that the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) had said, "You should not pass urine in stagnant water which is not flowing then (you may need to) wash in it."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: While Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) was prostrating (as stated below).

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Once the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) was offering prayers at the Ka'ba. Abu Jahl was sitting with some of his companions. One of them said to the others, "Who amongst you will bring the abdominal contents (intestines, etc.) of a camel of Bani so and so and put it on the back of Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him), when he prostrates?" The most unfortunate of them got up and brought it. He waited till the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) prostrated and then placed it on his back between his shoulders. I was watching but could not do anything. I wish I had some people with me to hold out against them. They started laughing and falling on one another. Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) was in prostration and he did not lift his head up till Fatima (May Allah be pleased with her) (Prophet's daughter) came and threw that (camel's abdominal contents) away from his back. He raised his head and said thrice, "O Allah! Punish Quraish." So it was hard for Abu Jahl and his companions when the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) invoked Allah against them as they had a conviction that the prayers and invocations were accepted in this city (Mecca). The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "O Allah! Punish Abu Jahl, 'Utba bin Rabi'a, Shaiba bin Rabi'a, Al-Walid bin 'Utba, Umaiya bin Khalaf, and 'Uqba bin Al Mu'it (and he mentioned the seventh whose name I cannot recall). By Allah in Whose Hands my life is, I saw the dead bodies of those persons who were counted by Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) in the Qalib (one of the wells) of Badr."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) once spat in his clothes.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "All drinks that produce intoxication are Haram (forbidden to drink)."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Sahl bin Sa'd As-Sa'idi (May Allah be pleased with him), was asked by the people, "With what was the wound of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) treated? Sahl replied, "None remains among the people living who knows that better than I. 'Ali (May Allah be pleased with him) used to bring water in his shield and Fatima (May Allah be pleased with her) used to wash the blood off his face. Then straw mat was burnt and the wound was filled with it."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: My father said, "I came to the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and saw him carrying a Siwak in his hand and cleansing his teeth, saying, 'U' U'," as if he was retching while the Siwak was in his mouth."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Whenever the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) got up at night, he used to clean his mouth with Siwak.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said to me, "Whenever you go to bed perform ablution like that for the prayer, lie on your right side and say, "Allahumma aslamtu wajhi ilaika, wa fauwadtu amri ilaika, wa alja'tu Zahri ilaika raghbatan wa rahbatan ilaika. La Malja' wa la manja minka illa ilaika. Allahumma amantu bikitabika-l-ladhi anzalta wa bina-biyika-l ladhi arsalta" (O Allah! I surrender to You and entrust all my affairs to You and depend upon You for Your Blessings both with hope and fear of You. There is no fleeing from You, and there is no place of protection and safety except with You O Allah! I believe in Your Book (the Qur'an) which You have revealed and in Your Prophet (Muhammad) whom You have sent). Then if you die on that very night, you will die with faith (i.e. or the religion of Islam). Let the aforesaid words be your last utterance (before sleep)." I repeated it before the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and when I reached "Allahumma amantu bikitabika-l-ladhi anzalta (O Allah I believe in Your Book which You have revealed)." I said, "Wa-rasulika (and your Apostle)." The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "No, (but say): 'Wanabiyika-l-ladhi arsalta (Your Prophet whom You have sent), instead."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: Whenever the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) took a bath after Janaba he started by washing his hands and then performed ablution like that for the prayer. After that he would put his fingers in water and move the roots of his hair with them, and then pour three handfuls of water over his head and then pour water all over his body.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: (the wife of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)) Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) performed ablution like that for the prayer but did not wash his feet. He washed off the discharge from his private parts and then poured water over his body. He withdrew his feet from that place (the place where he took the bath) and then washed them. And that was his way of taking the bath of Janaba.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and I used to take a bath from a single pot called 'Faraq'.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: 'Aisha's (May Allah be pleased with her) brother and I went to 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) and he asked her about the bath of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him). She brought a pot containing about a Sa' of water and took a bath and poured it over her head and at what time there was a screen between her and us.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: While I and my father were with Jabir bin 'Abdullah (May Allah be pleased with him), some people asked him about taking a bath. He replied, "A Sa' of water is sufficient for you." A man said, "A Sa' is not sufficient for me." Jabir said, "A Sa was sufficient for one who had more hair than you and was better than you (meaning the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him))." And then Jabir (May Allah be pleased with him) (put on) his garment and led the prayer.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and Maimuna (May Allah be pleased with her) used to take a bath from a single pot.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "As for me, I pour water three times on my head." And he pointed with both his hands.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) used to pour water three times on his head.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Jabir bin Abdullah (May Allah be pleased with him) said to me, "Your cousin (Hasan bin Muhammad bin Al-Hanafiya) came to me and asked about the bath of Janaba. I replied, 'The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) uses to take three handfuls of water, pour them on his head and then pour more water over his body.' Al-Hasan said to me, 'I am a hairy man.' I replied, 'The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) had more hair than you.'

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: I placed water for the bath of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him). He washed his hands twice or thrice and then poured water on his left hand and washed his private parts. He rubbed his hands over the earth (and cleaned them), rinsed his mouth, washed his nose by putting water in it and blowing it out, washed his face and both forearms and then poured water over his body. Then he withdrew from that place and washed his feet.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: Whenever the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) took the bath of Janaba (sexual relation or wet dream) he asked for the Hilab or some other scent. He used to take it in his hand, rub it first over the right side of his head and then over the left and then rub the middle of his head with both hands.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: I placed water for the bath of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and he poured water with his right hand on his left and washed them. Then he washed his private parts and rubbed his hands on the ground, washed them with water, rinsed his mouth and washed his nose by putting water in it and blowing it out, washed his face and poured water on his head. He withdrew from that place and washed his feet. A piece of cloth (towel) was given to him but he did not use it.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) took the bath of Janaba (sexual relation or wet dream). He first cleaned his private parts with his hand, and then rubbed it (that hand) on the wall (earth) and washed it. Then he performed ablution like that for the prayer, and after the bath, he washed his feet.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and I used to take a bath from a single pot of water and our hands used to go in the pot after each other in turn.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: Whenever Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) took a bath of Janaba, he washed his hands first.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and I used to take a bath from a single pot of water after Janaba.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and one of his wives used to take a bath from a single pot of water. (Shu'ba added to Anas's Statement "After the Janaba")

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: I placed water for the bath of Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) and he poured water over his hands and washed them twice or thrice; then he poured water with his right hand over his left and washed his private parts (with his left hand). He rubbed his hand over the earth and rinsed his mouth, washed his nose by putting water in it and blowing it out. After that he washed his face, both forearms and head thrice and then poured water over his body. He withdrew from that place and washed his feet.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: I placed water for the bath of Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) and put a screen. He poured water over his hands, and washed them once or twice. (The subnarrator added that he did not remember if she had said thrice or not). Then he poured water with his right hand over his left one and washed his private parts. He rubbed his hand over the earth or the wall and washed it. He rinsed his mouth and washed his nose by putting water in it and blowing it out. He washed his face, forearms and head. He poured water over his body and then withdrew from that place and washed his feet. I presented him a piece of cloth (towel) and he pointed with his hand (that he does not want it) and did not take it.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: On the authority of his father that he had asked 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) (about the Hadith of Ibn 'Umar). She said, "May Allah be Merciful to Abu 'Abdur-Rahman. I used to put scent on Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) and he used to go round his wives, and in the morning he assumed the Ihram, and the fragrance of scent was still coming out from his body."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) used to visit all his wives in a round, during the day and night and they were eleven in number." I asked Anas, "Had the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) the strength for it?" Anas replied, "We used to say that the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) was given the strength of thirty (men)." And Sa'id said on the authority of Qatada that Anas had told him about nine wives only (not eleven).

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: I used to get emotional urethral discharge frequently. Being the son-in-law of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) I requested a man to ask him about it. So the man asked the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) about it. The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) replied, "Perform ablution after washing your organ (penis)."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: On the authority of his father that he had asked 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) about the saying of Ibn 'Umar (i.e. he did not like to be a Muhrim while the smell of scent was still coming from his body). 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) said, "I scented Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) and he went round (had sexual intercourse with) all his wives, and in the morning he was Muhrim (after taking a bath)."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: It is as if I am just looking at the glitter of scent in the parting of the Prophet's (Peace Be Upon Him) head hair while he was a Muhrim.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: (on the authority of his father) 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) said, "Whenever Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) took the bath of Janaba, he cleaned his hands and performed ablution like that for prayer and then took a bath and rubbed his hair, till he felt that the whole skin of the head had become wet, then he would pour water thrice and wash the rest of the body." 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) further said, "I and Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) used to take a bath from a single water container, from which we took water simultaneously."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: Water was placed for the ablution of Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) after Janaba. He poured water with his right hand over his left twice or thrice and then washed his private parts and rubbed his hand on the earth or on a wall twice or thrice and then rinsed his mouth, washed his nose by putting water in it and then blowing it out and then washed his face and forearms and poured water over his head and washed his body. Then he shifted from that place and washed his feet. I brought a piece of cloth, but he did not take it and removed the traces of water from his body with his hand.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Once the call (Iqama) for the prayer was announced and the rows were straightened. Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) came out; and when he stood up at his Musalla, he remembered that he was Junub. Then he ordered us to stay at our places and went to take a bath and then returned with water dropping from his head. He said, "Allahu-Akbar", and we all offered the prayer with him.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: I placed water for the bath of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and screened him with a garment. He poured water over his hands and washed them. After that he poured water with his right hand over his left and washed his private parts, rubbed his hands with earth and washed them, rinsed his mouth, washed his nose by putting water in it and then blowing it out and then washed his face and forearms. He poured water over his head and body. He then shifted from that place and washed his feet. I gave him a piece of cloth but he did not take it and came out removing the water (from his body) with both his hands.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: Whenever any one of us was Junub, she poured water over her head thrice with both her hands and then rubbed the right side of her head with one hand and rubbed the left side of the head with the other hand.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The (people of) Bani Israel used to take bath naked (all together) looking at each other. The Prophet Moses (Peace Be Upon Him) used to take a bath alone. They said, 'By Allah! Nothing prevents Moses from taking a bath with us except that he has a scrotal hernia.' So once Moses went out to take a bath and put his clothes over a stone and then that stone ran away with his clothes. Moses followed that stone saying, "My clothes, O stone! My clothes, O stone!" till the people of Bani Israel saw him and said, 'By Allah, Moses has got no defect in his body. Moses took his clothes and began to beat the stone." Abu Huraira added, "By Allah! There are still six or seven marks present on the stone from that excessive beating." Narrated Abu Huraira: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "When the Prophet Job (Aiyub) (Peace Be Upon Him) was taking a bath naked, golden locusts began to fall on him. Job started collecting them in his clothes. His Lord addressed him, 'O Job! Haven't I given you enough so that you are not in need of them.' Job replied, 'Yes! By Your Honor (power)! But I cannot dispense with Your Blessings.'"

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: I went to Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) in the year of the conquest of Mecca and found him taking a bath while Fatima (May Allah be pleased with her) was screening him. The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) asked, "Who is it?" I replied, "I am Um-Hani."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: I screened the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) while he was taking a bath of Janaba. He washed his hands, poured water from his right hand over his left and washed his private parts. Then he rubbed his hand over a wall or the earth, and performed ablution similar to that for the prayer but did not wash his feet. Then he poured water over his body, shifted from that place, and washed his feet.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: (the mother of the believers) Um Sulaim, the wife of Abu Talha (May Allah be pleased with them), came to Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) and said, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him)! Verily Allah is not shy of (telling you) the truth. Is it necessary for a woman to take a bath after she has a wet dream (nocturnal sexual discharge)?" Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) replied, "Yes, if she notices a discharge."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) came across me in one of the streets of Medina and at that time I was Junub. So I slipped away from him and went to take a bath. On my return the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "O Abu Huraira! Where have you been?" I replied, "I was Junub, so I disliked to sit in your company." The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Subhan Allah! A believer never becomes impure."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) used to visit all his wives in one night and he had nine wives at that time.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) came across me and I was Junub. He took my hand and I went along with him till he sat down. I slipped away, went home and took a bath. When I came back, he was still sitting there. He then said to me, "O Abu Huraira! Where have you been?' I told him about it. The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Subhan Allah! O Abu Huraira! A believer never becomes impure."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: I asked 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) "Did the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) use to sleep while he was Junub?" She replied, "Yes, but he used to perform ablution (before going to bed)."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: I asked Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) "Can any one of us sleep while he is Junub?" He replied, "Yes, if he performs ablution, he can sleep while he is Junub."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: Whenever the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) intended to sleep while he was Junub, he used to wash his private parts and perform ablution like that for the prayer.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) asked the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) "Can anyone of us sleep while he is Junub?" He replied, "Yes, if he performs ablution."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Umar bin Al-Khattab (May Allah be pleased with him) told Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him), "I became Junub at night." Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) replied, "Perform ablution after washing your private parts and then sleep."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: as the following Hadith 290.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "When a man sits in between the four parts of a woman and did the sexual intercourse with her, bath becomes compulsory."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: I asked 'Uthman bin 'Affan (May Allah be pleased with him) about a man who engaged in the sexual intercourse with his wife but did not discharge. 'Uthman replied, "He should perform ablution like that for the prayer after washing his private parts." 'Uthman added, "I heard that from Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him)." I asked 'Ali bin Abi Talib (May Allah be pleased with him), Az-Zubair bin Al-'Awwam (May Allah be pleased with him), Talha bin 'Ubaidullah (May Allah be pleased with him) and Ubai bin Ka'b (May Allah be pleased with him) and a gave the same reply. (Abu Aiylub said that he had heard that from Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him)) (This order was cancelled later on so one has to take a bath. See, Hadith No. 180).

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: I asked Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) about a man who engages in sexual intercourse with his wife but does not discharge. He replied, "He should wash the parts which come in contact with the private parts of the woman, perform ablution and then pray." (Abu 'Abdullah said, "Taking a bath is safer and is the last order.")

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) said, "We set out with the sole intention of performing Hajj and when we reached Sarif, (a place six miles from Mecca) I got my menses. Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) came to me while I was weeping. He said 'What is the matter with you? Have you got your menses?' I replied, 'Yes.' He said, 'This is a thing which Allah has ordained for the daughters of Adam. So do what all the pilgrims do with the exception of the Taw-af (Circumambulation) round the Ka'ba.' 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) added, "Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) sacrificed cows on behalf of his wives."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: While in menses, I used to comb the hair of Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him).

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: A person asked me, "Can a woman in menses serve me? And can a Junub woman come close to me?" I replied, "All this is easy for me. All of them can serve me, and there is no harm for any other person to do the same. 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) told me that she used to comb the hair of Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) while she was in her menses, and he was in Itikaf (in the mosque). He would bring his head near her in her room and she would comb his hair, while she used to be in her menses."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) used to lean on my lap and recite Qur'an while I was in menses.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: While I was laying with the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) under a single woolen sheet, I got the menses. I slipped away and put on the clothes for menses. He said, "Have you got "Nifas" (menses)?" I replied, "Yes." He then called me and made me lie with him under the same sheet.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and I used to take a bath from a single pot while we were Junub. During the menses, he used to order me to put on an Izar (dress worn below the waist) and used to fondle me. While in Itikaf, he used to bring his head near me and I would wash it while I used to be in my periods (menses).

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: (on the authority of his father) 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) said: "Whenever Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) wanted to fondle anyone of us during her periods (menses), he used to order her to put on an Izar and start fondling her." 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) added, "None of you could control his sexual desires as the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) could."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: Whenever Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) wanted to fondle any of his wives during the periods (menses), he used to ask her to wear an Izar.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Once Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) went out to the Musalla (to offer the prayer) o 'Id-al-Adha or Al-Fitr prayer. Then he passed by the women and said, "O women! Give alms, as I have seen that the majority of the dwellers of Hell-fire were you (women)." They asked, "Why is it so, O Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him)?" He replied, "You curse frequently and are ungrateful to your husbands. I have not seen anyone more deficient in intelligence and religion than you. A cautious sensible man could be led astray by some of you." The women asked, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him)! What is deficient in our intelligence and religion?" He said, "Is not the evidence of two women equal to the witness of one man?" They replied in the affirmative. He said, "This is the deficiency in her intelligence. Isn't it true that a woman can neither pray nor fast during her menses?" The women replied in the affirmative. He said, "This is the deficiency in her religion."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: We set out with the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) for Hajj and when we reached Sarif I got my menses. When the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) came to me, I was weeping. He asked, "Why are you weeping?" I said, "I wish if I had not performed Hajj this year." He asked, "May be that you got your menses?" I replied, "Yes." He then said, "This is the thing which Allah has ordained for all the daughters of Adam. So do what all the pilgrims do except that you do not perform the Tawaf round the Ka'ba till you are clean."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: Fatima bint Abi Hubaish (May Allah be pleased with her) said to Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him), "O Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him)! I do not become clean (from bleeding). Shall I give up my prayers?" Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) replied: "No, because it is from a blood vessel and not the menses. So when the real menses begins give up your prayers and when it (the period) has finished wash the blood off your body (take a bath) and offer your prayers."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: A woman asked Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him), "O Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him)! What should we do, if the blood of menses falls on our clothes?" Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) replied, "If the blood of menses falls on the garment of anyone of you, she must take hold of the blood spot, rub it, and wash it with water and then pray in (with it)."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: Whenever anyone of us got her menses, she, on becoming clean, used to take hold of the blood spot and rub the blood off her garment, and pour water over it and wash that portion thoroughly and sprinkle water over the rest of the garment. After that she would pray in (with) it.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: Once one of the wives of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) did Itikaf along with him and she was getting bleeding in between her periods. She used to see the blood (from her private parts) and she would perhaps put a dish under her for the blood. (The sub-narrator 'Ikrima added, 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) once saw the liquid of safflower and said, "It looks like what so and so used to have.")

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: "One of the wives of Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) joined him in l'tikaf and she noticed blood and yellowish discharge (from her private parts) and put a dish under her when she prayed."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: One of the mothers of the faithful believers (i.e. the wives of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)) did l'tikaf while she was having bleeding in between her periods.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: None of us had more than a single garment and we used to have our menses while wearing it. Whenever it got soiled with blood of menses we used to apply saliva to the blood spot and rub off the blood with our nails.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: We were forbidden to mourn for a dead person for more than three days except in the case of a husband for whom mourning was allowed for four months and ten days. (During that time) we were not allowed to put ko,hl (Antimony eye power) in our eyes or to use perfumes or to put on colored clothes except a dress made of 'Asb (a kind of Yemen cloth, very coarse and rough). We were allowed very light perfumes at the time of taking a bath after menses and also we were forbidden to go with the funeral procession.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: A woman asked the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) about the bath which is taken after finishing from the menses. The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) told her what to do and said, "Purify yourself with a piece of cloth scented with musk." The woman asked, "How shall I purify myself with it" He said, "Subhan Allah! Purify yourself (with it)." I pulled her to myself and said, "Rub the place soiled with blood with it."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: An Ansari woman asked the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) how to take a bath after finishing from the menses. He replied, "Take a piece a cloth perfumed with musk and clean the private parts with it thrice." The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) felt shy and turned his face. So I pulled her to me and told her what the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) meant.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: In the last Hajj of Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) I assumed the Ihram for Hajj along with Allah Apostle. I was one of those who intended Tamattu' (to perform Hajj an 'Umra) and did not take the Hadi (animal for sacrifice) with me. I got my menses and was not clean till the night of 'Arafa I said, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him)! It is the night of the day of 'Arafat and I intended to perform the Hajj Tamattu' with 'Umra Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) told me to undo my hair and comb it and to postpone the 'Umra. I did the same and completed the Hajj. On the night of Al-Hasba (i.e. place outside Mecca where the pilgrims go after finishing all the ceremonies Hajj at Mina) he (the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)) ordered 'Abdur Rahman ('Aisha's brother) to take me to At-Tan'im to assume the Ihram for 'Umra in lieu of that of Hajj-at-Tamattu' which I had intended to perform.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: On the 1st of Dhul-Hijja we set out with the intention of performing Hajj. Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Any one who likes to assume the Ihram for 'Umra he can do so. Had I not brought the Hadi with me, I would have assumed the Ihram for 'Umra. "Some of us assumed the Ihram for 'Umra while the others assumed the Ihram for Hajj. I was one of those who assumed the Ihram for 'Umra. I got menses and kept on menstruating until the day of 'Arafat and complained of that to the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him). He told me to postpone my 'Umra, undo and comb my hair, and to assure the Ihram of Hajj and I did so. On the right of Hasba, he sent my brother 'Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Bakr with me to At-Tan'im, where I assumed the Ihram for 'Umra in lieu of the previous one. Hisham said, "For that ('Umra) no Hadi, fasting or alms were required.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "At every womb Allah appoints an angel who says, 'O Lord! A drop of semen, O Lord! A clot. O Lord! A little lump of flesh." Then if Allah wishes (to complete) its creation, the angel asks, (O Lord!) Will it be a male or female, a wretched or a blessed, and how much will his provision be? And what will his age be?' So all that is written while the child is still in the mother's womb.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) said, "We set out with the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) in his last Hajj. Some of us intended to perform 'Umra while others Hajj. When we reached Mecca, Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Those who had assumed the Ihram for'Umra and had not brought the Hadi should finish his Ihram and whoever had assumed the Ihram for 'Umra and brought the Hadi should not finish the Ihram till he has slaughtered his Hadi and whoever had assumed the Ihram for Hajj should complete his Hajj.' 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) further said, "I got my periods (menses) and kept on menstruating till the day of 'Arafat, and I had assumed the Ihram for 'Umra only (Tamattu'). The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) ordered me to undo and comb my head hair and assume the Ihram for Hajj only and leave the 'Umra. I did the same till I completed the Hajj. Then the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) sent 'Abdur Rahman bin Abi Bakr with me and ordered me to perform 'Umra from At-Tan'im in lieu of the missed 'Umra."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
