hadiths.text: Fatima bint Abi Hubaish (May Allah be pleased with her) used to have bleeding in between the periods, so she asked the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) about it. He replied, "The bleeding is from a blood vessel and not the menses. So give up the prayers when the (real) menses begin and when it has finished, take a bath and start praying."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: A woman asked 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her), "Should I offer the prayers that which I did not offer because of menses" 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) said, "Are you from the Huraura' (a town in Iraq?) We were with the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and used to get our periods but he never ordered us to offer them (the Prayers missed during menses)." 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) perhaps said, "We did not offer them."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: Um-Salama (May Allah be pleased with her) said, "I got my menses while I was lying with the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) under a woolen sheet. So I slipped away, took the clothes for menses and put them on. Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Have you got your menses?' I replied, 'Yes.' Then he called me and took me with him under the same sheet." Um Salama (May Allah be pleased with her) further said, "The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) used to kiss me while he was fasting. The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and I used to take the bath of Janaba from a single pot."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: While I was lying with the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) under a woolen sheet, I got my menses. I slipped away and put on the clothes for menses. The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Have you got your menses?" I replied, "Yes." He called me and I slept with him under the woolen sheet.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Hafsa (May Allah be pleased with her) said, 'We used to forbid our young women to go out for the two 'Id prayers. A woman came and stayed at the palace of Bani Khalaf and she narrated about her sister whose husband took part in twelve holy battles along with the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and her sister was with her husband in six (out of these twelve). She (the woman's sister) said, "We used to treat the wounded, look after the patients and once I asked the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him), 'Is there any harm for any of us to stay at home if she doesn't have a veil?' He said, 'She should cover herself with the veil of her companion and should participate in the good deeds and in the religious gathering of the Muslims.' When Um 'Atiya (May Allah be pleased with her) came I asked her whether she had heard it from the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him). She replied, "Yes. May my father be sacrificed for him (the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him))! (Whenever she mentioned the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) she used to say, 'May my father be sacrificed for him) I have heard the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) saying, 'The unmarried young virgins and the mature girl who stay often screened or the young unmarried virgins who often stay screened and the menstruating women should come out and participate in the good deeds as well as the religious gathering of the faithful believers but the menstruating women should keep away from the Musalla (praying place).' " Hafsa (May Allah be pleased with her) asked Um 'Atiya (May Allah be pleased with her) surprisingly, "Do you say the menstruating women?" She replied, "Doesn't a menstruating woman attend 'Arafat (Hajj) and such and such (other deeds)?"

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: Fatima bint Abi Hubaish (May Allah be pleased with her) asked the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him), "I got persistent bleeding (in between the periods) and do not become clean. Shall I give up prayers?" He replied, "No, this is from a blood vessel. Give up the prayers only for the days on which you usually get the menses and then take a bath and offer your prayers."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: We never considered yellowish discharge as a thing of importance (as menses).

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: (the wife of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)) Um Habiba (May Allah be pleased with her) got bleeding in between the periods for seven years. She asked Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) about it. He ordered her to take a bath (after the termination of actual periods) and added that it was (from) a blood vessel. So she used to take a bath for every prayer.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: (the wife of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)) I told Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) that Safiya bint Huyai (May Allah be pleased with her) had got her menses. He said, "She will probably delay us. Did she perform Tawaf (Al-Ifada) with you?" We replied, "Yes." On that the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) told her to depart.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: A woman is allowed to leave (go back home) if she gets menses (after Tawaf-AlIfada). Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) formerly used to say that she should not leave but later on I heard him saying, "She may leave, since Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) gave them the permission to leave (after Tawaf-AlIfada)."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said to me, "Give up the prayer when your menses begin and when it has finished, wash the blood off your body (take a bath) and start praying."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) offered the funeral prayer for the dead body of a woman who died of (during) delivery (i.e. child birth) and he stood by the middle of her body.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: (the wife of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)) During my menses, I never prayed, but used to sit on the mat beside the mosque of Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him). He used to offer the prayer on his sheet and in prostration some of his clothes used to touch me.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "While I was at Mecca the roof of my house was opened and Gabriel (Peace Be Upon Him) descended, opened my chest, and washed it with Zam-zam water. Then he brought a golden tray full of wisdom and faith and having poured its contents into my chest, he closed it. Then he took my hand and ascended with me to the nearest heaven, when I reached the nearest heaven, Gabriel (Peace Be Upon Him) said to the gatekeeper of the heaven, 'Open (the gate).' The gatekeeper asked, 'Who is it?' Gabriel (Peace Be Upon Him) answered: 'Gabriel (Peace Be Upon Him).' He asked, 'Is there anyone with you?' Gabriel (Peace Be Upon Him) replied, 'Yes, Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) is with me.' He asked, 'Has he been called?' Gabriel (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Yes.' So the gate was opened and we went over the nearest heaven and there we saw a man sitting with some people on his right and some on his left. When he looked towards his right, he laughed and when he looked toward his left he wept. Then he said, 'Welcome! O pious Prophet and pious son.' I asked Gabriel (Peace Be Upon Him), 'Who is he?' He replied, 'He is Adam (Peace Be Upon Him) and the people on his right and left are the souls of his offspring. Those on his right are the people of Paradise and those on his left are the people of Hell and when he looks towards his right he laughs and when he looks towards his left he weeps.' Then he ascended with me till he reached the second heaven and he (Gabriel (Peace Be Upon Him)) said to its gatekeeper, 'Open (the gate).' The gatekeeper said to him the same as the gatekeeper of the first heaven had said and he opened the gate. Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) said: "Abu Dhar (May Allah be pleased with him) added that the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) met Adam (Peace Be Upon Him), Idris (Peace Be Upon Him), Moses (Peace Be Upon Him), Jesus (Peace Be Upon Him) and Abraham (Peace Be Upon Him), he (Abu Dhar (May Allah be pleased with him)) did not mention on which heaven they were but he mentioned that he (the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)) met Adam (Peace Be Upon Him) on the nearest heaven and Abraham (Peace Be Upon Him) on the sixth heaven. Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "When Gabriel (Peace Be Upon Him) along with the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) passed by Idris (Peace Be Upon Him), the latter said, 'Welcome! O pious Prophet and pious brother.' The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) asked, 'Who is he?' Gabriel (Peace Be Upon Him) replied, 'He is Idris (Peace Be Upon Him)." The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) added, "I passed by Moses (Peace Be Upon Him) and he said, 'Welcome! O pious Prophet and pious brother.' I asked Gabriel (Peace Be Upon Him), 'Who is he?' Gabriel (Peace Be Upon Him) replied, 'He is Moses (Peace Be Upon Him).' Then I passed by Jesus (Peace Be Upon Him) and he said, 'Welcome! O pious brother and pious Prophet.' I asked, 'Who is he?' Gabriel (Peace Be Upon Him) replied, 'He is Jesus (Peace Be Upon Him). Then I passed by Abraham (Peace Be Upon Him) and he said, 'Welcome! O pious Prophet and pious son.' I asked Gabriel (Peace Be Upon Him), 'Who is he?' Gabriel (Peace Be Upon Him) replied, 'He is Abraham (Peace Be Upon Him). The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) added, 'Then Gabriel (Peace Be Upon Him) ascended with me to a place where I heard the creaking of the pens." Ibn Hazm and Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him) said: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Then Allah enjoined fifty prayers on my followers when I returned with this order of Allah, I passed by Moses (Peace Be Upon Him) who asked me, 'What has Allah enjoined on your followers?' I replied, 'He has enjoined fifty prayers on them.' Moses (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Go back to your Lord (and appeal for reduction) for your followers will not be able to bear it.' (So I went back to Allah and requested for reduction) and He reduced it to half. When I passed by Moses (Peace Be Upon Him) again and informed him about it, he said, 'Go back to your Lord as your followers will not be able to bear it.' So I returned to Allah and requested for further reduction and half of it was reduced. I again passed by Moses (Peace Be Upon Him) and he told me to go back once again. I replied, 'Now I feel shy of asking my Lord again.' Then Gabriel (Peace Be Upon Him) took me till we reached Sidrat-il-Muntaha (Lote tree of; the utmost boundry) which was shrouded in colors, indescribable. Then I was admitted into Paradise where I found small (tents or) walls (made) of pearls and its earth was of musk."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: the mother of believers: Allah enjoined the prayer when He enjoined it, it was two Rakat only (in every prayer) both when in residence or on a journey. Then the prayers offered on a journey remained the same, but (the Rakat of) the prayers for non-travellers were increased.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: We were ordered to bring out our menstruating women and veiled women in the religious gatherings and invocation of Muslims on the two 'Id festivals. These menstruating women were to keep away from their Musalla. A woman asked, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) ' What about one who does not have a veil?" He said, "Let her share the veil of her companion."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Once Jabir (May Allah be pleased with him) prayed with his Izar tied to his back while his clothes were lying beside him on a wooden peg. Somebody asked him, "Do you offer your prayer in a single Izar?" He replied, "I did so to show it to a fool like you. Had anyone of us two garments in the life-time of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)?"

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: I saw Jabir bin 'Abdullah (May Allah be pleased with him) praying in a single garment and he said that he had seen the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) praying in a single garment.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) prayed in one garment and crossed its ends.

hadiths.narrator: Umar bin Abi Salama (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I saw the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) offering prayers in a single garment in the house of Um-Salama (may Allah be pleased with her) and he had crossed its ends around his shoulders.

hadiths.narrator: Umar bin Abi Salama (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: In the house of Um-Salama (may Allah be pleased with her) I saw Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) offering prayers, wrapped in a single garment around his body with its ends crossed round his shoulders.

hadiths.narrator: Abu Murra (may Allah be pleased with him) (the freed slave of Um Hani)
hadiths.text: Um Hani (may Allah be pleased with her), the daughter of Abi Talib said, "I went to Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) in the year of the conquest of Mecca and found him taking a bath and his daughter Fatima (may Allah be pleased with her) was screening him. I greeted him. He asked, 'Who is she?' I replied, 'I am Um Hani bint Abi Talib.' He said, 'Welcome! O Um Hani.' When he finished his bath he stood up and prayed eight Rak'at while wearing a single garment wrapped round his body and when he finished I said, 'O Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him)! My brother has told me that he will kill a person whom I gave shelter and that person is so and so the son of Hubaira.' The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, 'We shelter the person whom you have sheltered.'" Um Hani added, "And that was before noon (Duha)."

hadiths.narrator: Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: A person asked Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) about the offering of the prayer in a single garment. Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) replied, "Has every one of you got two garments?"

hadiths.narrator: Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "None of you should offer prayer in a single garment that does not cover the shoulders."

hadiths.narrator: Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "Whoever prays in a single garment must cross its ends (over the shoulders)."

hadiths.narrator: Said bin Al-Harith (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I asked Jabir bin 'Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him) about praying in a single garment. He said, "I travelled with the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) during some of his journeys, and I came to him at night for some purpose and I found him praying. At that time, I was wearing a single garment with which I covered my shoulders and prayed by his side. When he finished the prayer, he asked, 'O Jabir! What has brought you here?' I told him what I wanted. When I finished, he asked, 'O Jabir! What is this garment which I have seen and with which you covered your shoulders?' I replied, 'It is a (tight) garment.' He said, 'If the garment is large enough, wrap it round the body (covering the shoulders) and if it is tight (too short) then use it as an Izar (tie it around your waist only).'"

hadiths.narrator: Sahl (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The men used to pray with the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) with their Izars tied around their necks as boys used to do; therefore the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) told the women not to raise their heads till the men sat down straight (while praying).

hadiths.narrator: Mughira bin Shu'ba (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Once I was traveling with the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) and he said, "O Mughira! take this container of water." I took it and Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) went far away till he disappeared. He answered the call of nature and was wearing a Syrian cloak. He tried to take out his hands from its sleeve but it was very tight so he took out his hands from under it. I poured water and he performed ablution like that for prayers and passed his wet hands over his Khuff (leather socks) and then prayed.

hadiths.narrator: Jabir bin 'Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: While Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) was carrying stones (along) with the people of Mecca for (the building of) the Ka'ba wearing an Izar (waist-sheet cover), his uncle Al-'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) said to him, "O my nephew! (It would be better) if you take off your Izar and put it over your shoulders underneath the stones." So he took off his Izar and put it over his shoulders, but he fell unconscious and since then he had never been seen naked.

hadiths.narrator: Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: A man stood up and asked the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) about praying in a single garment. The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "Has every one of you two garments?" A man put a similar question to 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) on which he replied, "When Allah makes you wealthier then you should clothe yourself properly during prayers. Otherwise one can pray with an Izar and a Rida' (a sheet covering the upper part of the body.) Izar and a shirt, Izar and a Qaba', trousers and a Rida, trousers and a shirt or trousers and a Qaba', Tubban and a Qaba' or Tubban and a shirt." (The narrator added, "I think that he also said a Tubban and a Rida.")

hadiths.narrator: Ibn 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: A person asked Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him), "What should a Muhrim wear?" He replied, "He should not wear shirts, trousers, a burnus (a hooded cloak), or clothes which are stained with saffron or Wars (a kind of perfume). Whoever does not find a sandal to wear can wear Khuffs, but these should be cut short so as not to cover the ankles."

hadiths.narrator: Abu Said Al-Khudri (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) forbade Ishtimal-As-Samma' (wrapping one's body with a garment so that one cannot raise its end or take one's hand out of it). He also forbade Al-Ihtiba' (sitting on buttocks with knees close to abdomen and feet apart with the hands circling the knees) while wrapping oneself with a single garment, without having a part of it over the private parts."

hadiths.narrator: Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) forbade two kinds of sales i.e. Al-Limais and An-Nibadh (the former is a kind of sale in which the deal is completed if the buyer touches a thing, without seeing or checking it properly and the latter is a kind of a sale in which the deal is completed when the seller throws a thing towards the buyer giving him no opportunity to see, touch or check it) and (the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) forbade) also Ishtimal-As-Samma' and Al-Ihtiba' in a single garment."

hadiths.narrator: Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: On the Day of Nahr (10th of Dhul-Hijja, in the year prior to the last Hajj of the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) when Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him) was the leader of the pilgrims in that Hajj) Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him) sent me along with other announcers to Mina to make a public announcement: "No pagan is allowed to perform Hajj after this year and no naked person is allowed to perform the Tawaf around the Ka'ba. Then Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) sent 'Ali (may Allah be pleased with him) to read out the Surat Bara'a (At-Tauba) to the people; so he made the announcement along with us on the day of Nahr in Mina: "No pagan is allowed to perform Hajj after this year and no naked person is allowed to perform the Tawaf around the Ka'ba."

hadiths.narrator: Muhammad bin Al-Munkadir (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I went to Jabir bin 'Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him) and he was praying wrapped in a garment and his Rida was lying beside him. When he finished the prayers, I said "O 'Abdullah! You pray (in a single garment) while your Rida' is lying beside you." He replied, "Yes, I did it intentionally so that the ignorant ones like you might see me. I saw the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) praying like this."

hadiths.narrator: Abdul 'Aziz (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) said, 'When Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) invaded Khaibar, we offered the Fajr prayer there yearly in the morning) when it was still dark. The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) rode and Abu Talha (may Allah be pleased with him) rode too and I was riding behind Abu Talha (may Allah be pleased with him). The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) passed through the lane of Khaibar quickly and my knee was touching the thigh of the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him). He uncovered his thigh and I saw the whiteness of the thigh of the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him). When he entered the town, he said, 'Allahu Akbar! Khaibar is ruined. Whenever we approach near a (hostile) nation (to fight) then evil will be the morning of those who have been warned.' He repeated this thrice. The people came out for their jobs and some of them said, 'Muhammad (Peace and blessings be upon him) (has come).' (Some of our companions added, "With his army.") We conquered Khaibar, took the captives, and the booty was collected. Dihya (may Allah be pleased with him) came and said, 'O Allah's Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him)! Give me a slave girl from the captives.' The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, 'Go and take any slave girl.' He took Safiya bint Huyai (may Allah be pleased with her). A man came to the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) and said, 'O Allah's Apostles (Peace and blessings be upon him)! You gave Safiya bint Huyai (may Allah be pleased with her) to Dihya (may Allah be pleased with him) and she is the chief mistress of the tribes of Quraiza and An-Nadir and she befits none but you.' So the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, 'Bring him along with her.' So Dihya (may Allah be pleased with him) came with her and when the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) saw her, he said to Dihya (may Allah be pleased with him), 'Take any slave girl other than her from the captives.' Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) added: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) then manumitted her and married her.' Thabit (may Allah be pleased with him) asked Anas (may Allah be pleased with him), "O Abu Hamza! What did the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) pay her (as Mahr)?" He said, "Her self was her Mahr for he manumitted her and then married her." Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) added, "While on the way, Um Sulaim (may Allah be pleased with her) dressed her for marriage (ceremony) and at night she sent her as a bride to the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him). So the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) was a bridegroom and he said, 'Whoever has anything (food) should bring it.' He spread out a leather sheet (for the food) and some brought dates and others cooking butter. (I think he (Anas) mentioned As-SawTq). So they prepared a dish of Hais (a kind of meal). And that was Walima (the marriage banquet) of Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him)."

hadiths.narrator: Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) used to offer the Fajr prayer and some believing women covered with their veiling sheets used to attend the Fajr prayer with him and then they would return to their homes unrecognized.

hadiths.narrator: Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) prayed in a Khamisa (a square garment) having marks. During the prayer, he looked at its marks. So when he finished the prayer he said, "Take this Khamisa of mine to Abu Jahm (may Allah be pleased with him) and get me his Inbijaniya (a woolen garment without marks) as it (the Khamisa) has diverted my attention from the prayer."

hadiths.narrator: Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, 'I was looking at its (Khamisa's) marks during the prayers and I was afraid that it may put me in trial (by taking away my attention).'

hadiths.narrator: Anas (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: 'Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her) had a Qiram (a thin marked woolen curtain) with which he had screened one side of her home. The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "Take away this Qiram of yours, as its pictures are still displayed in front of me during my prayer (i.e. they divert my attention from the prayer)."

hadiths.narrator: Uqba bin 'Amir (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) was given a silken Farruj as a present. He wore it while praying. When he had finished his prayer, he took it off violently as if with a strong aversion to it and said, "It is not the dress of Allah-fearing pious people."

hadiths.narrator: Abu Juhaifa (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I saw Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) in a red leather tent and I saw Bilal (may Allah be pleased with him) taking the remaining water with which the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) had performed ablution. I saw the people taking the utilized water impatiently and whoever got some of it rubbed it on his body and those who could not get any took the moisture from the others' hands. Then I saw Bilal (may Allah be pleased with him) carrying an 'Anza (a spear-headed stick) which he planted in the ground. The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) came out tucking up his red cloak, and led the people in prayer and offered two Rakat (facing the Ka'ba) taking 'Anza as a Sutra for his prayer. I saw the people and animals passing in front of him beyond the 'Anza.

hadiths.narrator: Abu Hazim (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Sahl bin Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him) was asked about the (Prophet's (Peace and blessings be upon him)) pulpit as to what thing it was made of? Sahl (may Allah be pleased with him) replied: "None remains alive amongst the people, who knows about it better than I. It was made of tamarisk (wood) of the forest. So and so, the slave of so and so prepared it for Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him). When it was constructed and place (in the Mosque), Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) stood on it facing the Qibla and said 'Allahu Akbar', and the people stood behind him (and led the people in prayer). He recited and bowed and the people bowed behind him. Then he raised his head and stepped back, got down and prostrated on the ground and then he again ascended the pulpit, recited, bowed, raised his head and stepped back, got down and prostrate on the ground. So, this is what I know about the pulpit." Ahmad bin Hanbal (may Allah be pleased with him) said, "As the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) was at a higher level than the people, there is no harm according to the above-mentioned Hadith if the Imam is at a higher level than his followers during the prayers."

hadiths.narrator: Anas bin Malik (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Once Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) fell off a horse and his leg or shoulder got injured. He swore that he would not go to his wives for one month and he stayed in a Mashruba (attic room) having stairs made of date palm trunks. So his companions came to visit him, and he led them in prayer sitting, whereas his companions were standing. When he finished the prayer, he said, "Imam is meant to be followed, so when he says 'Allahu Akbar,' say 'Allahu Akbar' and when he bows, bow and when he prostrates, prostrate and if he prays standing pray, standing. After the 29th day the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) came down (from the attic room) and the people asked him, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him)! You swore that you will not go to your wives for one month." He said, "The month is 29 days."

hadiths.narrator: Abdullah bin Shaddad (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Maimuna (may Allah be pleased with her) said, "Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) was praying while I was in my menses, sitting beside him and sometimes his clothes would touch me during his prostration." Maimuna (may Allah be pleased with her) added, "He prayed on a Khumra (a small mat sufficient just for the face and the hands while prostrating during prayers)."

hadiths.narrator: Ishaq (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Anas bin Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) said, "My grand-mother Mulaika (may Allah be pleased with her) invited Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) for a meal which she herself had prepared. He ate from it and said, 'Get up! I will lead you in the prayer.'" Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) added, "I took my Hasir, washed it with water as it had become dark because of long use and Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) stood on it. The orphan (Damira or Ruh) and I aligned behind him and the old lady (Mulaika) (may Allah be pleased with her) stood behind us. Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) led us in the prayer and offered two Rak'at and then left."

hadiths.narrator: Maimuna (may Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) used to pray on Khumra.

hadiths.narrator: Abu Salama (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: 'Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her) the wife of the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "I used to sleep in front of Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) and my legs were opposite his Qibla and in prostration he pushed my legs and I withdrew then and when he stood, I stretched them.' 'Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her) added, "In those days the houses were without lights."

hadiths.narrator: Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: Allah Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) prayed while I was lying like a dead body on his family bed between him and his Qibla.

hadiths.narrator: Urwa (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) prayed while 'Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her) was lying between him and his Qibla on the bed on which they used to sleep.

hadiths.narrator: Anas bin Malik (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: We used to pray with the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) and some of us used to place the ends of their clothes at the place of prostration because of scorching heat.

hadiths.narrator: Abu Maslama (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Said bin Yazid Al-Azdi: I asked Anas bin Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) whether the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) had ever prayed with his shoes on. He replied "Yes."

hadiths.narrator: Ibrahim (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Hammam bin Al-Harith (may Allah be pleased with him) said, "I saw Jarir bin 'Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him) urinating. Then he performed ablution and passed his (wet) hands over his Khuffs, stood up and prayed. He was asked about it. He replied that he had seen the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) doing the same." They approved of this narration as Jarir (may Allah be pleased with him) was one of those who embraced Islam very late.

hadiths.narrator: Al-Mughira bin Shu'ba (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I helped the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) in performing ablution and he passed his wet hands over his Khuffs and prayed.

hadiths.narrator: Abdullah bin Malik (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Ibn Buhaina (may Allah be pleased with him), "When the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) prayed, he used to separate his arms from his body so widely that the whiteness of his armpits was visible."

hadiths.narrator: Anas (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "Whoever prays like us and faces our Qibla and eats our slaughtered animals is a Muslim and is under Allah's and His Apostle's (Peace and blessings be upon him) protection. So do not betray Allah by betraying those who are in His protection."

hadiths.narrator: Anas (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "I have been ordered to fight the people till they say: 'None has the right to be worshipped but Allah.' And if they say so, pray like our prayers, face our Qibla and slaughter as we slaughter, then their blood and property will be sacred to us and we will not interfere with them except legally and their reckoning will be with Allah." Narrated Maimun ibn Siyah (may Allah be pleased with him) that he asked Anas bin Malik (may Allah be pleased with him), "O Abu Hamza! What makes the life and property of a person sacred?" He replied, "Whoever says, 'None has the right to be worshipped but Allah', faces our Qibla during the prayers, prays like us and eats our slaughtered animal, then he is a Muslim, and has got the same rights and obligations as other Muslims have."

hadiths.narrator: Abu Aiyub Al-Ansari (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "While defecating, neither face nor turn your back to the Qibla but face either east or west." Abu Aiyub (may Allah be pleased with him) added. "When we arrived in Sham we came across some lavatories facing the Qibla; therefore we turned ourselves while using them and asked for Allah's forgiveness."

hadiths.narrator: Amr bin Dmar (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I asked Ibn 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him), "Can a person who has performed the Tawaf around the Ka'ba for 'Umra but has not performed the (Sa'i) Tawaf of Safa and Marwa, have a sexual relation with his wife?" Ibn 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) replied "When the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) reached Mecca he performed the Tawaf around the Ka'ba (circumambulated it seven times) and offered a two-Rak'at prayer (at the place) behind the station (of Abraham) and then performed the Tawaf (Sa'i) of Safa and Marwa, and verily in Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) you have a good example." Then we put the same question to Jabir bin 'Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him) and he too replied, "He should not go near his wife (for sexual relation) till he has finished the Tawaf of Safa and Marwa."

hadiths.narrator: Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: When the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) entered the Ka'ba, he invoked Allah in each and every side of it and did not pray till he came out of it, and offered a two-Rak'at prayer facing the Ka'ba and said, "This is the Qibla."

hadiths.narrator: Bara' bin 'Azib (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) prayed facing Baitul-Maqdis for sixteen or seventeen months but he loved to face the Ka'ba (at Mecca) so Allah revealed: "Verily, We have seen the turning of your face to the heaven!" (2:144) So the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) faced the Ka'ba and the fools amongst the people namely "the Jews" said, "What has turned them from their Qibla (Bait-ul-Maqdis) which they formerly observed"" (Allah revealed): "Say: 'To Allah belongs the East and the West. He guides whom he will to a straight path'." (2:142) A man prayed with the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) (facing the Ka'ba) and went out. He saw some of the Ansar praying the 'Asr prayer with their faces towards Bait-ul-Maqdis, he said, "I bear witness that I prayed with Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) facing the Ka'ba." So all the people turned their faces towards the Ka'ba.

hadiths.narrator: Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) used to pray (optional, non-obligatory prayer) while riding on his mount (Rahila) wherever it turned, and whenever he wanted to pray the compulsory prayer he dismounted and prayed facing the Qibla.

hadiths.narrator: Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) prayed (and the subnarrator Ibrahim (may Allah be pleased with him) said, "I do not know whether he prayed more or less than usual"), and when he had finished the prayers he was asked, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him)! Has there been any change in the prayers?" He said, "What is it?' The people said, "You have prayed so much and so much." So the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) bent his legs, faced the Qibla and performed two prostrations (of Sahu) and finished his prayers with Tasiim (by turning his face to right and left saying: 'As-Salamu'Alaikum-Warahmat-ullah'). When he turned his face to us he said, "If there had been anything changed in the prayer, surely I would have informed you but I am a human being like you and liable to forget like you. So if I forget remind me and if anyone of you is doubtful about his prayer, he should follow what he thinks to be correct and complete his prayer accordingly and finish it and do two prostrations (of Sahu)."

hadiths.narrator: Umar (bin Al-Khattab) (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: My Lord agreed with me in three things: 1. I said,"O Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him), I wish we took the station of Abraham as our praying place (for some of our prayers). So came the Divine Inspiration: And take you (people) the station of Abraham as a place of prayer (for some of your prayers e.g. two Rakat of Tawaf of Ka'ba)". (2.125) 2. And as regards the (verse of) the veiling of the women, I said, 'O Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him)! I wish you ordered your wives to cover themselves from the men because good and bad ones talk to them.' So the verse of the veiling of the women was revealed. 3. Once the wives of the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) made a united front against the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) and I said to them, 'It may be if he (the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him)) divorced you, (all) that his Lord (Allah) will give him instead of you wives better than you.' So this verse (the same as I had said) was revealed." (66.5).

hadiths.narrator: Ibn 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: A person asked Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him), "What should a Muhrim wear?" He replied, "He should not wear shirts, trousers, a burnus (a hooded cloak), or clothes which are stained with saffron or Wars (a kind of perfume). Whoever does not find a sandal to wear can wear Khuffs, but these should be cut short so as not to cover the ankles."

hadiths.narrator: Abu Aiyub Al-Ansari (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "While defecating, neither face nor turn your back to the Qibla but face either east or west." Abu Aiyub (may Allah be pleased with him) added, "When we arrived in Sham we came across some lavatories facing the Qibla; therefore we turned ourselves while using them and asked for Allah's forgiveness."

hadiths.narrator: Amr bin Dmar (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I asked Ibn 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him), "Can a person who has performed the Tawaf around the Ka'ba for 'Umra but has not performed the (Sa'i) Tawaf of Safa and Marwa, have a sexual relation with his wife?" Ibn 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) replied "When the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) reached Mecca he performed the Tawaf around the Ka'ba (circumambulated it seven times) and offered a two-Rak'at prayer (at the place) behind the station (of Abraham) and then performed the Tawaf (Sa'i) of Safa and Marwa, and verily in Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) you have a good example." Then we put the same question to Jabir bin 'Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him) and he too replied, "He should not go near his wife (for sexual relation) till he has finished the Tawaf of Safa and Marwa."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) saw some sputum in the direction of the Qibla (on the wall of the mosque) and he disliked that and the sign of disgust was apparent from his face. So he got up and scraped it off with his hand and said, "Whenever anyone of you stands for the prayer, he is speaking in private to his Lord or his Lord is between him and his Qibla. So, none of you should spit in the direction of the Qibla but one can spit to the left or under his foot." The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) then took the corner of his sheet and spat in it and folded it and said, "Or you can do like this."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) saw sputum on the wall of the mosque in the direction of the Qibla and scraped it off. He faced the people and said, "Whenever any one of you is praying, he should not spit in front of him because in the prayer Allah is in front of him."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: (the mother of faithful believers) Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) saw some nasal secretions, expectoration or sputum on the wall of the mosque in the direction of the Qibla and scraped it off.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with them
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) saw some expectoration on the wall of the mosque; he took gravel and scraped it off and said, "If anyone of you wanted to spit he should neither spit in front of him nor on his right but he could spit either on his left or under his left foot."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with them
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) saw some expectoration on the wall of the mosque; he took gravel and scraped it off and said, "If anyone of you wanted to spit, he should neither spit in front of him nor on his right but could spit either on his left or under his left foot."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "None of you should spit in front or on his right but he could spit either on his left or under his foot."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "A faithful believer while in prayer is speaking in private to his Lord, so he should neither spit in front of him nor to his right side but he could spit either on his left or under his foot."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) saw sputum on (the wall of) the mosque in the direction of the Qibla and scraped it off with gravel. Then he forbade spitting in front or on the right, but allowed it on one's left or under one's left foot.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "Spitting in the mosque is a sin and its expiation is to bury it."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "If anyone of you stands for prayer, he should not spit in front of him because in prayer he is speaking in private to Allah and he should not spit on his right as there is an angel, but he can spit either on his left or under his left foot and bury it (i.e. expectoration)."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) saw expectoration (on the wall of the mosque) in the direction of the Qibla and scraped it off with his hand. It seemed that he disliked it and the sign of disgust was apparent from his face. He said, "If anyone of you stands for the prayer, he is speaking in private to his Lord, (or) his Lord is between him and his Qibla, therefore he should not spit towards his Qibla, but he could spit either on his left or under his foot." Then he took the corner of his sheet and spat in it, folded it and said, "Or do like this."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "Do you consider or see that my face is towards the Qibla? By Allah, neither your submissiveness nor your bowing is hidden from me; surely I see you from my back."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) led us in a prayer and then got up on the pulpit and said, "In your prayer and bowing, I certainly see you from my back as I see you (while looking at you)."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) ordered for a horse race; the trained horses were to run from a place called Al-Hafya' to Thaniyat Al-Wada' and the horses which were not trained were to run from Al-Thaniya to the Masjid (mosque of) Bani Zuraiq. The sub narrator added: Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) was one of those who took part in the race.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Some goods came to Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) from Bahrain. The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) ordered the people to spread them in the mosque -- it was the biggest amount of goods Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) had ever received. He left for prayer and did not even look at it. After finishing the prayer, he sat by those goods and gave from those to everybody he saw. Al-Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) came to him and said, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him)! give me (something) too, because I gave ransom for myself and 'Aqil." Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) told him to take. So he stuffed his garment with it and tried to carry it away but he failed to do so. He said, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him)! Order someone to help me in lifting it." The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) refused. He then said to the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him): "Will you please help me to lift it?" Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) refused. Then Al-Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) threw some of it and tried to lift it (but failed). He again said, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him)! Order someone to help me to lift it." He refused. Al-Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) then said to the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him): "Will you please help me to lift it?" He again refused. Then Al-Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) threw some of it, and lifted it on his shoulders and went away. Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) kept on watching him till he disappeared from his sight and was astonished at his greediness. Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) did not get up till the last coin was distributed.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: I found the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) in the mosque along with some people. He said to me, "Did Abu Talha (may Allah be pleased with him) send you?" I said, "Yes." He said, "For a meal?" I said, "Yes." Then he said to his companions, "Get up." They set out and I was ahead of them.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: A man said, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him)! If a man finds another man with his wife, (committing adultery) should the husband kill him?" Later on I saw them (the man and his wife) doing Lian in the mosque.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) came to my house and said, "Where do you like me to pray?" I pointed to a place. The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) then said, "Allahu Akbar", and we aligned behind him and he offered a two-Rak'at prayer.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: who was one of the companions of Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) and one of the Ansar's who took part in the battle of Badr: I came to Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) and said, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) I have weak eyesight and I lead my people in prayers. When it rains the water flows in the valley between me and my people so I cannot go to their mosque to lead them in prayer. O Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him)! I wish you would come to my house and pray in it so that I could take that place as a Musalla. Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) said. "Allah willing, I will do so." Next day after the sun rose high, Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) and Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him) came and Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) asked for permission to enter. I gave him permission and he did not sit on entering the house but said to me, "Where do you like me to pray?" I pointed to a place in my house. So Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) stood there and said, 'Allahu Akbar', and we all got up and aligned behind him and offered a two-Rak'at prayer and ended it with Taslim. We requested him to stay for a meal called "Khazira" which we had prepared for him. Many members of our family gathered in the house and one of them said, "Where is Malik bin Al-Dukhaishin or Ibn Al-Dukhshun?" One of them replied, "He is a hypocrite and does not love Allah and His Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him)." Hearing that, Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "Do not say so. Haven't you seen that he said, 'None has the right to be worshipped but Allah' for Allah's sake only?" He said, "Allah and His Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) know better. We have seen him helping and advising hypocrites." Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "Allah has forbidden the (Hell) fire for those who say, 'None has the right to be worshipped but Allah' for Allah's sake only."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) used to start everything from the right (for good things) whenever it was possible in all his affairs; for example: in washing, combing or wearing shoes.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: Um Habiba (may Allah be pleased with her) and Um Salama (may Allah be pleased with her) mentioned about a church they had seen in Ethiopia in which there were pictures. They told the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) about it, on which he said, "If any religious man dies amongst those people they would build a place of worship at his grave and make these pictures in it. They will be the worst creature in the sight of Allah on the Day of Resurrection."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: When the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) arrived in Medina, he dismounted at 'Awali-i-Medina amongst a tribe called Banu 'Amr bin 'Auf. He stayed there for fourteen nights. Then he sent for Bani An-Najjar and they came armed with their swords. As if I am looking (just now) as the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) was sitting over his Rahila (Mount) with Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him) riding behind him and all Banu An-Najjar around him till he dismounted at the courtyard of Abu Aiyub's (may Allah be pleased with him) house. The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) loved to pray wherever the time for the prayer was due even at sheep-folds. Later on he ordered that a mosque should be built and sent for some people of Banu-An-Najjar and said, "O Banu An-Najjar! Suggest to me the price of this (walled) piece of land of yours." They replied, "No! By Allah! We do not demand its price except from Allah." Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) added: There were graves of pagans in it and some of it was unleveled and there were some date-palm trees in it. The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) ordered that the graves of the pagans be dug out and the unleveled land be leveled and the date-palm trees be cut down. (So all that was done). They aligned these cut date-palm trees towards the Qibla of the mosque (as a wall) and they also built two stone side-walls (of the mosque). His companions brought the stones while reciting some poetic verses. The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) was with them and he kept on saying, "There is no goodness except that of the Hereafter, O Allah! So please forgive the Ansars and the emigrants."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) said, "The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) prayed in the sheep fold." Later on I heard him saying, "He prayed in the sheep folds before the construction of the mosque."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: "I saw Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) praying while taking his camel as a Sutra in front of him and he said, "I saw the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) doing the same."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The sun eclipsed and Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) offered the eclipse prayer and said, "I have been shown the Hellfire (now) and I never saw a worse and horrible sight than the sight I have seen today."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) had said, "Offer some of your prayers (Nawafil) at home, and do not take your houses as graves."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "Do not enter (the places) of these people where Allah's punishment had fallen unless you do so weeping. If you do not weep, do not enter (the places of these people) because Allah's curse and punishment which fell upon them may fall upon you."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: Um Salama (may Allah be pleased with her) told Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) about a church which she had seen in Ethiopia and which was called Mariya. She told him about the pictures which she had seen in it. Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "If any righteous pious man dies amongst them, they would build a place of worship at his grave and make these pictures in it; they are the worst creatures in the sight of Allah."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with them
hadiths.text: When the last moment of the life of Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) came, he started putting his 'Khamisa' on his face and when he felt hot and short of breath he took it off his face and said, "May Allah curse the Jews and Christians for they built the places of worship at the graves of their Prophets." The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) was warning (Muslims) of what those had done.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "May Allah's curse be on the Jews for they built the places of worship at the graves of their Prophets."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "I have been given five things which were not given to any amongst the Prophets before me. These are: 1. Allah made me victorious by awe (by His frightening my enemies) for a distance of one month's journey. 2. The earth has been made for me (and for my followers) a place for praying and a thing to perform Tayammum. Therefore my followers can pray wherever the time of a prayer is due. 3. The booty has been made Halal (lawful) for me (and was not made so for anyone else). 4. Every Prophet used to be sent to his nation exclusively but I have been sent to all mankind. 5. I have been given the right of intercession (on the Day of Resurrection)."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: There was a black slave girl belonging to an 'Arab tribe and they manumitted her but she remained with them. The slave girl said, "Once one of their girls (of that tribe) came out wearing a red leather scarf decorated with precious stones. It fell from her or she placed it somewhere. A kite passed by that place, saw it lying there and mistaking it for a piece of meat, flew away with it. Those people searched for it but they did not find it. So they accused me of stealing it and started searching me and even searched my private parts." The slave girl further said, "By Allah! while I was standing (in that state) with those people, the same kite passed by them and dropped the red scarf and it fell amongst them. I told them, 'This is what you accused me of and I was innocent and now this is it.'" 'Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her) added: That slave girl came to Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) and embraced Islam. She had a tent or a small room with a low roof in the mosque. Whenever she called on me, she had a talk with me and whenever she sat with me, she would recite the following: "The day of the scarf (band) was one of the wonders of our Lord, verily He rescued me from the disbelievers' town. 'Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her) added: "Once I asked her, 'What is the matter with you? Whenever you sit with me, you always recite these poetic verses.' On that she told me the whole story."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) said: I used to sleep in the mosque of the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) while I was young and unmarried.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) went to Fatima's (may Allah be pleased with her) house but did not find 'Ali (may Allah be pleased with him) there. So he asked, "Where is your cousin?" She replied, "There was something between us and he got angry with me and went out. He did not sleep (mid-day nap) in the house." Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) asked a person to look for him. That person came and said, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him)! He (Ali) is sleeping in the mosque." Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) went there and 'Ali (may Allah be pleased with him) was lying. His upper body cover had fallen down to one side of his body and he was covered with dust. Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) started cleaning the dust from him saying: "Get up! O Aba Turab. Get up! O Aba Turab (literally means: O father of dust)."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: I saw seventy of As-Suffa men and none of them had a Rida' (a garment covering the upper part of the body). They had either Izars (only) or sheets which they tied round their necks. Some of these sheets reached the middle of their legs and some reached their heels and they used to gather them with their hands lest their private parts should become naked.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: I went to the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) in the mosque (the sub-narrator Mas'ar thought that Jabir had said, "In the forenoon.") He ordered me to pray two Rakat. He owed me some money and he repaid it to me and gave more than what was due to me.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "If anyone of you enters a mosque, he should pray two Rakat before sitting."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: In the life-time of Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) the mosque was built of adobes, its roof of the leaves of date-palms and its pillars of the stems of date-palms. Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him) did not alter it. Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) expanded it on the same pattern as it was in the lifetime of Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) by using adobes, leaves of date-palms and changing the pillars into wooden ones. Uthman (may Allah be pleased with him) changed it by expanding it to a great extent and built its walls with engraved stones and lime and made its pillars of engraved stones and its roof of teak wood.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: In the life-time of Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) the mosque was built of adobes, its roof of the leaves of date-palms and its pillars of the stems of date-palms. Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him) did not alter it. Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) expanded it on the same pattern as it was in the lifetime of Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) by using adobes, leaves of date-palms and changing the pillars into wooden ones. Uthman (may Allah be pleased with him) changed it by expanding it to a great extent and built its walls with engraved stones and lime and made its pillars of engraved stones and its roof of teak wood.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) said to me and to his son 'Ali (may Allah be pleased with him), "Go to Abu Sa'id (may Allah be pleased with him) and listen to what he narrates." So we went and found him in a garden looking after it. He picked up his Rida', wore it and sat down and started narrating till the topic of the construction of the mosque reached. He said, "We were carrying one adobe at a time while 'Ammar (may Allah be pleased with him) was carrying two. The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) saw him and started removing the dust from his body and said, "May Allah be Merciful to 'Ammar (may Allah be pleased with him). He will be inviting them (i.e. his murderers, the rebellious group) to Paradise and they will invite him to Hell-fire." 'Ammar (may Allah be pleased with him) said, "I seek refuge with Allah from affliction."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) sent someone to a woman telling her to "Order her slave, carpenter, to prepare a wooden pulpit for him to sit on."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: A woman said, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him)! Shall I get something constructed for you to sit on as I have a slave who is a carpenter?" He replied, "Yes, if you like." So she had that pulpit constructed.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: I heard Uthman bin Affan (may Allah be pleased with him) saying, when people argued too much about his intention to reconstruct the mosque of Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him), "You have talked too much. I heard the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) saying, 'Whoever built a mosque, (Bukair thought that 'Asim, another subnarrator, added, "Intending Allah's Pleasure"), Allah would build for him a similar place in Paradise.'"

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: I heard Jabir bin Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him) saying, "A man passed through the mosque carrying arrows. Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) said to him, 'Hold them by their heads.'"

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: (on the authority of his father) The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "Whoever passes through our mosques or markets with arrows should hold them by their heads lest he should injure a Muslim."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: I asked Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) "By Allah! Tell me the truth whether you heard the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) saying, 'O Hassan (may Allah be pleased with him)! Reply on behalf of Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him). O Allah! Help him with the Holy Spirit." Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) said, "Yes."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: Once I saw Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) at the door of my house while some Ethiopians were playing in the mosque (displaying their skill with spears). Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) was screening me with his Rida' so as to enable me to see their display. ('Urwa said that 'Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her) said, "I saw the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) and the Ethiopians were playing with their spears.")

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: Barira (may Allah be pleased with her) came to seek my help regarding her manumission. I told herself you like I would pay your price to your masters but your Al-Wala(1) would be for me." Her masters said, "If you like, you can pay what remains (of the price of her manumission), (Sufyan the sub-narrator once said), or if you like you can manumit her, but her (inheritance) Al-Wala would be for us. "When Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) came, I spoke to him about it. He said, "Buy her and manumit her. No doubt Al-Wala(1) is for the manumitted." Then Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) stood on the pulpit (or Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) ascended the pulpit as Sufyan once said), and said, "What about some people who impose conditions which are not present in Allah's Book (Laws)? Whoever imposes conditions which are not in Allah's Book (Laws), his conditions will be invalid even if he imposed them a hundred times."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: In the mosque I asked Ibn Abi Hadrad (may Allah be pleased with him) to pay the debts which he owed to me and our voices grew louder. Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) heard that while he was in his house. So he came to us raising the curtain of his room and said, "O Ka'b (may Allah be pleased with him)!" I replied, "Labaik, O Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him)!" He said, "O Ka'b (may Allah be pleased with him)! reduce your debt to one half," gesturing with his hand. I said, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him)! I have done so." Then Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) said (to Ibn Abi Hadrad (may Allah be pleased with him)), "Get up and pay the debt to him."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: A black man or a black woman used to sweep the mosque and he or she died. The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) asked about her (or him). He was told that she (or he) had died. He said, "Why did you not inform me? Show me his grave (or her grave)." So he went to her (his) grave and offered her (his) funeral prayer.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: When the verses of Surat "Al-Baqara" about the usury Riba were revealed, the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) went to the mosque and recited them in front of the people and then banned the trade of alcohol.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) said, "A man or a woman used to clean the mosque." (A sub-narrator said, 'Most probably a woman..') Then he narrated the Hadith of the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him).

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) sent some horsemen to Najd and they brought a man called Thumama bin Uthal from Bani Hanifa. They fastened him to one of the pillars of the mosque. The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) came and ordered them to release him. He went to a (garden of) date-palms near the mosque, took a bath and entered the mosque again and said, "None has the right to be worshipped but Allah and Muhammad is His Apostle (i.e. he embraced Islam)."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: On the day of Al-Khandaq (battle of the Trench) the medial arm vein of Sa'd bin Mu'ad (may Allah be pleased with him) was injured and the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) pitched a tent in the mosque to look after him. There was another tent for Banu Ghaffar in the mosque and the blood started flowing from Sa'd's tent to the tent of Bani Ghaffar. They shouted, "O occupants of the tent! What is coming from you to us?" They found that Sa'd's wound was bleeding profusely and Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him) died in his tent.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: I complained to Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) that I was sick. He told me to perform the Tawaf behind the people while riding. So I did so and Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) was praying beside the Ka'ba and reciting the Sura starting with "Wat-tur-wa-Kitabinmastur."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Two of the companions of the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) departed from him on a dark night and were led by two lights like lamps (going in front of them from Allah as a miracle) lighting the way in front of them, and when they parted, each of them was accompanied by one of these lights till he reached their (respective) houses.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) delivered a sermon and said, "Allah gave a choice to one of (His) slaves either to choose this world or what is with Him in the Hereafter. He chose the latter." Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him) wept. I said to myself, "Why is this Sheikh weeping, if Allah gave choice to one (of His) slaves either to choose this world or what is with Him in the Hereafter and he chose the latter?" And that slave was Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) himself. Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him) knew more than us. The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "O Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him)! Don't weep. The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) added: Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him) has favored me much with his property and company. If I were to take a Khalil from mankind I would certainly have taken Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him) but the Islamic brotherhood and friendship is sufficient. Close all the gates in the mosque except that of Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him)."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: "Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) in his fatal illness came out with a piece of cloth tied round his head and sat on the pulpit. After thanking and praising Allah he said, "There is no one who had done more favor to me with life and property than Abu Bakr bin Abi Quhafa (may Allah be pleased with him). If I were to take a Khalil, I would certainly have taken Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him) but the Islamic brotherhood is superior. Close all the small doors in this mosque except that of Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him)."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) said, "The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) arrived at Mecca and sent for Uthman bin Talha (may Allah be pleased with him). He opened the gate of the Ka'ba and the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him), Bilal (may Allah be pleased with him), Usama bin Zaid (may Allah be pleased with him) and Uthman bin Talha (may Allah be pleased with him) entered the Ka'ba and then they closed its door (from inside). They stayed there for an hour, and then came out." Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) added, "I quickly went to Bilal (may Allah be pleased with him) and asked him (whether the Prophet had prayed). Bilal (may Allah be pleased with him) replied, 'He prayed in it.' I asked, 'Where?' He replied, 'Between the two pillars.' "Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) added, "I forgot to ask how many Rakat he (the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him)) had prayed in the Ka'ba."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) sent some horsemen to Najd and they brought a man called Thumama bin Uthal from Bani Hanifa. They fastened him to one of the pillars of the mosque.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: I was standing in the mosque and somebody threw a gravel at me. I looked and found that he was Umar bin Al-Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him). He said to me, "Fetch those two men to me." When I did, he said to them, "Who are you? (Or) where do you come from?" They replied, "We are from Ta'if." Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) said, "Were you from this city (Medina) I would have punished you for raising your voices in the mosque of Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him)."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: During the life-time of Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) I asked Ibn Abi Hadrad in the mosque to pay the debts which he owed to me and our voices grew so loud that Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) heard them while he was in his house. So he came to us after raising the curtain of his room. The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "O Ka'b bin Malik (may Allah be pleased with him)!" I replied, "Labaik, O Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him)." He gestured with his hand to me to reduce the debt to one half. I said, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) have done it." Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) said (to Ibn Hadrad), "Get up and pay it."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) said, "While the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) was on the pulpit, a man asked him how to offer the night prayers. He replied, 'Pray two Rakat at a time and then two and then two and so on, and if you are afraid of the dawn (the approach of the time of the Fajr prayer) pray one Rak'a and that will be the witr for all the Rakat which you have offered." Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) said, "The last Rakat of the night prayer should be odd for the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) ordered it to be so."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: A man came to the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) while he was delivering the sermon and asked him how to offer the night prayers. The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) replied, 'Pray two Rakat at a time and then two and then two and so on and if you are afraid of dawn (the approach of the time of the Fajr prayer) pray one Rak'a and that will be the witr for all the Rakat which you have prayed." Narrated Ubaidullah bin Abdullah bin Umar (may Allah be pleased with him): A man called the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) while he was in the mosque.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: While Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) was sitting in the mosque (with some people) three men came, two of them came in front of Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) and the third one went away, and then one of them found a place in the circle and sat there while the second man sat behind the gathering, and the third one went away. When Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) finished his preaching, he said, "Shall I tell you about these three persons? One of them betook himself to Allah and so Allah accepted him and accommodated him; the second felt shy before Allah so Allah did the same for him and sheltered him in His Mercy (and did not punish him), while the third turned his face from Allah, and went away, so Allah turned His face from him likewise."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: That his uncle said, "I saw Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) lying flat (on his back) in the mosque with one leg on the other." Narrated Said bin Al-Musaiyab that Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) and Uthman (may Allah be pleased with him) used to do the same.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: (the wife of the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him)) I had seen my parents following Islam since I attained the age of puberty. Not a day passed but the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) visited us, both in the mornings and evenings. My father Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him) thought of building a mosque in the courtyard of his house and he did so. He used to pray and recite the Qur'an in it. The pagan women and their children used to stand by him and look at him with surprise. Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him) was a soft-hearted person and could not help weeping while reciting Qur'an. The chiefs of the Quraish pagans became afraid of that (i.e. that their children and women might be affected by the recitation of the Qur'an).

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "The prayer offered in congregation is twenty-five times more superior (in reward) to the prayer offered alone in one's house or in a business center, because if one performs ablution and does it perfectly, and then proceeds to the mosque with the sole intention of praying, then for each step which he takes towards the mosque, Allah upgrades him a degree in reward and (forgives) crosses out one sin till he enters the mosque. When he enters the mosque he is considered in prayer as long as he is waiting for the prayer and the angels keep on asking for Allah's forgiveness for him and they keep on saying: 'O Allah! Be Merciful to him, O Allah! Forgive him, as long as he keeps on sitting at his praying place and does not pass wind. (See Hadith No. 620)."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with them
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) clasped his hands, by interlacing his fingers. Narrated Abdullah that Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "O Abdullah bin Amr (may Allah be pleased with him)! What will be your condition when you will be left with the sediments of (worst) people?" (They will be in conflict with each other).

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, "A faithful believer to a faithful believer is like the bricks of a wall, enforcing each other." While (saying that) the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) clasped his hands, by interlacing his fingers.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Musa bin Uqba (may Allah be pleased with him) said, "I saw Salim bin Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him) looking for some places on the way and prayed there. He narrated that his father used to pray there, and had seen the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) praying at those very places."
