Narrated Nafi' (may Allah be pleased with him) on the authority of Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) who said, "I used to pray at those places." Musa the narrator added, "I asked Salim on which he said, 'I agree with Nafi' (may Allah be pleased with him) concerning those places, except the mosque situated at the place called Sharaf Ar-Rawha.'"

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Once I came riding a she-ass when I had just attained the age of puberty. Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) was offering the prayer at Mina with no wall in front of him and I passed in front of some of the row. There I dismounted and let my she-ass loose to graze and entered the row and nobody objected to me about it.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Whenever Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) came out on 'Id day, he used to order that a Harba (a short spear) to be planted in front of him (as a Sutra for his prayer) and then he used to pray facing it with the people behind him and used to do the same while on a journey. After the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him), this practice was adopted by the Muslim rulers (who followed his traditions).

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: I heard my father saying, "The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) led us, and prayed a two-Rak'at Zuhr prayer and then a two-Rak'at 'Asr prayer at Al-Batha' with an 'Anza (planted) in front of him (as a Sutra) while women and donkeys were passing in front of him (beyond that 'Anza)."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The distance between the Musalla of Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) and the wall was just sufficient for a sheep to pass through.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The distance between the wall of the mosque and the pulpit was hardly enough for a sheep to pass through.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) used to get a Harba planted in front of him (as a Sutra) and pray behind it.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: That he had heard his father saying, "Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) came to us at mid-day and water was brought for his ablution. He performed ablution and led us in Zuhr and 'Asr prayers with an 'Anza planted in front of him (as a Sutra), while women and donkeys were passing beyond it."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Whenever the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) went for answering the call of nature, I and another boy used to go after him with a staff, a stick or an 'Anza and a tumbler of water, and when he finished from answering the call of nature we would hand that tumbler of water to him.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) came out at midday and offered a two-Rak'at Zuhr and 'Asr prayers at Al-Batha and an 'Anza was planted in front of him (as a Sutra). He performed ablution and the people took the remaining water left after his ablution and rubbed their bodies with it.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: I used to accompany Salama bin Al-Akwa' (may Allah be pleased with him) and he used to pray behind the pillar which was near the place where the Qur'ans were kept. I said, "O Abu Muslim! I see you always seeking to pray behind this pillar." He replied, "I saw Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) always seeking to pray near that pillar."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: I saw the most famous people amongst the companions of the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) hurrying towards the pillars at the Maghrib prayer before the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) came for the prayer.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) entered the Ka'ba along with Usama bin Zaid, Uthman bin Talha, and Bilal, and remained there for a long time. When they came out, I was the first man to enter the Ka'ba. I asked Bilal, "Where did the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) pray?" Bilal replied, "Between the two front pillars."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) said, "Allah's Apostle (Peace and blessings be upon him) entered the Ka'ba along with Usama bin Zaid, Bilal, and Uthman bin Talha Al-Hajabi and closed the door and stayed there for some time. I asked Bilal when he came out, 'What did the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) do?' He replied, 'He offered prayer with one pillar to his left and one to his right and three behind.' In those days the Ka'ba was supported by six pillars." Malik said, "There were two pillars on his (the Prophet's) right side."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: "The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) used to make his she-camel sit across and he would pray facing it (as a Sutra)." I asked, "What would the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) do if the she-camel was provoked and moved?" He said, "He would take its camel-saddle and put it in front of him and pray facing its back part (as a Sutra). And Ibn Umar used to do the same." (This indicates that one should not pray except behind a Sutra).

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: Do you make us (women) equal to dogs and donkeys? While I used to lie in my bed, the Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) would come and pray facing the middle of the bed. I used to consider it not good to stand in front of him in his prayers. So I used to slip away slowly and quietly from the foot of the bed till I got out of my guilt.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace and blessings be upon him) said, (what is ascribed to him in the following Hadith 488):

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: I saw Abu Said Al-Khudri praying on a Friday, behind something which acted as a Sutra. A young man from Bani Abi Mu'ait wanted to pass in front of him, but Abu Said repulsed him with a push on his chest. Finding no alternative he again tried to pass but Abu Said pushed him with a greater force. The young man abused Abu Said and went to Marwan and lodged a complaint against Abu Said and Abu Said followed the young man to Marwan who asked him, "O Abu Said! What has happened between you and the son of your brother?" Abu Sa'id said to him, "I heard the Prophet saying, 'If anybody amongst you is praying behind something as a Sutra and somebody tries to pass in front of him, then he should repulse him and if he refuses, he should use force against him for he is a satan.'"

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: That Zaid bin Khalid sent him to Abi Juhaim to ask him what he had heard from Allah's Apostle about a person passing in front of another person who was praying. Abi Juhaim replied, "Allah's Apostle said, 'If the person who passes in front of another person in prayer knew the magnitude of his sin he would prefer to wait for 40 (days, months or years) rather than to pass in front of him.'"

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: The things which annul the prayers were mentioned before me. They said, "Prayer is annulled by a dog, a donkey and a woman (if they pass in front of the praying people)." I said, "You have made us (i.e. women) dogs. I saw the Prophet praying while I used to lie between him and the Qibla. Whenever I was in need of something, I would slip away. for I disliked to face him."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: The Prophet used to pray while I was sleeping across in his bed in front of him. Whenever he wanted to pray Witr, he would wake me up and I would pray Witr.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: The wife of the Prophet, "I used to sleep in front of Allah's Apostle with my legs opposite his Qibla (facing him); and whenever he prostrated, he pushed my feet and I withdrew them and whenever he stood, I stretched them." 'Aisha added, "In those days there were no lamps in the houses."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: The things which annul prayer were mentioned before me (and those were): a dog, a donkey and a woman. I said, "You have compared us (women) to donkeys and dogs. By Allah! I saw the Prophet praying while I used to lie in (my) bed between him and the Qibla. Whenever I was in need of something, I disliked to sit and trouble the Prophet. So, I would slip away by the side of his feet."

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: (the wife of the Prophet) Allah's Apostle used to get up at night and pray while I used to lie across between him and the Qibla on his family's bed.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle was praying and he was carrying Umama the daughter of Zainab, the daughter of Allah's Apostle. When he prostrated, he put her down and when he stood, he carried her (on his neck).

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: My bed was beside the praying place (Musalla) of the Prophet and sometimes his garment fell on me while I used to lie in my bed.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: The Prophet used to pray while I used to sleep beside him during my periods (menses) and in prostrations his garment used to touch me.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with her
hadiths.text: It is not good that you people have made us equal to dogs and donkeys. No doubt I saw Allah's Apostle praying while I used to lie between him and the Qibla and when he wanted to prostrate, he pushed my legs and I withdrew them.

hadiths.honorific: May Allah be pleased with him
hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Mas'ud said, "While Allah's Apostle was praying beside the Ka'ba, there were some Quraish people sitting in a gathering. One of them said, 'Don't you see this (who does deeds just to show off)? Who amongst you can go and bring the dung, blood and the abdominal contents of the slaughtered camels of the family of so-and-so and then wait till he prostrates and put that in between his shoulders?' The most unfortunate amongst them ('Uqba bin Abi Mu'ait) went and brought them and when Allah's Apostle prostrated, he put them between his shoulders. The Prophet remained in prostration and they laughed so much that they fell on each other. A passerby went to Fatima, who was a young girl in those days. She came running and the Prophet was still in prostration. She removed them and cursed the Quraish on their faces. When Allah's Apostle completed his prayer, he said, 'O Allah! Take revenge on Quraish.' He said so thrice and added, 'O Allah! take revenge on 'Amr bin Hisham, 'Utba bin Rabia, Shaiba bin Rabi'a, Al-Walid bin'Utba, Umaiya bin Khalaf, 'Uqba bin Abi Mu'ait and 'Umar a bin Al-Widal.' Abdullah added, "By Allah! I saw all of them dead in the battle field on the day of Badr and they were dragged and thrown in the Qalib at Badr: Allah's Apostle then said, 'Allah's curse has descended upon the people of the Qalib (well).'"

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Shihab
hadiths.text: Once 'Umar bin 'Abdul 'Aziz delayed the prayer and 'Urwa bin Az-Zubair went to him and said, "Once in 'Iraq, Al-Mughira bin Shu'ba delayed his prayers and Abi Mas'ud Al-Ansari went to him and said, 'O Mughira! What is this? Don't you know that once Gabriel came and offered the prayer (Fajr prayer) and Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) prayed too, then he prayed again (Zuhr prayer) and so did Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) and again he prayed ('Asr prayers) and Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) did the same; again he prayed (Maghrib-prayer) and so did Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) and again prayed ('Isha prayer) and so did Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) and (Gabriel) said, 'I was ordered to do so (to demonstrate the prayers prescribed to you)?'" 'Umar (bin 'Abdul 'Aziz) said to 'Urwa, "Be sure of what you say. Did Gabriel lead Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) at the stated times of the prayers?" 'Urwa replied, "Bashir bin Abi Mas'ud narrated like this on the authority of his father." Urwa added, "Aisha (May Allah Be Pleased With Her) told me that Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) used to pray 'Asr prayer when the sunshine was still inside her residence (during the early time of 'Asr)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Abbas
hadiths.text: Once a delegation of 'Abdul Qais came to Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) and said, "We belong to such and such branch of the tribe of Rab'a and we can only come to you in the sacred months. Order us to do something good so that we may (carry out) take it from you and also invite to it our people whom we have left behind (at home)." The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "I order you to do four things and forbid you from four things. (The first four are as follows): 1. To believe in Allah. (And then he explained it to them i.e.) to testify that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah and (Muhammad) am Allah's Apostle 2. To offer prayers perfectly (at the stated times): 3. To pay Zakat (obligatory charity) 4. To give me Khumus (The other four things which are forbidden are as follows): 1. Dubba 2. Hantam 3. Muqaiyat 4. Naqir (all these are utensils used for the preparation of alcoholic drinks)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Jarir bin 'Abdullah
hadiths.text: I gave the pledge of allegiance to Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) for to offer prayers perfectly, to pay Zakat regularly, and to give good advice to every Muslim.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Shaqiq
hadiths.text: That he had heard Hudhaifa saying, "Once I was sitting with 'Umar (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) and he said, 'Who amongst you remembers the statement of Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) about the afflictions?' I said, 'I know it as the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) had said it.' 'Umar (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) said, 'No doubt you are bold.' I said, 'The afflictions caused for a man by his wife, money, children and neighbor are expiated by his prayers, fasting, charity and by enjoining (what is good) and forbidding (what is evil).' 'Umar (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) said, 'I did not mean that but I asked about that affliction which will spread like the waves of the sea.' I (Hudhaifa) said, 'O leader of the faithful believers! You need not be afraid of it as there is a closed door between you and it.' 'Umar (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) asked, Will the door be broken or opened?' I replied, 'It will be broken.' 'Umar (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) said, 'Then it will never be closed again.' I was asked whether 'Umar (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) knew that door. I replied that he knew it as one knows that there will be night before the tomorrow morning. I narrated a Hadith that was free from any mis-statement" The subnarrator added that they deputed Masruq to ask Hudhaifa (about the door). Hudhaifa said, "The door was 'Umar (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) himself."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Mas'ud
hadiths.text: A man kissed a woman (unlawfully) and then went to the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and informed him. Allah revealed: And offer prayers perfectly At the two ends of the day And in some hours of the night (i.e. the five compulsory prayers). Verily! good deeds remove (annul) the evil deeds (small sins) (11.114). The man asked Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him), "Is it for me?" He said, "It is for all my followers."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdullah
hadiths.text: I asked the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) "Which deed is the dearest to Allah?" He replied, "To offer the prayers at their early stated fixed times." I asked, "What is the next (in goodness)?" He replied, "To be good and dutiful to your parents." I again asked, "What is the next (in goodness)?" He replied, 'To participate in Jihad (religious fighting) in Allah's cause.' 'Abdullah added, "I asked only that much and if I had asked more, the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) would have told me more."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira
hadiths.text: I heard Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) saying, "If there was a river at the door of anyone of you and he took a bath in it five times a day would you notice any dirt on him?" They said, "Not a trace of dirt would be left." The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) added, "That is the example of the five prayers with which Allah blots out (annuls) evil deeds."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ghailan
hadiths.text: Anas (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) said, "I do not find (now-a-days) things as they were (practiced) at the time of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)." Somebody said "The prayer (is as it was.)" Anas (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) said, "Have you not done in the prayer what you have done? Narrated Az-Zuhri that he visited Anas bin Malik (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) at Damascus and found him weeping and asked him why he was weeping. He replied, "I do not know anything which I used to know during the life-time of Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) except this prayer which is being lost (not offered as it should be)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Whenever anyone of you offers his prayer he is speaking in private to his Lord. So he should not spit to his right but under his left foot." Qatada said, "He should not spit in front of him but to his left or under his feet." And Shu'ba said, "He should not spit in front of him, nor to his right but to his left or under his foot." Anas (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) said: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "He should neither spit in the direction of his Qibla nor to his right but to his left or under his foot."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Do the prostration properly and do not put your fore-arms flat with elbows touching the ground like a dog. And if you want to spit, do not spit in front, nor to the right for the person in prayer is speaking in private to his Lord."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira and 'Abdullah bin 'Umar
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "If it is very hot, then pray the Zuhr prayer when it becomes (a bit) cooler, as the severity of the heat is from the raging of the Hell-fire."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Dhar
hadiths.text: The Muadhdhin (call-maker) of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) pronounced the Adhan (call) for the Zuhr prayer but the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Let it be cooler, let it be cooler." Or said, 'Wait, wait, because the severity of heat is from the raging of the Hell-fire. In severe hot weather, pray when it becomes (a bit) cooler and the shadows of hillocks appear."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "In very hot weather delay the Zuhr prayer till it becomes (a bit) cooler because the severity of heat is from the raging of Hell-fire. The Hell-fire of Hell complained to its Lord saying: O Lord! My parts are eating (destroying) one another. So Allah allowed it to take two breaths, one in the winter and the other in the summer. The breath in the summer is at the time when you feel the severest heat and the breath in the winter is at the time when you feel the severest cold."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Sa'id
hadiths.text: That Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Pray Zuhr prayer when it becomes (a bit) cooler as the severity of heat is from the raging of the Hell-fire."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Dhar Al-Ghifar
hadiths.text: We were with the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) on a journey and the Mu'adhdhin (call maker for the prayer) wanted to pronounce the Adhan (call) for the Zuhr prayer. The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Let it become cooler." He again (after a while) wanted to pronounce the Adhan but the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said to him, "Let it become cooler till we see the shadows of hillocks." The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) added, "The severity of heat is from the raging of the Hell-fire, and in very hot weather pray (Zuhr) when it becomes cooler."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) came out as the sun declined at mid-day and offered the Zuhr prayer. He then stood on the pulpit and spoke about the Hour (Day of Judgment) and said that in it there would be tremendous things. He then said, "Whoever likes to ask me about anything he can do so and I shall reply as long as I am at this place of mine. Most of the people wept and the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said repeatedly, "Ask me." Abdullah bin Hudhafa As-Sahmi (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) stood up and said, "Who is my father?" The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Your father is Hudhafa." The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) repeatedly said, "Ask me." Then Umar (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) knelt before him and said, "We are pleased with Allah as our Lord, Islam as our religion, and Muhammad as our Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)." The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) then became quiet and said, "Paradise and Hell-fire were displayed in front of me on this wall just now and I have never seen a better thing (than the former) and a worse thing (than the latter)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Al-Minhal
hadiths.text: Abu Barza (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) said, "The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) used to offer the Fajr (prayer) when one could recognize the person sitting by him (after the prayer) and he used to recite between 60 to 100 Ayat (verses) of the Qur'an. He used to offer the Zuhr prayer as soon as the sun declined (at noon) and the 'Asr at a time when a man might go and return from the farthest place in Medina and find the sun still hot. (The sub-narrator forgot what was said about the Maghrib). He did not mind delaying the 'Isha prayer to one third of the night or the middle of the night."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik
hadiths.text: When we offered the Zuhr prayers behind Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) we used to prostrate on our clothes to protect ourselves from the heat.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Abbas
hadiths.text: "The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) prayed eight Rakat for the Zuhr and 'Asr, and seven for the Maghrib and 'Isha prayers in Medina." Aiyub said, "Perhaps those were rainy nights." Anas (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) said, "May be."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) used to offer the 'Asr prayer when the sunshine had not disappeared from my chamber.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) used to offer the 'Asr prayers at a time when the sunshine was still inside my chamber and no shadow had yet appeared in it.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) used to pray the 'Asr prayers at a time when the sunshine was still inside my chamber and no shadow had yet appeared in it.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Saiyar bin Salama
hadiths.text: I along with my father went to Abu-Barza Al-Aslami (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) and my father asked him, "How Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) used to offer the five compulsory congregational prayers?" Abu-Barza said, "The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) used to pray the Zuhr prayer which you (people) call the first one at mid-day when the sun had just declined The Asr prayer at a time when after the prayer, a man could go to the house at the farthest place in Medina (and arrive) while the sun was still hot. (I forgot about the Maghrib prayer). The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) loved to delay the 'Isha which you call Al-Atama and he disliked sleeping before it and speaking after it. After the Fajr prayer he used to leave when a man could recognize the one sitting beside him and he used to recite between 60 to 100 Ayat (in the Fajr prayer)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik
hadiths.text: We used to pray the Asr prayer and after that if someone happened to go to the tribe of Bani Amr bin Auf, he would find them still praying the Asr (prayer).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Bakr bin Uthman bin Sahl bin Hunaif
hadiths.text: That he heard Abu Umama (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) saying: We prayed the Zuhr prayer with 'Umar bin Abdul Aziz (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) and then went to Anas bin Malik (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) and found him offering the Asr prayer. I asked him, "O uncle! Which prayer have you offered?" He said 'The Asr and this is (the time of) the prayer of Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) which we used to pray with him."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) used to offer the 'Asr prayer at a time when the sun was still hot and high and if a person went to Al-'Awali (a place) of Medina, he would reach there when the sun was still high. Some of Al-'Awali of Medina were about four miles or so from the town.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik
hadiths.text: We used to pray the 'Asr and after that if one of us went to Quba' he would arrive there while the sun was still high.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Umar
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Whoever misses the 'Asr prayer (intentionally) then it is as if he lost his family and property."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Al-Mahh
hadiths.text: We were with Buraida (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) in a battle on a cloudy day and he said, "Offer the 'Asr prayer early as the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Whoever leaves the 'Asr prayer, all his (good) deeds will be annulled."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Qais
hadiths.text: Jarir (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) said, "We were with the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and he looked at the moon--full-moon--and said, 'Certainly you will see your Lord as you see this moon and you will have no trouble in seeing Him. So if you can avoid missing (through sleep or business, etc.) a prayer before the sun-rise (Fajr) and a prayer before sunset ('Asr), you must do so.' He then recited Allah's Statement: And celebrate the praises Of your Lord before The rising of the sun And before (its) setting." (50.39) Isma'il said, "Offer those prayers and do not miss them."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Angels come to you in succession by night and day and all of them get together at the time of the Fajr and 'Asr prayers. Those who have passed the night with you (or stayed with you) ascend (to the Heaven) and Allah asks them, though He knows everything about you, well, "In what state did you leave my slaves?" The angels reply: "When we left them they were praying and when we reached them, they were praying."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "If anyone of you can get one Rak'a of the 'Asr prayer before sunset, he should complete his prayer. If any of you can get one Rak'a of the Fajr prayer before sunrise, he should complete his prayer."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Salim bin 'Abdullah
hadiths.text: My father said, "I heard Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) saying, 'The period of your stay as compared to the previous nations is like the period equal to the time between the 'Asr prayer and sunset. The people of the Torah were given the Torah and they acted (upon it) till mid-day then they were exhausted and were given one Qirat (of gold) each. And then the people of the Gospel were given the Gospel and they acted (upon it) till the 'Asr prayer then they were exhausted and were! given one Qirat each. And then we were given the Qur'an and we acted (upon it) till sunset and we were given two Qirats each. On that the people of both the scriptures said, 'O our Lord! You have given them two Qirats and given us one Qirat, though we have worked more than they.' Allah said, 'Have I usurped some of your right?' They said, 'No.' Allah said: "That is my blessing I bestow upon whomsoever I wish."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Musa
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "The example of Muslims, Jews and Christians is like the example of a man who employed laborers to work for him from morning till night. They worked till mid-day and they said, 'We are not in need of your reward.' SO the man employed another batch and said to them, 'Complete the rest of the day and yours will be the wages I had fixed (for the first batch). They worked Up till the time of the 'Asr prayer and said, 'Whatever we have done is for you.' He employed another batch. They worked for the rest of the day till sunset, and they received the wages of the two former batches."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Rafi' bin Khadij
hadiths.text: We used to offer the Maghrib prayer with the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and after finishing the prayer one of us may go away and could still see as Par as the spots where one's arrow might reach when shot by a bow.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Jabir bin 'Abdullah
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) used to pray the Zuhr at mid-day, and the 'Asr at a time when the sun was still bright, the Maghrib after sunset (at its stated time) and the Isha at a variable time. Whenever he saw the people assembled (for Isha' prayer) he would pray earlier and if the people delayed, he would delay the prayer. And they or the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) used to offer the Fajr Prayers when it still dark.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Salama
hadiths.text: We used to pray the Maghrib prayer with the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) when the sun disappeared from the horizon.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Abbas
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) prayed seven Rakat together and eight Rakat together.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdullah Al-Muzani
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Do not be influenced by bedouins regarding the name of your Maghrib prayer which is called 'Isha' by them."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abdullah
hadiths.text: "One night Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) led us in the 'Isha' prayer and that is the one called Al-'Atma by the people. After the completion of the prayer, he faced us and said, "Do you know the importance of this night? Nobody present on the surface of the earth to-night will be living after one hundred years from this night." (See Hadith No. 575).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Muhammad bin 'Amr
hadiths.text: We asked Jabir bin 'Abdullah (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) about the prayers of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him). He said, "He used to pray Zuhr prayer at mid-day, the 'Asr when the sun was still hot, and the Maghrib after sunset (at its stated time). The 'Isha was offered early if the people gathered, and used to be delayed if their number was less; and the morning prayer was offered when it was still dark."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) once delayed the 'Isha' prayer and that was during the days when Islam still had not spread. The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) did not come out till 'Umar (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) informed him that the women and children had slept. Then he came out and said to the people of the mosque:"None amongst the dwellers of the earth has been waiting for it ('Isha prayer) except you."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Musa
hadiths.text: My companions, who came with me in the boat and I landed at a place called Baqi Buthan. The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) was in Medina at that time. One of us used to go to the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) by turns every night at the time of the Isha prayer. Once I along with my companions went to the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and he was busy in some of his affairs, so the 'Isha' prayer was delayed to the middle of the night He then came out and led the people (in prayer). After finishing from the prayer, he addressed the people present there saying, "Be patient! Don't go away. Have the glad tiding. It is from the blessing of Allah upon you that none amongst mankind has prayed at this time save you." Or said, "None except you has prayed at this time." Abu Muisa added, 'So we returned happily after what we heard from Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him).'

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Barza
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) disliked to sleep before the 'Isha' prayer and to talk after it.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Shihab from 'Urwa
hadiths.text: 'Aisha (May Allah Be Pleased With Her) said, "Once Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) delayed the 'Isha' prayer till 'Umar (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) reminded him by saying, "The prayer!" The women and children have slept. Then the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) came out and said, 'None amongst the dwellers of the earth has been waiting for it (the prayer) except you." Urwa said, "Nowhere except in Medina the prayer used to be offered (in those days)." He further said, "The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) used to offer the 'Isha' prayer in the period between the disappearance of the twilight and the end of the first third of the night."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Juraij from Nafi
hadiths.text: 'Abdullah bin 'Umar (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) said, "Once Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) was busy (at the time of the 'Isha'), so the prayer was delayed so much so that we slept and woke up and slept and woke up again. The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) came out and said, 'None amongst the dwellers of the earth but you have been waiting for the prayer." Ibn 'Umar (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) did not find any harm in praying it earlier or in delaying it unless he was afraid that sleep might overwhelm him and he might miss the prayer, and sometimes he used to sleep before the 'Isha' prayer. Ibn Juraij said, "I said to 'Ata', 'I heard Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) saying: Once Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) delayed the 'Isha' prayer to such an extent that the people slept and got up and slept again and got up again. Then 'Umar bin Al-Khattab (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) stood up and reminded the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) of the prayer.' 'Ata' said, 'Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) said: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) came out as if I was looking at him at this time, and water was trickling from his head and he was putting his hand on his head and then said, 'Hadn't I thought it hard for my followers, I would have ordered them to pray ('Isha' prayer) at this time.' I asked 'Ata' for further information, how the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) had kept his hand on his head as he was told by Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah Be Pleased With Him). 'Ata' separated his fingers slightly and put their tips on the side of the head, brought the fingers downwards approximating them till the thumb touched the lobe of the ear at the side of the temple and the beard on the face. He neither slowed nor hurried in this action but he acted like that. The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said: "Hadn't I thought it hard for my followers I would have ordered them to pray at this time."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) delayed the 'Isha' prayer till midnight and then he offered the prayer and said, "The people prayed and slept but you have been in prayer as long as you have been waiting for it (the prayer)." Anas (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) added: As if I am looking now at the glitter of the ring of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) on that night.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Jarir bin 'Abdullah
hadiths.text: We were with the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) on a full moon night. He looked at the moon and said, "You will certainly see your Lord as you see this moon, and there will be no trouble in seeing Him. So if you can avoid missing (through sleep, business, etc.) a prayer before the rising of the sun (Fajr) and before its setting ('Asr) you must do so. He (the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)) then recited the following verse: And celebrate the praises Of Your Lord before The rising of the sun And before (its) setting." (50.39)

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Bakr bin Abi Musa
hadiths.text: My father said, "Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever prays the two cool prayers ('Asr and Fajr) will go to Paradise.'"

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas
hadiths.text: Zaid bin Thabit (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) said, "We took the "Suhur" (the meal taken before dawn while fasting is observed) with the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and then stood up for the (morning) prayer." I asked him how long the interval between the two (Suhur and prayer) was. He replied, 'The interval between the two was just sufficient to recite fifty to Sixth 'Ayat.'"

hadiths.by: Narrated by Qatada
hadiths.text: Anas bin Malik (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) said, "The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and Zaid bin Thabit (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) took the 'Suhur' together and after finishing the meal, the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) stood up and prayed (Fajr prayer)." I asked Anas (May Allah Be Pleased With Him), "How long was the interval between finishing their 'Suhur' and starting the prayer?" He replied, "The interval between the two was just sufficient to recite fifty 'Ayat.' (Verses of the Quran)."
You offer a prayer which I did not see being offered by Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) when we were in his company and he certainly had forbidden it (i.e. two Rakat after the Asr prayer).

Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) forbade the offering of two prayers: 

1. after the morning prayer till the sunrises. 

2. after the 'Asr prayer till the sun sets.
I pray as I saw my companions praying. I do not forbid praying at any time during the day or night except at sunset and sunrise.

By Allah, Who took away the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him). The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) never missed them (two Rakat) after the 'Asr prayer till he met Allah and he did not meet Allah till it became heavy for him to pray while standing so he used to offer most of the prayers while sitting. (She meant the two Rakat after Asr) He used to pray them in the house and never prayed them in the mosque lest it might be hard for his followers and he loved what was easy for them.
'Aisha (May Allah Be Pleased With Her) (addressing me) said, "O son of my sister! The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) never missed two prostrations (i.e. Rakat) after the 'Asr prayer in my house."
Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) never missed two Rakat before the Fajr prayer and after the Asr prayer openly and secretly.
Whenever the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) came to me after the 'Asr prayer, he always prayed two Rakat.

I was with Buraida (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) on a cloudy day and he said, "Offer the 'Asr prayer earlier as the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever leaves the 'Asr prayer will have all his (good) deeds annulled."

My father said, "One night we were traveling with the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and some people said, 'We wish that Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) would take a rest along with us during the last hours of the night.' He said, 'I am afraid that you will sleep and miss the (Fajr) prayer.' Bilal (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) said, 'I will make you get up.' So all slept and Bilal (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) rested his back against his Rahila and he too was overwhelmed (by sleep) and slept. The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) got up when the edge of the sun had risen and said, 'O Bilal (May Allah Be Pleased With Him)! What about your statement?' He replied, 'I have never slept such a sleep.' The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah captured your souls when He wished, and released them when He wished. O Bilal (May Allah Be Pleased With Him)! Get up and pronounce the Adhan for the prayer.' The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) performed ablution and when the sun came up and became bright, he stood up and prayed."

On the day of Al-Khandaq (the battle of trench.) 'Umar bin Al-Khattab (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) came cursing the disbelievers of Quraish after the sun had set and said, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) I could not offer the 'Asr prayer till the sun had set." The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "By Allah! I, too, have not prayed." So we turned towards Buthan, and the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) performed ablution and we too performed ablution and offered the 'Asr prayer after the sun had set, and then he offered the Maghrib prayer.

The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "If anyone forgets a prayer he should pray that prayer when he remembers it. There is no expiation except to pray the same." Then he recited: "Establish prayer for My (i.e. Allah's) remembrance." (20.14).

Umar (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) came cursing the disbelievers (of Quraish) on the day of Al-Khandaq (the battle of Trench) and said, "I could not offer the 'Asr prayer till the sun had set. Then we went to Buthan and he offered the ('Asr) prayer after sunset and then he offered the Maghrib prayer.

My father and I went to Abi Barza Al-Aslami (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) and my father said to him, "Tell us how Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) used to offer the compulsory congregational prayers." He said, "He used to pray the Zuhr prayer, which you call the first prayer, as the sun declined at noon, the 'Asr at a time when one of us could go to his family at the farthest place in Medina while the sun was still hot. (The narrator forgot what Abu Barza had said about the Maghrib prayer), and the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) preferred to pray the 'Isha' late and disliked to sleep before it or talk after it. And he used to return after finishing the morning prayer at such a time when it was possible for one to recognize the person sitting by his side and he (the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)) used to recite 60 to 100 'Ayat' (verses) of the Qur'an in it."

Once he waited for Al-Hasan and he did not show up till it was about the usual time for him to start his speech; then he came and apologized saying, "Our neighbors invited us." Then he added, "Narrated Anas (May Allah Be Pleased With Him), 'Once we waited for the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) till it was midnight or about midnight. He came and led the prayer, and after finishing it, he addressed us and said, 'All the people prayed and then slept and you had been in prayer as long as you were waiting for it." Al-Hasan said, "The people are regarded as performing good deeds as long as they are waiting for doing good deeds." Al-Hasan's statement is a portion of Anas's Hadith from the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him).

The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) prayed one of the 'Isha' prayer in his last days and after finishing it with Taslim, he stood up and said, "Do you realize (the importance of) this night? Nobody present on the surface of the earth to-night would be living after the completion of one hundred years from this night." The people made a mistake in grasping the meaning of this statement of Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) and they indulged in those things which are said about these narrators (i.e. some said that the Day of Resurrection will be established after 100 years etc.) But the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Nobody present on the surface of earth tonight would be living after the completion of 100 years from this night"; he meant "When that century (people of that century) would pass away."

'Abdur Rahman bin Abi Bakr (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) said, "The Suffa Companions were poor people and the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever has food for two persons should take a third one from them (Suffa companions). And whosoever has food for four persons he should take one or two from them' Abu Bakr (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) took three men and the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) took ten of them." 'Abdur Rahman added, my father my mother and I were there (in the house). (The sub-narrator is in doubt whether 'Abdur Rahman also said, 'My wife and our servant who was common for both my house and Abu Bakr's house). Abu Bakr (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) took his supper with the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and remained there till the 'Isha' prayer was offered. Abu Bakr (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) went back and stayed with the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) till the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) took his meal and then Abu Bakr (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) returned to his house after a long portion of the night had passed. Abu Bakr's (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) wife said, 'What detained you from your guests (or guest)?' He said, 'Have you not served them yet?' She said, 'They refused to eat until you come. The food was served for them but they refused.' 'Abdur Rahman added, "I went away and hid myself (being afraid of Abu Bakr) and in the meantime he (Abu Bakr) called me, 'O Ghunthar (a harsh word)!' and also called me bad names and abused me and then said (to his family), 'Eat. No welcome for you.' Then (the supper was served). Abu Bakr (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) took an oath that he would not eat that food. The narrator added: By Allah, whenever any one of us (myself and the guests of Suffa companions) took anything from the food, it increased from underneath. We all ate to our fill and the food was more than it was before its serving. Abu Bakr (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) looked at it (the food) and found it as it was before serving or even more than that. He addressed his wife (saying) 'O the sister of Bani Firas! What is this?' She said, 'O the pleasure of my eyes! The food is now three times more than it was before.' Abu Bakr (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) ate from it, and said, 'That (oath) was from Satan' meaning his oath (not to eat). Then he again took a morsel (mouthful) from it and then took the rest of it to the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him). So that meal was with the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him). There was a treaty between us and some people, and when the period of that treaty had elapsed the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) divided us into twelve (groups) (the Prophet's companions) each being headed by a man. Allah knows how many men were under the command of each (leader). So all of them (12 groups of men) ate of that meal."

Anas (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) said, "Bilal (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) was ordered to pronounce the wording of Adhan twice and of Iqama once only." The sub narrator Isma'li said, "I mentioned that to Aiyub and he added (to that), "Except Iqama (i.e. Qad-Qamatis-Salat which should be said twice)."

Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "When the Adhan is pronounced Satan takes to his heels and passes wind with noise during his flight in order not to hear the Adhan. When the Adhan is completed he comes back and again takes to his heels when the Iqama is pronounced and after its completion he returns again till he whispers into the heart of the person (to divert his attention from his prayer) and makes him remember things which he does not recall to his mind before the prayer and that causes him to forget how much he has prayed."

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) told my father, "I see you liking sheep and the wilderness. So whenever you are with your sheep or in the wilderness and you want to pronounce Adhan for the prayer raise your voice in doing so, for whoever hears the Adhan, whether a human being, a jinn or any other creature, will be a witness for you on the Day of Resurrection." Abu Said added, "I heard it (this narration) from Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him)."

Anas bin Malik (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) said, "Whenever the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) went out with us to fight (in Allah's cause) against any nation, he never allowed us to attack till morning and he would wait and see: if he heard Adhan he would postpone the attack and if he did not hear Adhan he would attack them." Anas added, "We reached Khaibar at night and in the morning when he did not hear the Adhan for the prayer, he (the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)) rode and I rode behind Abi Talha and my foot was touching that of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him). The inhabitants of Khaibar came out with their baskets and spades and when they saw the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) they shouted 'Muhammad! By Allah, Muhammad and his army.' When Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) saw them, he said, "Allahu-Akbar! Allahu-Akbar! Khaibar is ruined. Whenever we approach a (hostile) nation (to fight), then evil will be the morning of those who have been warned."
Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Whenever you hear the Adhan, say what the Mu'adhdhin is saying."
That he had heard Muawiya repeating the words of Adhan up to "Wa ash-hadu Anna Muhammadan Rasulul-lah (and I testify that Muhammad is Allah's Apostle.)"

"Some of my companions told me that Hisham had said, "When the Mu'adhdhin said, "Haiya alas-sala(t) (come for the prayer)." Muawiya said, "La hawla wala quwata illa billah (There is neither might nor any power except with Allah)" and added, "We heard your Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) saying the same."

Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Whoever after listening to the Adhan says, 'Allahumma Rabba hadhihi-d-da' watit-tammati was-salatil qa'imati, ati Muhammadan al-wasilata wal-fadilata, wab' athhu maqaman mahmudan-il-ladhi wa' adtahu (O Allah! Lord of this perfect call (of not ascribing partners to You) and of the regular prayer which is going to be established! Kindly give Muhammad the right of intercession and superiority and send him (on the Day of Judgment) to the best and the highest place in Paradise which You promised him)', then intercession for me will be permitted for him on the Day of Resurrection."

Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "If the people knew the reward for pronouncing the Adhan and for standing in the first row (in congregational prayers) and found no other way to get that except by drawing lots they would draw lots, and if they knew the reward of the Zuhr prayer (in the early moments of its stated time) they would race for it (go early) and if they knew the reward of 'Isha' and Fajr (morning) prayers in congregation, they would come to offer them even if they had to crawl."

Once on a rainy muddy day, Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) delivered a sermon in our presence and when the Mu'adhdhin pronounced the Adhan and said, "Haiya ala-s-sala(t) (come for the prayer)" Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) ordered him to say 'Pray at your homes.' The people began to look at each other (surprisingly). Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) said. "It was done by one who was much better than I (i.e. the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) or his Mu'adhdhin), and it is a license.'

My father said that Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Bilal (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) pronounces 'Adhan at night, so keep on eating and drinking (Suhur) till Ibn Um Maktum (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) pronounces Adhan." Salim added, "He was a blind man who would not pronounce the Adhan unless he was told that the day had dawned."

When the Muadh-dhin pronounced the Adhan for Fajr prayer and the dawn became evident the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) ordered a two Rakat light prayer (Sunna) before the Iqama of the compulsory (congregational) prayer.
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) used to offer two light Rakat between the Adhan and the Iqama of the Fajr prayer.

Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Bilal (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) pronounces the Adhan at night, so keep on eating and drinking (Suhur) till Ibn Um Maktum (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) pronounces the Adhan."

The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "The Adhan pronounced by Bilal (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) should not stop you from taking Suhur, for he pronounces the Adhan at night, so that the one offering the late night prayer (Tahajjud) from among you might hurry up and the sleeping from among you might wake up. It does not mean that dawn or morning has started." Then he (the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)) pointed with his fingers and raised them up (towards the sky) and then lowered them (towards the earth) like this (Ibn Mas'ud imitated the gesture of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)). Az-Zuhri gestured with his two index fingers which he put on each other and then stretched them to the right and left. These gestures illustrate the way real dawn appears. It spreads left and right horizontally. The dawn that appears in the high sky and lowers down is not the real dawn).

The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Bilal (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) pronounces the Adhan at night, so eat and drink (Suhur) till Ibn Um Maktum (May Allah Be Pleased With Him) pronounces the Adhan."
Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said thrice, "There is a prayer between the two Adhans (Adhan and Iqama)," and added, "For the one who wants to pray."

"When the Mu'adhdhin pronounced the Adhan, some of the companions of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) would proceed to the pillars of the mosque (for the prayer) till the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) arrived and in this way they used to pray two Rakat before the Maghrib prayer. There used to be a little time between the Adhan and the Iqama." Shu'ba said, "There used to be a very short interval between the two (Adhan and Iqama)."

Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) used to pray two light Rakat before the morning (compulsory) prayer after the day dawned and the Mu'adhdhin had finished his Adhan. He then would lie on his right side till the Mu'adhdhin came to pronounce the Iqama.

The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "There is a prayer between the two Adhans (Adhan and Iqama), there is a prayer between the two Adhans." And then while saying it the third time he added, "For the one who wants to (pray)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Malik bin Huwairth (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I came to Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) with some men from my tribe and stayed with him for twenty nights. He was kind and merciful to us. When he realized our longing for our families, he said to us, "Go back and stay with your families and teach them the religion, and offer the prayer and one of you should pronounce the Adhan for the prayer when its time is due and the oldest one amongst you should lead the prayer."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Dhar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: We were in the company of Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) on a journey and the Mu'adhdhin wanted to pronounce the Adhan for the (Zuhr) prayer. Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said to him, "Let it become cooler." Then he again wanted to pronounce the Adhan but Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said to him, "Let it become cooler." The Mu'adh-dhin again wanted to pronounce the Adhan for the prayer but Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Let it become cooler," till the shadows of the hillocks become equal to their sizes. Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) added, "The severity of the heat is from the raging of Hell."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Malik bin Huwairth (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Two men came to Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) with the intention of a journey. Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "When (both of) you set out, pronounce Adhan and then Iqama and the oldest of you should lead the prayer."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Malik (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: We came to Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) and stayed with him for twenty days and nights. We were all young and of about the same age. Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) was very kind and merciful. When he realized our longing for our families, he asked about our homes and the people there and we told him. Then he asked us to go back to our families and stay with them and teach them (the religion) and to order them to do good things. He also mentioned some other things which I have (remembered or) forgotten. Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) then added, "Pray as you have seen me praying and when it is the time for the prayer one of you should pronounce the Adhan and the oldest of you should lead the prayer."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Nafi (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Once in a cold night, Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) pronounced the Adhan for the prayer at Dajnan (the name of a mountain) and then said, "Pray at your homes", and informed us that Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) used to tell the Mu'adhdin to pronounce Adhan and say, "Pray at your homes" at the end of the Adhan on a rainy or a very cold night during the journey."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aun bin Abi Juhaifa (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: My father said, "I saw Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) at a place called Al-Abtah. Bilal (May Allah be pleased with him) came and informed him about the prayer and then came out with an Anza and planted it in front of Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) at Al-Abtah and pronounced the Iqama."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aun bin Abi Juhaifa (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: My father said, "I saw Bilal (May Allah be pleased with him) turning his face from side to side while pronouncing the Adhan for the prayer."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdullah bin Abi Qatada (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: My father said, "While we were praying with Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) he heard the noise of some people. After the prayer he said, 'What is the matter?' They replied 'We were hurrying for the prayer.' He said, 'Do not make haste for the prayer, and whenever you come for the prayer, you should come with calmness, and pray whatever you get (with the people) and complete the rest which you have missed."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "When you hear the Iqama, proceed to offer the prayer with calmness and solemnity and do not make haste. And pray whatever you are able to pray and complete whatever you have missed."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdullah bin Abi Qatada (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: My father said. "Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'If the Iqama is pronounced then do not stand for the prayer till you see me (in front of you).'"

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdullah bin Abi Qatada (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: My father said, "Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'If the Iqama is pronounced, then do not stand for the prayer till you see me (in front of you) and do it calmly.'"

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) went out (of the mosque) when the Iqama had been pronounced and the rows straightened. Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) stood at his Musalla (praying place) and we waited for him to begin the prayer with Takbir. He left and asked us to remain in our places. We kept on standing till Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) returned and the water was trickling from his head for he had taken a bath (of Janaba)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Once Iqama was pronounced and the people had straightened the rows, Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) went forward (to lead the prayer) but he was Junub, so he said, "Remain in your places." And he went out, took a bath and returned with water trickling from his head. Then he led the prayer.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Jabir bin 'Abdullah (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: On the day of Al-Khandaq (the trench), 'Umar bin Al-Khattab (May Allah be pleased with him) went to Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) and said, "O Allah's Apostle! By Allah, I could not pray (the 'Asr) till the sun had set." 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) told this to Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) at the time when a fasting person had done Iftar (taken his meals). Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) then went to Buthan and I was with him. He performed ablution and offered the 'Asr prayer after the sun had set and then the Maghrib prayer.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Once the Iqama was pronounced and Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) was talking to a man (in a low voice) in a corner of the mosque and he did not lead the prayer till (some of) the people had slept (dozed in a sitting posture).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Once Iqama was pronounced a man came to Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) and detained him (from the prayer).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "By Him in Whose Hand my soul is I was about to order for collecting fire-wood (fuel) and then order Someone to pronounce the Adhan for the prayer and then order someone to lead the prayer then I would go from behind and burn the houses of men who did not present themselves for the (compulsory congregational) prayer. By Him, in Whose Hands my soul is, if anyone of them had known that he would get a bone covered with good meat or two (small) pieces of meat present in between two ribs, he would have turned up for the 'Isha' prayer.'"

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdullah bin Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "The prayer in congregation is twenty seven times superior to the prayer offered by person alone."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Said Al-Khudri (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "The prayer in congregation is twenty five times superior to the prayer offered by person alone."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "The reward of the prayer offered by a person in congregation is twenty five times greater than that of the prayer offered in one's house or in the market (alone). And this is because if he performs ablution and does it perfectly and then proceeds to the mosque with the sole intention of praying, then for every step he takes towards the mosque, he is upgraded one degree in reward and his one sin is taken off (crossed out) from his accounts (of deeds). When he offers his prayer, the angels keep on asking Allah's Blessings and Allah's forgiveness for him as long as he is (staying) at his Musalla. They say, 'O Allah! Bestow Your blessings upon him, be Merciful and kind to him.' And one is regarded in prayer as long as one is waiting for the prayer."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Salama bin 'Abdur Rahman (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "I heard Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) saying, 'The reward of a prayer in congregation is twenty five times greater than that of a prayer offered by a person alone. The angels of the night and the angels of the day gather at the time of Fajr prayer.'" Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him) then added, "Recite the Holy Book if you wish, for 'Indeed, the recitation of the Qur'an in the early dawn (Fajr prayer) is ever witnessed.' (17.18). Narrated 'Abdullah bin 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him): The reward of the congregational prayer is twenty seven times greater (than that of the prayer offered by a person alone)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Salim (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I heard Um Ad-Darda' (May Allah be pleased with her) saying, "Abu Ad-Darda' (May Allah be pleased with him) entered the house in an angry mood. I said to him, 'What makes you angry?' He replied, 'By Allah! I do not find the followers of Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) doing those good things (which they used to do before) except the offering of congregational prayer." (This happened in the last days of Abu Ad-Darda' (May Allah be pleased with him) during the rule of 'Uthman (May Allah be pleased with him)).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Musa (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "The people who get tremendous reward for the prayer are those who are farthest away (from the mosque) and then those who are next farthest and so on. Similarly one who waits to pray with the Imam has greater reward than one who prays and goes to bed."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "While a man was going on a way, he saw a thorny branch and removed it from the way and Allah became pleased by his action and forgave him for that." Then Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Five are martyrs: One who dies of plague, one who dies of an abdominal disease, one who dies of drowning, one who is buried alive (and) dies and one who is killed in Allah's cause." (Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) further said, "If the people knew the reward for pronouncing the Adhan and for standing in the first row (in the congregational prayer) and found no other way to get it except by drawing lots they would do so, and if they knew the reward of offering the Zuhr prayer early (in its stated time), they would race for it and they knew the reward for 'Isha' and Fajr prayers in congregation, they would attend them even if they were to crawl')"

hadiths.by: Narrated by Humaid (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'O Bani Salima! Don't you think that for every step of yours (that you take towards the mosque) there is a reward (while coming for prayer)?" Mujahid (May Allah be pleased with him) said: "Regarding Allah's Statement: "We record that which they have sent before (them), and their traces" (36.12). 'Their traces' means 'their steps.'" And Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) said that the people of Bani Salima wanted to shift to a place near Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) but Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) disliked the idea of leaving their houses uninhabited and said, "Don't you think that you will get the reward for your footprints." Mujahid (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "Their foot prints mean their foot steps and their going on foot."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "No prayer is harder for the hypocrites than the Fajr and the 'Isha' prayers and if they knew the reward for these prayers at their respective times, they would certainly present themselves (in the mosques) even if they had to crawl." Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) added, "Certainly I decided to order the Mu'adh-dhin (call-maker) to pronounce Iqama and order a man to lead the prayer and then take a fire flame to burn all those who had not left their houses so far for the prayer along with their houses."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Malik bin Huwairith (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said (to two persons), "Whenever the prayer time becomes due, you should pronounce Adhan and then Iqama and the older of you should lead the prayer."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "The angels keep on asking for Allah's Blessing and Forgiveness for anyone of you as long as he is at his Musalla (praying place) and does not do Hadath (passes wind). The angels say, 'O Allah! Forgive him and be Merciful to him.' Each one of you is in the prayer as long as he is waiting for the prayer and nothing but the prayer detains him from going to his family."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Allah will give shade, to seven, on the Day when there will be no shade but His. (These seven persons are) a just ruler, a youth who has been brought up in the worship of Allah (i.e. worships Allah sincerely from childhood), a man whose heart is attached to the mosques (i.e. to pray the compulsory prayers in the mosque in congregation), two persons who love each other only for Allah's sake and they meet and part in Allah's cause only, a man who refuses the call of a charming woman of noble birth for illicit intercourse with her and says: I am afraid of Allah, a man who gives charitable gifts so secretly that his left hand does not know what his right hand has given (i.e. nobody knows how much he has given in charity), and a person who remembers Allah in seclusion and his eyes are then flooded with tears."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Humaid (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) was asked, "Did Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) wear a ring?" He said, "Yes. Once he delayed the 'Isha' prayer till mid-night and after the prayer, he faced us and said, 'The people prayed and have slept and you remained in prayer as long as you waited for it.'" Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) added, "As if I were just now observing the glitter of his ring."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Allah will prepare for him who goes to the mosque (every) morning and in the afternoon (for the congregational prayer) an honorable place in Paradise with good hospitality for (what he has done) every morning and afternoon goings."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Malik Ibn Buhaina (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) passed by a man praying two Rakat after the Iqama (had been pronounced). When Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) completed the prayer, the people gathered around him (the Prophet) or that man and Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said to him (protesting), Are there four Rakat in Fajr prayer? Are there four Rakat in Fajr prayer?"

hadiths.by: Narrated by Al-Aswad (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: "We were with 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) discussing the regularity of offering the prayer and dignifying it. She said, 'When Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) fell sick with the fatal illness and when the time of prayer became due and Adhan was pronounced, he said, 'Tell Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) to lead the people in prayer.' He was told that Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) was a soft-hearted man and would not be able to lead the prayer in his place. Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) gave the same order again but he was given the same reply. He gave the order for the third time and said, 'You (women) are the companions of Joseph. Tell Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) to lead the prayer.' So Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) came out to lead the prayer. In the meantime the condition of Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) improved a bit and he came out with the help of two men one on each side. As if I was observing his legs dragging on the ground owing to the disease. Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) wanted to retreat but Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) beckoned him to remain at his place and Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) was brought till he sat beside Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him)." Al-A'mash was asked, "Was Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) praying and Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) following him, and were the people following Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) in that prayer?" Al-A'mash replied in the affirmative with a nod of his head. Abu Muawiya said, "Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) was sitting on the left side of Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) who was praying while standing."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: "When Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) became seriously ill and his disease became aggravated he asked for permission from his wives to be nursed in my house and he was allowed. He came out with the help of two men and his legs were dragging on the ground. He was between Al-Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him) and another man." 'Ubaid Ullah said, "I told Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him) what 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) had narrated and he said, 'Do you know who was the (second) man whose name 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) did not mention?" I said, 'No.' Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him) said, 'He was 'Ali Ibn Abi Talib (May Allah be pleased with him).'"

hadiths.by: Narrated by Nafi' (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Once on a very cold and stormy night, Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) pronounced the Adhan for the prayer and then said, "Pray in your homes." He (Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)) added, "On very cold and rainy nights Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) used to order the Mu'adhdhin to say, 'Pray in your homes.'"

hadiths.by: Narrated by Mahmuid bin Rabi' Al-Ansari (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: 'Itban bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him) used to lead his people (tribe) in prayer and was a blind man, he said to Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him), "O Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him)! At times it is dark and flood water is flowing (in the valley) and I am blind man, so please pray at a place in my house so that I can take it as a Musalla (praying place)." So Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) went to his house and said, "Where do you like me to pray?" 'Itban (May Allah be pleased with him) pointed to a place in his house and Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him), offered the prayer there."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdullah bin Al-Harith (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him) addressed us on a (rainy and) muddy day and when the Mu'adh-dhin said, "Come for the prayer" Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him) ordered him to say, "Pray in your homes." The people began to look at one another with surprise as if they did not like it. Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "It seems that you thought ill of it but no doubt it was done by one who was better than I (i.e. Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him)). It (the prayer) is a strict order and I disliked to bring you out." Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him) narrated the same as above but he said, "I did not like you to make you sinful (in refraining from coming to the mosque) and to come (to the mosque) covered with mud up to the knees."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: A cloud came and it rained till the roof started leaking and in those days the roof used to be of the branches of date-palms. Iqama was pronounced and I saw Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) prostrating in water and mud and even I saw the mark of mud on his forehead.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Sirin (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I heard Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) saying, "A man from Ansar said to Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him), 'I cannot pray with you (in congregation).' He was a very fat man and he prepared a meal for Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) and invited him to his house. He spread out a mat for Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him), and washed one of its sides with water, and Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) prayed two Rakat on it." A man from the family of Al-Jaruid asked, "Did Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) used to pray the Duha (forenoon) prayer?" Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "I did not see him praying the Duha prayer except on that day."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "If supper is served, and Iqama is pronounced one should start with the supper."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "If supper is served, and Iqama is pronounced one should start with the supper."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Nafi' (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'If the supper is served for anyone of you and the Iqama is pronounced, start with the supper and don't be in haste (and carry on eating) till you finish it." If food was served for Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) and Iqama was pronounced, he never came to the prayer till he finished it (i.e. food) in spite of the fact that he heard the recitation (of the Qur'an) by the Imam (in the prayer). Narrated Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him): Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "If anyone of you is having his meals, he should not hurry up till he is; satisfied even if the prayer has been started."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ja'far bin 'Amr bin Umaiya (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: My father said, "I saw Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) eating a piece of meat from the shoulder of a sheep and he was called for the prayer. He stood up, put down the knife and prayed but did not perform ablution.''

hadiths.by: Narrated by Al-Aswad (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: That he asked 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) "What did Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) use to do in his house?" She replied, "He used to keep himself busy serving his family and when it was the time for prayer he would go for it."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Aiyub (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Abu Qilaba (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "Malik bin Huwairith (May Allah be pleased with him) came to this Mosque of ours and said, 'I pray in front of you and my aim is not to lead the prayer but to show you the way in which Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) used to pray.'" I asked Abu Qilaba (May Allah be pleased with him),"How did he use to pray?'" He replied, "(Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) used to pray) like this Sheikh of ours and the Sheikh used to sit for a while after the prostration, before getting up after the first Rak'a."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Musa (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: "Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) became sick and when his disease became aggravated, he said, "Tell Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) to lead the prayer." 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) said, "He is a soft-hearted man and would not be able to lead the prayer in your place." Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said again, "Tell Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) to lead the people in prayer." She repeated the same reply but he said, "Tell Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) to lead the people in prayer. You are the companions of Joseph." So the messenger went to Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) (with that order) and he led the people in prayer in the lifetime of Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: The mother of the believers: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) in his illness said, "Tell Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) to lead the people in prayer." I said to him, "If Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) stands in your place, the people would not hear him owing to his (excessive) weeping. So please order 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) to lead the prayer."
