'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) added I said to Hafsa (May Allah be pleased with her), "Say to him: If Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) should lead the people in the prayer in your place, the people would not be able to hear him owing to his weeping; so please, order 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) to lead the prayer." Hafsa (May Allah be pleased with her) did so but Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Keep quiet! You are verily the Companions of Joseph. Tell Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) to lead the people in the prayer." Hafsa (May Allah be pleased with her) said to 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her), "I never got anything good from you."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Az-Zuhn (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Anas bin Malik Al-Ansari (May Allah be pleased with him), told me, "Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) used to lead the people in prayer during the fatal illness of Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) till it was Monday. When the people aligned (in rows) for the prayer Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) lifted the curtain of his house and started looking at us and was standing at that time. His face was (glittering) like a page of the Qur'an and he smiled cheerfully. We were about to be put to trial for the pleasure of seeing Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him), Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) retreated to join the row as he thought that Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) would lead the prayer. Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) beckoned us to complete the prayer and he let the curtain fall. On the same day he died."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) did not come out for three days. The people stood for the prayer and Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) went ahead to lead the prayer. (In the meantime) Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) caught hold of the curtain and lifted it. When the face of Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) appeared we had never seen a scene more pleasing than the face of Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) as it appeared then. Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) beckoned to Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) to lead the people in the prayer and then let the curtain fall. We did not see him (again) till he died.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Hamza bin 'Abdullah (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: My father said, "When Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) became seriously ill, he was told about the prayer. He said, 'Tell Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) to lead the people in the prayer.' 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) said, 'Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) is a soft-hearted man and he would be over-powered by his weeping if he recited the Qur'an.' He said to them, 'Tell him (Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him)) to lead the prayer. The same reply was given to him. He said again, 'Tell him to lead the prayer. You (women) are the companions of Joseph."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Urwa's father (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) said, "Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) ordered Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) to lead the people in the prayer during his illness and so he led them in prayer." 'Urwa, a sub narrator, added, "Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) felt a bit relieved and came out and Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) was leading the people. When Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) saw Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) he retreated but Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) beckoned him to remain there. Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) sat beside Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him). Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) was following the prayer of Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) and the people were following the prayer of Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Sahl bin Sa'd As-Sa'idi (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) went to establish peace among Bani 'Amr bin 'Auf. In the meantime the time of prayer was due and the Mu'adh-dhin went to Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) and said, "Will you lead the prayer, so that I may pronounce the Iqama?" Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) replied in the affirmative and led the prayer. Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) came while the people were still praying and he entered the rows of the praying people till he stood in the (first row). The people clapped their hands. Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) never glanced sideways in his prayer but when the people continued clapping, Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) looked and saw Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him). Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) beckoned him to stay at his place. Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) raised his hands and thanked Allah for that order of Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) and then he retreated till he reached the first row. Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) went forward and led the prayer. When Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) finished the prayer, he said, "O Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him)! What prevented you from staying when I ordered you to do so?" Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) replied, "How can Ibn Abi Quhafa (Abu Bakr) (May Allah be pleased with him) dare to lead the prayer in the presence of Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him)?" Then Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Why did you clap so much? If something happens to anyone during his prayer he should say Subhan Allah. If he says so he will be attended to, for clapping is for women."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Malik bin Huwairth (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: We went to Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) and we were all young men and stayed with him for about twenty nights. Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) was very merciful. He said, "When you return home, impart religious teachings to your families and tell them to offer perfectly such and such a prayer at such and such a time and such and such a prayer at such and such a time. And at the time of the prayer one of you should pronounce the Adhan and the oldest of you should lead the prayer."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Itban bin Malik Al-Ansari (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) (came to my house and) asked permission for entering and I allowed him. He asked, "Where do you like me to pray in your house?" I pointed to a place which I liked. He stood up for prayer and we aligned behind him and he finished the prayer with Taslim and we did the same.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Ubaid-Ullah Ibn 'Abdullah bin 'Utba (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I went to 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) and asked her to describe to me the illness of Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him). 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) said, "Yes. Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) became seriously ill and asked whether the people had prayed. We replied, 'No. O Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him)! They are waiting for you.' He added, 'Put water for me in a trough." 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) added, "We did so. He took a bath and tried to get up but fainted. When he recovered, he again asked whether the people had prayed. We said, 'No, they are waiting for you. O Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him),' He again said, 'Put water in a trough for me.' He sat down and took a bath and tried to get up but fainted again. Then he recovered and said, 'Have the people prayed?' We replied, 'No, they are waiting for you. O Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him).' He said, 'Put water for me in the trough.' Then he sat down and washed himself and tried to get up but he fainted. When he recovered, he asked, 'Have the people prayed?' We said, 'No, they are waiting for you. O Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him)! The people were in the mosque waiting for Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) for the 'Isha prayer. Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) sent for Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) to lead the people in the prayer. The messenger went to Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) and said, 'Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) orders you to lead the people in the prayer.' Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) was a soft-hearted man, so he asked 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) to lead the prayer but 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) replied, 'You are more rightful.' So Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) led the prayer in those days. When Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) felt a bit better, he came out for the Zuhr prayer with the help of two persons one of whom was Al-'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him). while Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) was leading the people in the prayer. When Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) saw him he wanted to retreat but Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) beckoned him not to do so and asked them to make him sit beside Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) and they did so. Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) was following Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) (in the prayer) and the people were following Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him). Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) (prayed) sitting." 'Ubaid-Ullah added "I went to 'Abdullah bin 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him) and asked him, Shall I tell you what Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) has told me about the fatal illness of Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him)?' Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him) said, 'Go ahead. I told him her narration and he did not deny anything of it but asked whether 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) told me the name of the second person (who helped Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him)) along with Al-Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him). I said. 'No.' He said, 'He was 'Ali (Ibn Abi Talib) (May Allah be pleased with him).'

hadiths.by: Narrated by Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: The mother of the believers: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) during his illness prayed at his house while sitting whereas some people prayed behind him standing. Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) beckoned them to sit down. On completion of the prayer, he said, 'The Imam is to be followed: bow when he bows, raise up your heads (stand erect) when he raises his head and when he says, 'Sami a-l-lahu liman-hamida ' (Allah heard those who sent praises to Him) say then 'Rabbana wa laka-l-hamd' (O our Lord! All the praises are for You), and if he prays sitting then pray sitting."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Once Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) rode a horse and fell down and the right side (of his body) was injured. He offered one of the prayers while sitting and we also prayed behind him sitting. When he completed the prayer, he said, "The Imam is to be followed. Pray standing if he prays standing and bow when he bows; rise when he rises; and if he says, 'Sami a-l-lahu-liman hamida, say then, 'Rabbana wa Lakal-hamd' and pray standing if he prays standing and pray sitting (all of you) if he prays sitting." Humaid (May Allah be pleased with him) said: The saying of Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) "Pray sitting, if he (Imam) prays sitting" was said in his former illness (during his early life) but Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) prayed sitting afterwards (in the last illness) and the people were praying standing behind him and Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) did not order them to sit. We should follow the latest actions of Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Al-Bara (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: (and he was not a liar) When Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Sami a-l-lahu Liman hamida " none of us bent his back (for prostrations) till Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) prostrated and then we would prostrate after him.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Ishaq (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: as above.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Isn't he who raises his head before the Imam afraid that Allah may transform his head into that of a donkey or his figure (face) into that of a donkey?"

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: When the earliest emigrants came to Al-'Usba a place in Quba', before the arrival of Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) - Salim, the slave of Abu Hudhaifa (May Allah be pleased with him), who knew the Qur'an more than the others used to lead them in prayer.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Listen and obey (your chief) even if an Ethiopian whose head is like a raisin were made your chief."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "If the Imam leads the prayer correctly then he and you will receive the rewards but if he makes a mistake (in the prayer) then you will receive the reward for the prayer and the sin will be his."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said to Abu-Dhar (May Allah be pleased with him), "Listen and obey (your chief) even if he is an Ethiopian with a head like a raisin."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Once I passed the night in the house of my aunt Maimuna (May Allah be pleased with her). Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) offered the 'Isha' prayer and then came to the house and offered four Rakat and slept. Later on, he woke up and stood for the prayer and I stood on his left side. He drew me to his right and prayed five Rakat and then two. He then slept till I heard him snoring (or heard his breath sounds). Afterwards, he went out for the morning prayer.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: One night I slept at the house of (my aunt) Maimuna (May Allah be pleased with her) and Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) was there on that night. He performed ablution and stood up for the prayer. I joined him and stood on his left side but he drew me to his right and prayed thirteen Rakat and then slept till I heard his breath sounds. And whenever he slept, he used to breathe with audible sounds. The Mu'adhdhin came to Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) and he went out and prayed the morning prayer without repeating the ablution.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Once I passed the night in the house of my aunt Maimuna (May Allah be pleased with her). Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) stood for the night prayer and I joined him and stood on his left side but he drew me to his right by holding me by the head.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Mu'adh bin Jabal (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I used to pray the 'Isha prayer with Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) and then go to lead my people in the prayer.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Amr (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Jabir bin 'Abdullah (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "Mu'adh bin Jabal (May Allah be pleased with him) used to pray with Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) and then go to lead his people in prayer. Once he led the 'Isha' prayer and recited Surat 'Al-Baqra.' Somebody left the prayer and Mu'adh (May Allah be pleased with him) criticized him. The news reached Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) and he said to Mu'adh (May Allah be pleased with him), 'You are putting the people to trial,' and repeated it thrice (or said something similar) and ordered him to recite two medium Suras of Mufassal." ('Amr (May Allah be pleased with him) said that he had forgotten the names of those Suras).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Mas'ud (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: A man came and said, "O Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him)! By Allah, I keep away from the morning prayer only because So and so prolongs the prayer when he leads us in it." The narrator said, "I never saw Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) more furious in giving advice than he was at that time. He then said, "Some of you make people dislike good deeds (the prayer). So whoever among you leads the people in prayer should shorten it because among them are the weak, the old and the needy."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "If anyone of you leads the people in the prayer, he should shorten it for amongst them are the weak, the sick and the old; and if anyone among your prays alone then he may prolong (the prayer) as much as he wishes."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Mas'ud (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: A man came and said, "O Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him)! I keep away from the morning prayer because so-and-so (Imam) prolongs it too much." Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) became furious and I had never seen him more furious than he was on that day. Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "O people! Some of you make others dislike the prayer, so whoever becomes an Imam he should shorten the prayer, as behind him are the weak, the old and the needy.''

hadiths.by: Narrated by Jabir bin 'Abdullah Al-Ansari (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Once a man was driving two Nadihas (camels used for agricultural purposes) and night had fallen. He found Mu'adh (May Allah be pleased with him) praying so he made his camel kneel and joined Mu'adh (May Allah be pleased with him) in the prayer. The latter recited Surat 'Al-Baqara' or Surat 'An-Nisa', (so) the man left the prayer and went away. When he came to know that Mu'adh (May Allah be pleased with him) had criticized him, he went to Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him), and complained against Mu'adh (May Allah be pleased with him). Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said thrice, "O Mu'adh (May Allah be pleased with him)! Are you putting the people to trial?" It would have been better if you had recited "Sabbih Isma Rabbika-l-a-la (87)", Wash-Shamsi wadu-haha (91)", or "Wal-laili Idha yaghsha (92)", for the old, the weak and the needy pray behind you." Jabir (May Allah be pleased with him) said that Mu'adh (May Allah be pleased with him) recited Sura Al-Baqara in the 'Isha' prayer.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) used to pray a short prayer (in congregation) but used to offer it in a perfect manner.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdullah bin 'Abi Qatada (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: My father said, "Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'When I stand for prayer, I intend to prolong it but on hearing the cries of a child, I cut it short, as I dislike to trouble the child's mother.'"

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I never prayed behind any Imam a prayer lighter and more perfect than that behind Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) and he used to cut short the prayer whenever he heard the cries of a child lest he should put the child's mother to trial.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "When I start the prayer I intend to prolong it, but on hearing the cries of a child, I cut short the prayer because I know that the cries of the child will incite its mother's passions."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him), said, "Whenever I start the prayer I intend to prolong it, but on hearing the cries of a child, I cut short the prayer because I know that the cries of the child will incite its mother's passions."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Jabir bin 'Abdullah (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Mu'adh (May Allah be pleased with him) used to pray with Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) and then go and lead his people (tribe) in the prayer.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: When Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) became ill in his fatal illness, Someone came to inform him about the prayer, and Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) told him to tell Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) to lead the people in the prayer. I said, "Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) is a soft-hearted man and if he stands for the prayer in your place, he would weep and would not be able to recite the Qur'an." Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Tell Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) to lead the prayer." I said the same as before. He (repeated the same order and) on the third or the fourth time he said, "You are the companions of Joseph. Tell Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) to lead the prayer." So Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) led the prayer and meanwhile Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) felt better and came out with the help of two men; as if I see him just now dragging his feet on the ground. When Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) saw him, he tried to retreat but Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) beckoned him to carry on. Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) retreated a bit and Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) sat on his (left) side. Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) was repeating the Takbir (Allahu Akbar) of Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) for the people to hear.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: When Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) became seriously ill, Bilal (May Allah be pleased with him) came to him for the prayer. He said, "Tell Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) to lead the people in the prayer." I said, "O Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him)! Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) is a soft-hearted man and if he stands in your place, he would not be able to make the people hear him. Will you order 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) (to lead the prayer)?" Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Tell Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) to lead the people in the prayer." Then I said to Hafsa (May Allah be pleased with her), "Tell him, Abu i Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) is a soft-hearted man and if he stands in his place, he would not be able to make the people hear him. Would you order 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) to lead the prayer?' " Hafsa (May Allah be pleased with her) did so. Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Verily you are the companions of Joseph. Tell Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) to lead the people in the prayer." So Abu- Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) stood for the prayer. In the meantime, Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) felt better and came out with the help of two persons and both of his legs were dragging on the ground till he entered the mosque. When Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) heard him coming, he tried to retreat but Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) beckoned him to carry on. Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) sat on his left side. Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) was praying while standing and Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) was leading the prayer while sitting. Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) was following Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) and the people were following Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) (in the prayer).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Once Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) prayed two Rakat (instead of four) and finished his prayer. Dhu-l-yadain asked him whether the prayer had been reduced or whether he had forgotten. Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) asked the people whether Dhu-l-yadain was telling the truth. The people replied in the affirmative. Then Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) stood up, offered the remaining two Rakat and then finished his prayer with Taslim and then said, "Allahu Akbar." He followed it with two prostrations like ordinary prostrations or a bit longer.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) prayed two Rakat of Zuhr prayer (instead of four) and he was told that he had prayed two Rakat only. Then he prayed two more Rakat and finished them with the Taslim followed by two prostrations.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: The mother of the faithful believers: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) in his last illness said, "Tell Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) to lead the people in the prayer." I said, "If Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) stood in your place, he would not be able to make the people hear him owing to his weeping. So please order 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) to lead the prayer." He said, "Tell Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) to lead the people in the prayer." I said to Hafsa (May Allah be pleased with her), "Say to him, 'Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) is a softhearted man and if he stood in your place he would not be able to make the people hear him owing to his weeping. So order 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) to lead the people in the prayer.' " Hafsa (May Allah be pleased with her) did so but Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Keep quiet. Verily you are the companions of (Prophet) Joseph. Tell Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) to lead the people in the prayer." Hafsa (May Allah be pleased with her) said to me, "I never got any good from you."

hadiths.by: Narrated by An-Nu'man bin 'Bashir (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Straighten your rows or Allah will alter your faces."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Straighten your rows, for I see you from behind my back.'

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Once the Iqama was pronounced and Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) faced us and said, "Straighten your rows and stand closer together, for I see you from behind my back.'

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Martyrs are those who die because of drowning, plague, an abdominal disease, or of being buried alive by a falling building." And then he added, "If the people knew the Reward for the Zuhr prayer in its early time, they would race for it. If they knew the reward for the 'Isha' and the Fajr prayers in congregation, they would join them even if they had to crawl. If they knew the reward for the first row, they would draw lots for it."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "The Imam is (appointed) to be followed. So do not differ from him, bow when he bows, and say, "Rabbana-lakal hamd" if he says "Sami'a-l-lahu Liman hamida"; and if he prostrates, prostrate (after him), and if he prays sitting, pray sitting all together, and straighten the rows for the prayer, as the straightening of the rows is amongst those things which make your prayer a correct and perfect one. (See Hadith No. 657).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Straighten your rows as the straightening of rows is essential for a perfect and correct prayer."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I arrived at Medina and was asked whether I found any change since the days of Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him). I said, "I have not found any change except that you do not stand in alignment in your prayers."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Straighten your rows for I see you from behind my back." Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) added, "Everyone of us used to put his shoulder with the shoulder of his companion and his foot with the foot of his companion."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I prayed with Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) one night and stood on his left side. Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) caught hold of my head from behind and drew me to his right and then offered the prayer and slept. Later the Mu'adh-dhin came and Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) stood up for prayer without performing ablution.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: One night an orphan and I offered the prayers behind Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) in my house and my mother (Um Sulaim) (May Allah be pleased with her) was standing behind us (by herself forming a row).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: One night I stood to the left of Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) in the prayer but he caught hold of me by the hand or by the shoulder (arm) till he made me stand on his right and beckoned with his hand (for me) to go from behind (him). (Al-Kashmaihani-Fateh al-Bari).

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) used to pray in his room at night. As the wall of the room was LOW, the people saw him and some of them stood up to follow him in the prayer. In the morning they spread the news. The following night Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) stood for the prayer and the people followed him. This went on for two or three nights. Thereupon Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) did not stand for the prayer the following night, and did not come out. In the morning, the people asked him about it. He replied, that he was afraid that the night prayer might become compulsory.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) had a mat which he used to spread during the day and use as a curtain at night. So a number of people gathered at night facing it and prayed behind him.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Zaid bin Thabit (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) made a small room in the month of Ramadan (Sa'id said, "I think that Zaid bin Thabit (May Allah be pleased with him) said that it was made of a mat") and he prayed there for a few nights, and so some of his companions prayed behind him. When he came to know about it, he kept on sitting. In the morning, he went out to them and said, "I have seen and understood what you did. You should pray in your houses, for the best prayer of a person is that which he prays in his house except the compulsory prayers."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik Al-Ansari (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) rode a horse and fell down and the right side of his body was injured. On that day he prayed one of the prayers sitting and we also prayed behind him sitting. When Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) finished the prayer with Taslim, he said, "The Imam is to be followed and if he prays standing then pray standing, and bow when he bows, and raise your heads when he raises his head; prostrate when he prostrates; and if he says "Sami'a-l-lahu Liman hamida", you should say, "Rabbana wa-laka-l hamd."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) fell from a horse and got injured so he led the prayer sitting and we also prayed sitting. When he completed the prayer he said, "The Imam is to be followed; if he says Takbir then say Takbir, bow if he bows; raise your heads when he raises his head, when he says, 'Sami' a-l-lahu Liman hamida say, 'Rabbana laka-l-hamd', and prostrate when he prostrates."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "The Imam is to be followed. Say the Takbir when he says it; bow if he bows; if he says 'Sami a-l-lahu Liman hamida', say, 'Rabbana wa-laka-l-hamd', prostrate if he prostrates and pray sitting altogether if he prays sitting."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Salim bin 'Abdullah (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: My father said, "Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) used to raise both his hands up to the level of his shoulders when opening the prayer; and on saying the Takbir for bowing. And on raising his head from bowing he used to do the same and then say "Sami a-l-lahu Liman hamida, Rabbana walaka-l-hamd." And he did not do that (i.e. raising his hands) in prostrations.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdullah bin 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I saw that whenever Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) stood for the prayer, he used to raise both his hands up to the shoulders, and used to do the same on saying the Takbir for bowing and on raising his head from it and used to say, "Sami a-l-lahu Liman hamida". But he did not do that (i.e. raising his hands) in prostrations.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Qilaba (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I saw Malik bin Huwairith (May Allah be pleased with him) saying Takbir and raising both his hands (on starting the prayers and raising his hands on bowing and also on raising his head after bowing. Malik bin Huwairith (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) did the same."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdullah bin 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I saw Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) opening the prayer with the Takbir and raising his hands to the level of his shoulders at the time of saying the Takbir, and on saying the Takbir for bowing he did the same; and when he said, "Sami a-l-lahu Liman hamida", he did the same and then said, "Rabbana wa laka-l-hamd." But he did not do the same on prostrating and on lifting the head from it."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Nafi' (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Whenever Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) started the prayer with Takbir, he used to raise his hands: whenever he bowed, he used to raise his hands (before bowing) and also used to raise his hands on saying, "Sami a-l-lahu Liman hamida", and he used to do the same on rising from the second Rak'a (for the 3rd Rak'a). Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) said: "Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) used to do the same."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Sahl bin Sa'd (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The people were ordered to place the right hand on the left forearm in the prayer. Abu Hazim (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "I knew that the order was from Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "You see me facing the Qibla; but, by Allah, nothing is hidden from me regarding your bowing and submissiveness and I see you from behind my back."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Perform the bowing and the prostrations properly. By Allah, I see you from behind me (or from behind my back) when you bow or prostrate."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him), Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) and 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) used to start the prayer with "Al-hamdu lil-lahi Rabbil-'ala-min (All praises are for Allah the Lord of the Worlds)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) used to keep silent between the Takbir and the recitation of Qur'an and that interval of silence used to be a short one. I said to Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him), "May my parents be sacrificed for you! What do you say in the pause between Takbir and recitation?" Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "I say, 'Allahumma, ba'id baini wa baina khatayaya kama ba'adta baina-l-mashriqi wa-l-maghrib. Allahumma, naqqim min khatayaya kama yunaqqa-ththawbu-l-abyadu mina-ddanas. Allahumma, ighsil khatayaya bil-ma'i wa-th-thalji wal-barad (O Allah! Set me apart from my sins (faults) as the East and West are set apart from each other and clean me from sins as a white garment is cleaned of dirt (after thorough washing). O Allah! Wash off my sins with water, snow and hail.)'"

hadiths.by: Narrated by Asma' bint Abi Bakr (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) once offered the eclipse prayer. He stood for a long time and then did a prolonged bowing. He stood up straight again and kept on standing for a long time, then bowed a long bowing and then stood up straight and then prostrated a prolonged prostration and then lifted his head and prostrated a prolonged prostration. And then he stood up for a long time and then did a prolonged bowing and then stood up straight again and kept on standing for a long time. Then he bowed a long bowing and then stood up straight and then prostrated a prolonged prostration and then lifted his head and went for a prolonged prostration. On completion of the prayer, he said, "Paradise became so near to me that if I had dared, I would have plucked one of its bunches for you and Hell became so near to me that I said, 'O my Lord will I be among those people?' Then suddenly I saw a woman and a cat was lacerating her with its claws. On inquiring, it was said that the woman had imprisoned the cat till it died of starvation and she neither fed it no freed it so that it could feed itself."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Ma'mar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: We asked Khabbab (May Allah be pleased with him) whether Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) used to recite (the Qur'an) in the Zuhr and the 'Asr prayers. He replied in the affirmative. We said, "How did you come to know about it?" He said, "By the movement of his beard."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Al-Bara (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: (And Al-Bara (May Allah be pleased with him) was not a liar) Whenever we offered prayer with Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) and he raised his head from the bowing, we used to remain standing till we saw him prostrating.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdullah bin 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Once a solar eclipse occurred during the lifetime of Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him). He offered the eclipse prayer. His companions asked, "O Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him)! We saw you trying to take something while standing at your place and then we saw you retreating." Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "I was shown Paradise and wanted to have a bunch of fruit from it. Had I taken it, you would have eaten from it as long as the world remains."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) led us in prayer and then went up to the pulpit and beckoned with both hands towards the Qibla of the mosque and then said, "When I started leading you in prayer, I saw the display of Paradise and Hell on the wall of the mosque (facing the Qibla). I never saw good and bad as I have seen today." He repeated the last statement thrice.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "What is wrong with those people who look towards the sky during the prayer?" His talk grew stern while delivering this speech and he said, "They should stop (looking towards the sky during the prayer); otherwise their eyesight would be taken away."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: I asked Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) about looking hither and thither in prayer. He replied, "It is a way of stealing by which Satan takes away (a portion) from the prayer of a person."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: Once Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) prayed on a Khamisa with marks on it and said, "The marks on it diverted my attention; take this Khamisa to Abu Jahm (May Allah be pleased with him) and bring an Inbijaniya (from him)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) saw expectoration in the direction of the Qibla of the mosque while he was leading the prayer, and scratched it off. After finishing the prayer, he said, "Whenever any of you is in prayer he should know that Allah is in front of him. So none should spit in front of him in the prayer."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: While the Muslims were offering the Fajr prayer, Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) suddenly appeared before them by lifting the curtain of the dwelling place of 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her), looked towards the Muslims who were standing in rows. He smiled with pleasure. Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) started retreating to join the row on the assumption that Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) wanted to come out for the prayer. The Muslims intended to leave the prayer (and were on the verge of being put to trial), but Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) beckoned them to complete their prayer and then he let the curtain fall. He died in the last hours of that day.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Jabir bin Samura (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The People of Kufa complained against Sa'd (May Allah be pleased with him) to 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) and the latter dismissed him and appointed 'Ammar (May Allah be pleased with him) as their chief. They lodged many complaints against Sa'd (May Allah be pleased with him) and even they alleged that he did not pray properly. 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) sent for him and said, "O Aba Ishaq! These people claim that you do not pray properly." Abu Ishaq said, "By Allah, I used to pray with them a prayer similar to that of Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) and I never reduced anything of it. I used to prolong the first two Rakat of 'Isha prayer and shorten the last two Rakat." 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "O Aba Ishaq, this was what I thought about you." And then he sent one or more persons with him to Kufa so as to ask the people about him. So they went there and did not leave any mosque without asking about him. All the people praised him till they came to the mosque of the tribe of Bani 'Abs; one of the men called Usama bin Qatada with a surname of Aba Sa'da stood up and said, "As you have put us under an oath; I am bound to tell you that Sa'd (May Allah be pleased with him) never went himself with the army and never distributed (the war booty) equally and never did justice in legal verdicts." (On hearing it) Sa'd (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "I pray to Allah for three things: O Allah! If this slave of yours is a liar and got up for showing off, give him a long life, increase his poverty and put him to trials." (And so it happened). Later on when that person was asked how he was, he used to reply that he was an old man in trial as the result of Sa'd's curse. 'Abdul Malik, the sub narrator, said that he had seen him afterwards and his eyebrows were over-hanging his eyes owing to old age and he used to tease and assault the small girls in the way.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Ubada bin As-Samit (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Whoever does not recite Al-Fatiha in his prayer, his prayer is invalid."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) entered the mosque and a person followed him. The man prayed and went to Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) and greeted him. Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) returned the greeting and said to him, "Go back and pray, for you have not prayed." The man went back prayed in the same way as before, returned and greeted Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) who said, "Go back and pray, for you have not prayed." This happened thrice. The man said, "By Him Who sent you with the Truth, I cannot offer the prayer in a better way than this. Please, teach me how to pray." Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "When you stand for Prayer say Takbir and then recite from the Holy Qur'an (of what you know by heart) and then bow till you feel at ease. Then raise your head and stand up straight, then prostrate till you feel at ease during your prostration, then sit with calmness till you feel at ease (do not hurry) and do the same in all your prayers."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Jabir bin Samura (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Sa'd (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "I used to pray with them a prayer similar to that of Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) (the prayer of Zuhr and 'Asr) reducing nothing from them. I used to prolong the first two Rakat and shorten the last two Rak'at." 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) said to Sa'd (May Allah be pleased with him), "This was what we thought about you."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdullah bin Abi Qatada (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: My father said, "Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) in Zuhr prayers used to recite Al-Fatiha along with two other Suras in the first two Rakat: a long one in the first Rak'a and a shorter (Sura) in the second, and at times the verses were audible. In the 'Asr prayer Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) used to recite Al-Fatiha and two more Suras in the first two Rakat and used to prolong the first Rak'a. And he used to prolong the first Rak'a of the Fajr prayer and shorten the second."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Ma'mar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I asked Khabbab (May Allah be pleased with him) whether Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) used to recite the Qur'an in the Zuhr and the 'Asr prayers. He replied in the affirmative. We said, "How did you come to know about it?" He said, "By the movement of his beard."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Ma'mar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I asked Khabbab bin Al-Art (May Allah be pleased with him) whether Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) used to recite the Qur'an in the Zuhr and the 'Asr prayers. He replied in the affirmative. I said, "How did you come to know that?" He replied, "From the movement of his beard."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdullah bin Abi Qatada (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: My father said, "Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) used to recite Al-Fatiha along with another Sura in the first two Rakat of the Zuhr and the 'Asr prayers and at times a verse or so was audible to us."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: (My mother) Umu-l-Fadl (May Allah be pleased with her) heard me reciting "Wal Mursalati 'Urfan" (77) and said, "O my son! By Allah, your recitation made me remember that it was the last Sura I heard from Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him). He recited it in the Maghrib prayer."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Marwan bin Al-Hakam (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Zaid bin Thabit (May Allah be pleased with him) said to me, "Why do you recite very short S&ras in the Maghrib prayer while I heard Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) reciting the longer of the two long Suras?"

hadiths.by: Narrated by Jubair bin Mut'im (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: My father said, "I heard Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) reciting "At-Tur" (52) in the Maghrib prayer."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Rafi (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I offered the 'Isha' prayer behind Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him) and he recited, "Idha-s-Sama'u-n-Shaqqat" (84) and prostrated. On my inquiring, he said, "I prostrated behind Abu-l-Qasim (Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him)) (when he recited that Sura) and I will go on doing it till I meet him."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Al-Bara (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) was on a journey and recited in one of the first two Rakat of the 'Isha' prayer "Wat-tini waz-zaituni." (95)

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Rafi' (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Once I prayed the 'Isha' prayer with Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him) and he recited, "Idha-s-Sama' u-nShaqqat" (84) and prostrated. I said, "What is that?" He said, "I prostrated behind Abu-l-Qasim, (Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him)) (when he recited that Sura) and I will go on doing it till I meet him."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Al-Bara (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I heard Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) reciting "Wat-tini wazzaituni" (95) in the 'Isha' prayer, and I never heard a sweeter voice or a better way of recitation than that of Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Jabir bin Samura (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) said to Sa'd (May Allah be pleased with him), "The people complained against you in everything, even in prayer." Sa'd (May Allah be pleased with him) replied, "Really I used to prolong the first two Rakat and shorten the last two and I will never shorten the prayer in which I follow Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him)." 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "You are telling the truth and that is what I think about you."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Saiyar bin Salama (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: My father and I went to Abu Barza-al-Aslami (May Allah be pleased with him) to ask him about the stated times for the prayers. He replied, "Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) used to offer the Zuhr prayer when the sun just declined from its highest position at noon; the 'Asr at a time when if a man went to the farthest place in Medina (after praying) he would find the sun still hot (bright). (The sub narrator said: I have forgotten what Abu Barza (May Allah be pleased with him) said about the Maghrib prayer). Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) never found any harm in delaying the 'Isha' prayer to the first third of the night and he never liked to sleep before it and to talk after it. He used to offer the morning prayer at a time when after finishing it one could recognize the person sitting beside him and used to recite between 60 to 100 verses in one or both the Rakat."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Qur'an is recited in every prayer and in those prayers in which Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) recited aloud for us, we recite aloud in the same prayers for you; and the prayers in which Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) recited quietly, we recite quietly. If you recite "Al-Fatiha" only it is sufficient but if you recite something else in addition, it is better.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) set out with the intention of going to Suq 'Ukaz (market of 'Ukaz) along with some of his companions. At the same time, a barrier was put between the devils and the news of heaven. Fire commenced to be thrown at them. The Devils went to their people, who asked them, "What is wrong with you?" They said, "A barrier has been placed between us and the news of heaven. And fire has been thrown at us." They said, "The thing which has put a barrier between you and the news of heaven must be something which has happened recently. Go eastward and westward and see what has put a barrier between you and the news of heaven." Those who went towards Tuhama came across Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) at a place called Nakhla and it was on the way to Suq 'Ukaz and Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) was offering the Fajr prayer with his companions. When they heard the Qur'an they listened to it and said, "By Allah, this is the thing which has put a barrier between us and the news of heaven." They went to their people and said, "O our people; verily we have heard a wonderful recital (Qur'an) which shows the true path; we believed in it and would not ascribe partners to our Lord." Allah revealed the following verses to his Prophet (Sura 'Jinn') (72): "Say: It has been revealed to me." And what was revealed to him was the conversation of the Jinns.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) recited aloud in the prayers in which he was ordered to do so and quietly in the prayers in which he was ordered to do so. "And your Lord is not forgetful." "Verily there was a good example for you in the ways of Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Wa'il (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: A man came to Ibn Mas'ud (May Allah be pleased with him) and said, "I recited the Mufassal (Suras) at night in one Rak'a." Ibn Mas'ud (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "This recitation is (too quick) like the recitation of poetry. I know the identical Suras which Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) used to recite in pairs." Ibn Mas'ud (May Allah be pleased with him) then mentioned 20 Mufassal Suras including two Suras from the family of (i.e., those verses which begin with) AL, HA, MIM (which Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) used to recite) in each Rak'a.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdullah bin Abi Qatada (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: My father said, "Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) used to recite Al-Fatiha followed by another Sura in the first two Rakat of the prayer and used to recite only Al-Fatiha in the last two Rakat of the Zuhr prayer. Sometimes a verse or so was audible and he used to prolong the first Rak'a more than the second and used to do the same in the 'Asr and Fajr prayers."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Ma'mar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: We said to Khabbab (May Allah be pleased with him) "Did Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) used to recite in Zuhr and 'Asr prayers?" He replied in the affirmative. We said, "How did you come to know about it?" He said, "By the movement of his beard."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdullah bin Abi Qatada (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: My father said, "Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) used to recite Al-Fatiha along with another Sura in the first two Rakat of the Zuhr and 'Asr prayers. A verse or so was audible at times and he used to prolong the first Rak'a."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdullah bin Abi Qatada (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: My father said, "Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) used to prolong the first Rak'a of the Zuhr prayer and shorten the second one and used to do the same in the Fajr prayer."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Say Amin" when the Imam says it and if the Amin of any one of you coincides with that of the angels then all his past sins will be forgiven." Ibn Shihab (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) used to Say "Amin."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "If any one of you says, "Amin" and the angels in the heavens say "Amin" and the former coincides with the latter, all his past sins will be forgiven."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Say Amen' when the Imam says "Ghair-il-maghdubi 'alaihim wala-ddal-lin; not the path of those who earn Your Anger (such as Jews) nor of those who go astray (such as Christians); all the past sins of the person whose saying (of Amin) coincides with that of the angels, will be forgiven.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Bakra (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I reached Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) in the mosque while he was bowing in prayer and I too bowed before joining the row mentioned it to Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) and he said to me, "May Allah increase your love for the good. But do not repeat it again (bowing in that way)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Imran bin Husain (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I offered the prayer with 'Ali (May Allah be pleased with him) in Basra and he made us remember the prayer which we used to pray with Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him). 'Ali (May Allah be pleased with him) said Takbir on each rising and bowing.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Salama (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: When Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him) led us in prayer he used to say Takbir on each bowing and rising. On the completion of the prayer he used to say, "My prayer is more similar to the prayer of Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) than that of anyone of you."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Mutarrif bin 'Abdullah (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: 'Imran bin Husain (May Allah be pleased with him) and I offered the prayer behind Ali bin Abi Talib (May Allah be pleased with him). When 'Ali (May Allah be pleased with him) prostrated, he said the Takbir, when he raised his head, he said the Takbir and when he got up for the third Rak'a he said the Takbir. On completion of the prayer Imran took my hand and said, "This (i.e. 'Ali) made me remember the prayer of Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him)" Or he said, "He led us in a prayer like that of Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Ikrima (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I saw a person praying at Muqam-lbrahim (the place of Abraham by the Ka'ba) and he was saying Takbir on every bowing, rising, standing and sitting. I asked Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him) (about this prayer). He admonished me saying: "Isn't that the prayer of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)?"

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Ikrima (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I prayed behind a Sheikh at Mecca and he said twenty two Takbirs (during the prayer). I told Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him) that he (i.e. that Sheikh) was foolish. Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him) admonished me and said, "This is the tradition of Abu-l-Qasim (Peace Be Upon Him)." And narrated Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him): Whenever Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) stood for the prayer, he said Takbir on starting the prayer and then on bowing. On rising from bowing he said, "Sami'a-l-lahu liman hamida," and then while standing straight he used to say, "Rabbana laka-l hamd" (Al-Laith said, "(The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said), 'Walaka-l-hamd'." He used to say Takbir on prostrating and on raising his head from prostration; again he would say Takbir on prostrating and raising his head. He would then do the same in the whole of the prayer till it was completed. On rising from the second Rak'a (after sitting for At-Tahiyyat), he used to say Takbir.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Mus'ab bin Sa'd (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I offered prayer beside my father and approximated both my hands and placed them in between the knees. My father told me not to do so and said, "We used to do the same but we were forbidden (by the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)) to do it and were ordered to place the hands on the knees."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Zaid bin Wahb (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Hudhaifa (May Allah be pleased with him) saw a person who was not performing the bowing and prostrations perfectly. He said to him, "You have not prayed and if you should die you would die on a religion other than that of Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Al-Bara' (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The bowing, the prostration the sitting in between the two prostrations and the standing after the bowing of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) but not Qiyam (standing in the prayer) and Qu'ud (sitting in the prayer) used to be approximately equal (in duration).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Once the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) entered the mosque, a man came in, offered the prayer and greeted the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him). The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) returned his greeting and said to him, "Go back and pray again for you have not prayed." The man offered the prayer again, came back and greeted the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him). He said to him thrice, "Go back and pray again for you have not prayed." The man said, "By Him Who has sent you with the truth! I do not know a better way of praying. Kindly teach me how to pray." He said, "When you stand for the prayer, say Takbir and then recite from the Qur'an what you know and then bow with calmness till you feel at ease, then rise from bowing till you stand straight. Afterwards prostrate calmly till you feel at ease and then raise (your head) and sit with calmness till you feel at ease and then prostrate with calmness till you feel at ease in prostration and do the same in the whole of your prayer."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) used to say in his bowing and prostrations, "Subhanaka-Allahumma Rabbana wa-bihamdika Allahumma-ighfirli.' (I honor Allah from all what (unsuitable things) is ascribed to Him. O Allah Our Lord! And all the praises are for You. O Allah! Forgive me)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: When the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Sami' a-l-lahu Liman hamida," (Allah heard those who sent praises to Him), he would say, "Rabbana wa-laka-l-hamd." On bowing and raising his head from it the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) used to say Takbir. He also used to say Takbir on rising after the two prostrations.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "When the Imam says, "Sami' a-l-lahu Liman hamida," you should say, "Allahumma Rabbana laka-l-hamd." And if the saying of any one of you coincides with that of the angels, all his past sins will be forgiven."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Qunut used to be recited in the Maghrib and the Fajr prayers.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Rifa'a bin Rafi AzZuraqi (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: One day we were praying behind the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him). When he raised his head from bowing, he said, "Sami'a-l-lahu Liman hamida." A man behind him said, "Rabbana walaka-l hamd hamdan Kathiran taiyiban mubarakan fihi" (O our Lord! All the praises are for You, many good and blessed praises). When the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) completed the prayer, he asked, "Who has said these words?" The man replied, "I." The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "I saw over thirty angels competing to write it first." Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) rose (from bowing) and stood straight till all the vertebrae of his spinal column came to a natural position.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Thabit (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) used to demonstrate to us the prayer of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and while demonstrating, he used to raise his head from bowing and stand so long that we would say that he had forgotten (the prostration).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Al-Bara' (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The bowing, the prostrations, the period of standing after bowing and the interval between the two prostrations of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) used to be equal in duration.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Aiyub (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Abu Qilaba (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "Malik bin Huwairith (May Allah be pleased with him) used to demonstrate to us the prayer of the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) at times other than that of the compulsory prayers. So (once) he stood up for prayer and performed a perfect Qiyam (standing and reciting from the Holy Qur'an) and then bowed and performed bowing perfectly; then he raised his head and stood straight for a while." Abu Qilaba (May Allah be pleased with him) added, "Malik bin Huwairith (May Allah be pleased with him) in that demonstration prayed like this Sheikh of ours, Abu Yazid (May Allah be pleased with him)." Abu, Yazid (May Allah be pleased with him) used to sit (for a while) on raising his head from the second prostration before getting up.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Bakr bin 'Abdur Rahman Ibn Harith bin Hisham and Abu Salama bin 'Abdur Rahman (May Allah be pleased with them)
hadiths.text: Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him) used to say Takbir in all the prayers, compulsory and optional -- in the month of Ramadan or other months. He used to say Takbir on standing for prayer and on bowing; then he would say, "Salmi'a-l-lahu Liman hamida," and before prostrating he would say "Rabbana walaka-l-hamd." Then he would say Takbir on prostrating and on raising his head from the prostration, then another Takbir on prostrating (for the second time), and on raising his head from the prostration. He also would say the Takbir on standing from the second Rak'a. He used to do the same in every Rak'a till he completed the prayer. On completion of the prayer, he would say, "By Him in Whose Hands my soul is! No doubt my prayer is closer to that of Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) than yours, and this was His prayer till he left this world." And Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "When Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) raised his head from (bowing) he used to say "Sami' a-l-lahu Liman hamida, Rabbana walakal-hamd." He Would invoke Allah for some people by naming them: "O Allah! Save Al-Walid bin Al-Walid and Salama bin Hisham and 'Aiyash bin Abi Rabi'a and the weak and the helpless people among the faithful believers O Allah! Be hard on the tribe of Mudar and let them suffer from famine years like that of the time of Joseph." In those days the Eastern section of the tribe of Mudar was against the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) fell from a horse and the right side of his body was injured. We went to enquire about his health meanwhile it was time for the prayer and he led the prayer sitting and we also prayed while sitting. On completion of the prayer he said, "The Imam is to be followed; say Takbir when he says it; bow when he bows; rise when he rises and when he says "Sami'a-l-lahu Liman hamida," say, "Rabbana walaka-lhamd", and prostrate if he prostrates." Sufyan narrated the same from Ma'mar. Ibn Juraij said that his (the Prophet's) right leg had been injured.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The people said, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him)! Shall we see our Lord on the Day of Resurrection?" He replied, "Do you have any doubt in seeing the full moon on a clear (not cloudy) night?" They replied, "No, O Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him)!" He said, "Do you have any doubt in seeing the sun when there are no clouds?" They replied in the negative. He said, "You will see Allah (your Lord) in the same way. On the Day of Resurrection, people will be gathered and He will order the people to follow what they used to worship. So some of them will follow the sun, some will follow the moon, and some will follow other deities; and only this nation (Muslims) will be left with its hypocrites. Allah will come to them and say, 'I am Your Lord.' They will say, 'We shall stay in this place till our Lord comes to us and when our Lord will come, we will recognize Him. Then Allah will come to them again and say, 'I am your Lord.' They will say, 'You are our Lord.' Allah will call them, and As-Sirat (a bridge) will be laid across Hell and I (Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him)) shall be the first amongst the Apostles to cross it with my followers. Nobody except the Apostles will then be able to speak and they will be saying then, 'O Allah! Save us. O Allah Save us.' There will be hooks like the thorns of Sa'dan in Hell. Have you seen the thorns of Sa'dan?" The people said, "Yes." He said, "These hooks will be like the thorns of Sa'dan but nobody except Allah knows their greatness in size and these will entangle the people according to their deeds; some of them will fall and stay in Hell forever; others will receive punishment (torn into small pieces) and will get out of Hell, till when Allah intends mercy on whomever He likes amongst the people of Hell, He will order the angels to take out of Hell those who worshipped none but Him alone. The angels will take them out by recognizing them from the traces of prostrations, for Allah has forbidden the (Hell) fire to eat away those traces. So they will come out of the Fire, it will eat away from the whole of the human body except the marks of the prostrations. At that time they will come out of the Fire as mere skeletons. The Water of Life will be poured on them and as a result they will grow like the seeds growing on the bank of flowing water. Then when Allah had finished from the Judgments amongst his creations, one man will be left between Hell and Paradise and he will be the last man from the people of Hell to enter paradise. He will be facing Hell, and will say, 'O Allah! Turn my face from the fire as its wind has dried me and its steam has burnt me.' Allah will ask him, "Will you ask for anything more in case this favor is granted to you?' He will say, "No by Your (Honor) Power!" And he will give to his Lord (Allah) what he will of the pledges and the covenants. Allah will then turn his face from the Fire. When he will face Paradise and will see its charm, he will remain quiet as long as Allah will. He then will say, 'O my Lord! Let me go to the gate of Paradise.' Allah will ask him, 'Didn't you give pledges and make covenants (to the effect) that you would not ask for anything more than what you requested at first?' He will say, 'O my Lord! Do not make me the most wretched, amongst Your creatures.' Allah will say, 'If this request is granted, will you then ask for anything else?' He will say, 'No! By Your Power! I shall not ask for anything else.' Then he will give to his Lord what He will of the pledges and the covenants. Allah will then let him go to the gate of Paradise. On reaching then and seeing its life, charm, and pleasure, he will remain quiet as long as Allah wills and then will say, 'O my Lord ! Let me enter Paradise.' Allah will say, May Allah be merciful unto you, O son of Adam! How treacherous you are! Haven't you made covenants and given pledges that you will not ask for anything more that what you have been given?' He will say, 'O my Lord! Do not make me the most wretched amongst Your creatures.' So Allah will laugh and allow him to enter Paradise and will ask him to request as much as he likes. He will do so till all his desires have been fulfilled. Then Allah will say, 'Request more of such and such things.' Allah will remind him and when all his desires and wishes have been fulfilled, Allah will say "All this is granted to you and a similar amount besides." Abu Said Al-Khudri said to Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with them), 'Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Allah said, 'That is for you and ten times more like it.' "Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "I do not remember from Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) except (his saying), 'All this is granted to you and a similar amount besides." Abu Sahd said, "I heard him saying, 'That is for you and ten times more the like of it."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdullah bin Malik bin Buhaina (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Whenever the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) used to offer prayer he used to keep arms away (from the body) so that the whiteness of his armpits was visible.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Wail (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Hudhaifa (May Allah be pleased with him) saw a person who was not performing his bowing and prostrations perfectly. When he completed the prayer, I told him that he had not prayed. I think that Hudhaifa (May Allah be pleased with him) added (i.e. said to the man), "Had you died, you would have died on a tradition other than that of the Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) was ordered (by Allah) to prostrate on seven parts and not to tuck up the clothes or hair (while praying). Those parts are: the forehead (along with the tip of nose), both hands, both knees, and (toes of) both feet.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "We have been ordered to prostrate on seven bones and not to tuck up the clothes or hair."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Al-Bara' bin 'Azib (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: (and he was not a liar) We used to pray behind the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) and when he said, "Sami' a-l-lahu Liman hamida", none of us would bend his back (to go for prostration) till the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) had placed his forehead on the ground.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "I have been ordered to prostrate on seven bones i.e. on the forehead along with the tip of the nose and the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) pointed towards his nose, both hands, both knees and the toes of both feet and not to gather the clothes or the hair."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Salama (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Once I went to Abu- Sa'id Al-Khudri (May Allah be pleased with him) and asked him, "Won't you come with us to the date-palm trees to have a talk?" So Abu Said (May Allah be pleased with him) went out and I asked him, "Tell me what you heard from the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) about the Night of Qadr." Abu Said (May Allah be pleased with him) replied, "Once Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) performed I'tikaf (seclusion) on the first ten days of the month of Ramadan and we did the same with him. Gabriel came to him and said, 'The night you are looking for is ahead of you.' So the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) performed the I'tikaf in the middle (second) ten days of the month of Ramadan and we too performed I'tikaf with him. Gabriel came to him and said, 'The night which you are looking for is ahead of you.' In the morning of the 20th of Ramadan the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) delivered a sermon saying, 'Whoever has performed I'tikaf with me should continue it. I have been shown the Night of "Qadr", but have forgotten its date, but it is in the odd nights of the last ten nights. I saw in my dream that I was prostrating in mud and water.' In those days the roof of the mosque was made of branches of date-palm trees. At that time the sky was clear and no cloud was visible, but suddenly a cloud came and it rained. The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) led us in the prayer and I saw the traces of mud on the forehead and on the nose of Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him). So it was the confirmation of that dream."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Sahl bin Sa'd (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The people used to pray with the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) tying their Izars around their necks because of their small sizes and the women were directed that they should not raise their heads from the prostrations till the men had sat straight.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) was ordered to prostrate on seven bony parts and not to tuck up his clothes or hair.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "I have been ordered to prostrate on seven (bones) and not to tuck up the hair or garment."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) used to say frequently in his bowing and prostrations "Subhanaka-Allahumma Rabbana Wabihamdika, Allahumma Ighfir-li" (I honor Allah from all what (unsuitable things) is ascribed to Him, O Allah! Our Lord! All praises are for You. O Allah! Forgive me). In this way he was acting on what was explained to him in the Holy Qur'an.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Qilaba (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Once Malik bin Huwairith (May Allah be pleased with him) said to his friends, "Shall I show you how Allah's Apostle (Peace Be Upon Him) used to offer his prayers?" And it was not the time for any of the compulsory congregational prayers. So he stood up (for the prayer) bowed and said the Takbir, then he raised his head and remained standing for a while and then prostrated and raised his head for a while (sat up for a while). He prayed like our Sheikh 'Amr Ibn Salama. (Aiyub said, "The latter used to do a thing which I did not see the people doing i.e. he used to sit between the third and the fourth Rak'a). IMalik bin Huwairith (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "We came to the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) (after embracing Islam) and stayed with him. He said to us, 'When you go back to your families, pray such and such a prayer at such and such a time, pray such and such a prayer at such and such a time, and when there is the time for the prayer then only of you should pronounce the Adhan for the prayer and the oldest of you should lead the prayer."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Al-Bara' (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The time taken by the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) in prostrations, bowing, and the sitting interval between the two prostrations was about the same.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Thabit (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "I will leave no stone unturned in making you offer the prayer as I have seen the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) making us offer it." Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) used to do a thing which I have not seen you doing. He used to stand after the bowing for such a long time that one would think that he had forgotten (the prostrations) and he used to sit in-between the prostrations so long that one would think that he had forgotten the second prostration.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, "Be straight in the prostrations and none of you should put his forearms on the ground (in the prostration) like a dog."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Malik bin Huwairith Al-Laithi (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I saw the Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) praying and in the odd Rakat, he used to sit for a moment before getting up.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Aiyub (May Allah be pleased with him)
