hadiths.text: On 'Id ul Fitr or 'Id ul Adha Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) went out to the Musalla. After finishing the prayer, he delivered the sermon and ordered the people to give alms. He said, "O people! Give alms." Then he went towards the women and said. "O women! Give alms, for I have seen that the majority of the dwellers of Hell-Fire were you (women)." The women asked, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him)! What is the reason for it?" He replied, "O women! You curse frequently, and are ungrateful to your husbands. I have not seen anyone more deficient in intelligence and religion than you. O women, some of you can lead a cautious wise man astray." Then he left. And when he reached his house, Zainab, the wife of Ibn Mas'ud (May Allah be pleased with her), came and asked permission to enter. It was said, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him)! It is Zainab." He asked, 'Which Zainab?" The reply was that she was the wife of Ibn Mas'ud (May Allah be pleased with him). He said, "Yes, allow her to enter." And she was admitted. Then she said, "O Prophet of Allah (Peace be upon him)! Today you ordered people to give alms and I had an ornament and intended to give it as alms, but Ibn Mas'ud (May Allah be pleased with him) said that he and his children deserved it more than anybody else." The Prophet (Peace be upon him) replied, "Ibn Mas'ud (May Allah be pleased with him) had spoken the truth. Your husband and your children had more right to it than anybody else."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) said, "There is no Zakat either on a horse or a slave belonging to a Muslim."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said,"There is no Zakat either on a slave or on a horse belonging to a Muslim."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Said Al-Khudri (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Once the Prophet (Peace be upon him) sat on a pulpit and we sat around him. Then he said, "The things I am afraid of most for your sake (concerning what will befall you after me) is the pleasures and splendors of the world and its beauties which will be disclosed to you." Somebody said, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him)! Can the good bring forth evil?" The Prophet (Peace be upon him) remained silent for a while. It was said to that person, "What is wrong with you? You are talking to the Prophet (Peace be upon him) while he is not talking to you." Then we noticed that he was being inspired divinely. Then the Prophet (Peace be upon him) wiped off his sweat and said, "Where is the questioner?" It seemed as if the Prophet (Peace be upon him) liked his question. Then he said, "Good never brings forth evil. Indeed it is like what grows on the banks of a water-stream which either kill or make the animals sick, except if an animal eats its fill the Khadira (a kind of vegetable) and then faces the sun, and then defecates and urinates and grazes again. No doubt this wealth is sweet and green. Blessed is the wealth of a Muslim from which he gives to the poor, the orphans, and to needy travelers. (Or the Prophet (Peace be upon him) said something similar to it) No doubt, whoever takes it illegally will be like the one who eats but is never satisfied, and his wealth will be a witness against him on the Day of Resurrection."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Amr bin Al-Harith (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Zainab (May Allah be pleased with her), the wife of 'Abdullah said, "I was in the Mosque and saw the Prophet (Peace be upon him) saying, 'O women! Give alms even from your ornaments.' " Zainab (May Allah be pleased with her) used to provide for 'Abdullah (May Allah be pleased with him) and those orphans who were under her protection. So she said to 'Abdullah (May Allah be pleased with him), "Will you ask Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) whether it will be sufficient for me to spend part of the Zakat on you and the orphans who are under my protection?" He replied "Will you yourself ask Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him)?" (Zainab added): So I went to the Prophet (Peace be upon him) and I saw there an Ansari woman who was standing at the door (of the Prophet (Peace be upon him)) with a similar problem as mine. Bilal (May Allah be pleased with him) passed by us and we asked him, 'Ask the Prophet (Peace be upon him) whether it is permissible for me to spend (the Zakat) on my husband and the orphans under my protection.' And we requested Bilal (May Allah be pleased with him) not to inform the Prophet (Peace be upon him) about us. So Bilal (May Allah be pleased with him) went inside and asked the Prophet (Peace be upon him) regarding our problem. The Prophet (Peace be upon him) asked, "Who are those two?" Bilal (May Allah be pleased with him) replied that she was Zainab (May Allah be pleased with her). The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "Which Zainab?" Bilal (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "The wife of 'Abdullah (May Allah be pleased with him)." The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "Yes, (it is sufficient for her) and she will receive double rewards (for that): One for helping relatives, and the other for giving Zakat."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Zainab (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: (the daughter of Um Salama) My mother said, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him)! Shall I receive a reward if I spend for the sustenance of Abu Salama's offspring, and in fact, they are also my sons?" The Prophet (Peace be upon him) replied, "Spend on them and you will get a reward for what you spend on them."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) ordered (a person) to collect Zakat, and that person returned and told him that Ibn Jamil, Khalid bin Al-Walid (May Allah be pleased with him), and Abbas bin 'Abdul Muttalib (May Allah be pleased with him) had refused to give Zakat." The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "What made Ibn Jamll refuse to give Zakat though he was a poor man and was made wealthy by Allah and His Apostle (Peace be upon him)? But you are unfair in asking Zakat from Khalid (May Allah be pleased with him) as he is keeping his armor for Allah's Cause (for Jihad). As for Abbas bin 'Abdul Muttalib (May Allah be pleased with him), he is the uncle of Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) and Zakat is compulsory on him and he should pay it double."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Said Al-Khudri (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Some Ansari persons asked for (something) from Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) and he gave them. They again asked him for (something) and he again gave them. And then they asked him and he gave them again till all that was with him finished. And then he said "If I had anything. I would not keep it away from you. (Remember) Whoever abstains from asking others, Allah will make him contented, and whoever tries to make himself self-sufficient, Allah will make him self-sufficient. And whoever remains patient, Allah will make him patient. Nobody can be given a blessing better and greater than patience."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) said, "By Him in Whose Hand my life is, it is better for anyone of you to take a rope and cut the wood (from the forest) and carry it over his back and sell it (as a means of earning his living) rather than to ask a person for something and that person may give him or not."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Az-Zubair bin Al'Awwam (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "It is better for anyone of you to take a rope (and cut) and bring a bundle of wood (from the forest) over his back and sell it and Allah will save his face (from the Hell-Fire) because of that, rather than to ask the people who may give him or not."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Urwa bin Az-Zubair and Said bin Al-Musaiyab (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Hakim bin Hizam (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "(Once) I asked Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) (for something) and he gave it to me. Again I asked and he gave (it to me). Again I asked and he gave (it to me). And then he said, "O Hakim! This property is like a sweet fresh fruit; whoever takes it without greediness, he is blessed in it, and whoever takes it with greediness, he is not blessed in it, and he is like a person who eats but is never satisfied; and the upper (giving) hand is better than the lower (receiving) hand." Hakim (May Allah be pleased with him) added, "I said to Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him), 'By Him (Allah) Who sent you with the Truth, I shall never accept anything from anybody after you, till I leave this world.' " Then Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) called Hakim (May Allah be pleased with him) to give him his share from the war booty (like the other companions of the Prophet (Peace be upon him)), he refused to accept anything. Then 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) called him to give him his share but he refused. On that 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "O Muslims! I would like you to witness that I offered Hakim (May Allah be pleased with him) his share from this booty and he refused to take it." So Hakim (May Allah be pleased with him) never took anything from anybody after the Prophet (Peace be upon him) till he died.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) used to give me something but I would say to him, "would you give it to a poorer and more needy one than I?" The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said to me, "Take it. If you are given something from this property, without asking for it or having greed for it take it; and if not given, do not run for it."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdullah bin 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "A man keeps on asking others for something till he comes on the Day of Resurrection without any piece of flesh on his face." The Prophet (Peace be upon him) added, "On the Day of Resurrection, the Sun will come near (to the people) to such an extent that the sweat will reach up to the middle of the ears, so, when all the people are in that state, they will ask Adam (Peace be upon him) for help, and then Moses (Peace be upon him), and then Muhammad (Peace be upon him)." The sub-narrator added "Muhammad (Peace be upon him) will intercede with Allah to judge amongst the people. He will proceed on till he will hold the ring of the door (of Paradise) and then Allah will exalt him to Maqam Mahmud (the privilege of intercession, etc.). And all the people of the gathering will send their praises to Allah."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "The poor person is not the one who asks a morsel or two (of meals) from the others, but the poor is the one who has nothing and is ashamed to beg from others."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ash-sha'bi (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text:
The clerk of Al-Mughira bin Shu'ba narrated, "Muawiya (May Allah be pleased with him) wrote to Al-Mughira bin Shu'ba: Write to me something which you have heard from the Prophet (Peace be upon him)." So Al-Mughira (May Allah be pleased with him) wrote: I heard the Prophet (Peace be upon him) saying, "Allah has hated for you three things: 

1. Vain talks, (useless talk) that you talk too much or about others. 

2. Wasting of wealth (by extravagance) 

3. And asking too many questions (in disputed religious matters) or asking others for something (except in great need). (See Hadith No. 591, Vol. III)

hadiths.by: Narrated by Sad (bin Abi Waqqas) (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) distributed something (from the resources of Zakat) amongst a group of people while I was sitting amongst them, but he left a man whom I considered the best of the lot. So, I went up to Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) and asked him secretly, "Why have you left that person? By Allah! I consider him a believer." The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "Or merely a Muslim (Who surrenders to Allah)." I remained quiet for a while but could not help repeating my question because of what I knew about him. I said, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him)! Why have you left that person? By Allah! I consider him a believer. " The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "Or merely a Muslim." I remained quiet for a while but could not help repeating my question because of what I knew about him. I said, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him)! Why have you left that person? By Allah! I consider him a believer." The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "Or merely a Muslim." Then Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) said, "I give to a person while another is dearer to me, for fear that he may be thrown in the Hell-fire on his face (by renegating from Islam)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Salim bin 'Abdullah from his father (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) said, "The poor person is not the one who goes round the people and ask them for a mouthful or two (of meals) or a date or two but the poor is that who has not enough (money) to satisfy his needs and whose condition is not known to others, that others may give him something in charity, and who does not beg of people."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "No doubt, it is better for a person to take a rope and proceed in the morning to the mountains and cut the wood and then sell it, and eat from this income and give alms from it than to ask others for something."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: We took part in the holy battle of Tabuk in the company of the Prophet (Peace be upon him) and when we arrived at the Wadi-al-Qura, there was a woman in her garden. The Prophet (Peace be upon him) asked his companions to estimate the amount of the fruits in the garden, and Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) estimated it at ten Awsuq (One Wasaq = 60 Sa's) and 1 Sa'= 3 kg. approximately). The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said to that lady, "Check what your garden will yield." When we reached Tabuk, the Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "There will be a strong wind to-night and so no one should stand and whoever has a camel, should fasten it." So we fastened our camels. A strong wind blew at night and a man stood up and he was blown away to a mountain called Taiy. The King of Aila sent a white mule and a sheet for wearing to the Prophet (Peace be upon him) as a present, and wrote to the Prophet (Peace be upon him) that his people would stay in their place (and will pay Jizya taxation.) (1) When the Prophet (Peace be upon him) reached Wadi-al-Qura he asked that woman how much her garden had yielded. She said, "Ten Awsuq," and that was what Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) had estimated. Then the Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "I want to reach Medina quickly, and whoever among you wants to accompany me, should hurry up." The sub-narrator Ibn Bakkar said something which meant: When the Prophet (Peace be upon him) saw Medina he said, "This is Taba." And when he saw the mountain of Uhud, he said, "This mountain loves us and we love it. Shall I tell you of the best amongst the Ansar?" They replied in the affirmative. He said, "The family of Bani-n-Najjar, and then the family of Bani Sa'ida or Bani Al-Harith bin Al-Khazraj. (The above-mentioned are the best) but there is goodness in all the families of Ansar."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Salim bin 'Abdullah from his father (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "On a land irrigated by rain water or by natural water channels or if the land is wet due to a nearby water channel, Ushr (i.e. one-tenth) is compulsory (as Zakat); and on the land irrigated by the well, half of an Ushr (i.e. one-twentieth) is compulsory (as Zakat on the yield of the land)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Humaid As-Sa'idi (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "There is no Zakat on less than five Awsuq (of dates), or on less than five camels, or on less than five Awaq of silver." (22 Yameni Riyals Faransa).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Dates used to be brought to Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) immediately after being plucked. Different persons would bring their dates till a big heap collected (in front of the Prophet (Peace be upon him)). Once Al-Hasan and Al-Husain were playing with these dates. One of them took a date and put it in his mouth. Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) looked at him and took it out from his mouth and said, "Don't you know that Muhammad's (Peace be upon him) offspring do not eat what is given in charity?"

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace be upon him) had forbidden the sale of dates till they were good (ripe), and when it was asked what it meant, the Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "Till there is no danger of blight."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Jabir bin 'Abdullah (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace be upon him) had forbidden the sale of fruits till they were ripe (free from blight).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) forbade the selling of fruits until they were ripe. The Prophet (Peace be upon him) added, "It means that they become red."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdullah bin 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Umar bin Al-Khattab (May Allah be pleased with him) gave a horse in charity in Allah's Cause and later he saw it being sold in the market and intended to purchase it. Then he went to the Prophet (Peace be upon him) and asked his permission. The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "Do not take back what you have given in charity." For this reason, Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) never purchased the things which he had given in charity, and in case he had purchased something (unknowingly) he would give it in charity again.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Once I gave a horse in Allah's Cause (in charity) but that person did not take care of it. I intended to buy it, as I thought he would sell it at a low price. So, I asked the Prophet (Peace be upon him) about it. He said, "Neither buy, nor take back your alms which you have given, even if the seller were willing to sell it for one Dirham, for he who takes back his alms is like the one who swallows his own vomit."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Al-Hasan bin 'Ali (May Allah be pleased with him) took a date from the dates given in charity and put it in his mouth. The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "Expel it from your mouth. Don't you know that we do not eat a thing which is given in charity?"

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace be upon him) saw a dead sheep which had been given in charity to a freed slave-girl of Maimuna (May Allah be pleased with her), the wife of the Prophet (Peace be upon him). The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "Why don't you get the benefit of its hide?" They said, "It is dead." He replied, "Only to eat (its meat) is illegal."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Al-Aswad (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) intended to buy Barira (a slave-girl) in order to manumit her and her masters intended to put the condition that her Al-wala would be for them. 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) mentioned that to the Prophet (Peace be upon him) who said to her, "Buy her, as the "Wala" is for the manumitted." Once some meat was presented to the Prophet (Peace be upon him) and 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) said to him, "This (meat) was given in charity to Barira." He said, "It is an object of charity for Barira but a gift for us."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Um 'Atiyya Al-Ansariya (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace be upon him) went to 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) and asked her whether she had something (to eat). She replied that she had nothing except the mutton (piece) which Nusaiba (Um 'Atiyya) had sent to us (Buraira) in charity." The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "It has reached its place and now it is not a thing of charity but a gift for us."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Some meat was presented to the Prophet (Peace be upon him) and it had been given to Barira (the freed slave-girl of Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her)) in charity. He said, "This meat is a thing of charity for Barira but it is a gift for us."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Ma'bad (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) said to Muadh (May Allah be pleased with him) when he sent him to Yemen, "You will go to the people of the Scripture. So, when you reach there, invite them to testify that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah, and that Muhammad is His Apostle (Peace be upon him). And if they obey you in that, tell them that Allah has enjoined on them five prayers in each day and night. And if they obey you in that, tell them that Allah has made it obligatory on them to pay the Zakat which will be taken from the rich among them and given to the poor among them. If they obey you in that, then avoid taking the best of their possessions, and be afraid of the curse of an oppressed person because there is no screen between his invocation and Allah."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdullah bin Abu Aufa (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Whenever a person came to the Prophet (Peace be upon him) with his alms, the Prophet (Peace be upon him) would say, "O Allah! Send your Blessings upon so and so." My father went to the Prophet (Peace be upon him) with his alms and the Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "O Allah! Send your blessings upon the offspring of Abu Aufa."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) enjoined the payment of one Sa' of dates or one Sa' of barley as Zakat-ul-Fitr on every Muslim slave or free, male or female, young or old, and he ordered that it be paid before the people went out to offer the 'Id prayer. (One Sa' = 3 Kilograms approx.)

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) made it incumbent on all the slave or free Muslims, male or female, to pay one Sa' of dates or barley as Zakat-ul-Fitr.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Said (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: We used to give one Sa' of barley as Sadaqatul-Fitr (per head).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Said Al-Khudri (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: We used to give one Sa' of meal or one Sa' of barley or one Sa' of dates, or one Sa' of cottage cheese or one Sa' of Raisins (dried grapes) as Zakat-ul-Fitr.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdullah bin 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace be upon him) ordered (Muslims) to give one Sa' of dates or one Sa' of barley as Zakat-ul-Fitr. The people rewarded two Mudds of wheat as equal to that.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: In the life-time of the Prophet (Peace be upon him), we used to give one Sa' of food or one Sa' of dates or one Sa' of barley or one Sa' of Raisins (dried grapes) as Sadaqat-ul-Fitr. And when Muawiya (May Allah be pleased with him) became the Caliph and the wheat was (available in abundance), he said, "I think (observe) that one Mudd (of wheat) equals two Mudds (of any of the above-mentioned things)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace be upon him) ordered the people to pay Zakat-ul-Fitr before going to the 'Id prayer.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Said Al-Khudri (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: In the life-time of Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him), we used to give one Sa' of food (edible things) as Sadaqat-ul-Fitr (to the poor). Our food used to be either of barley, raisins (dried grapes), cottage cheese or dates.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Nafi' (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "The Prophet (Peace be upon him) made incumbent on every male or female, free man or slave, the payment of one Sa' of dates or barley as Sadaqat-ul-Fitr (or said Sadaqa-Ramadan)." The people then substituted half Sa' of wheat for that. Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) used to give dates (as Sadaqat-ul-Fitr). Once there was scarcity of dates in Medina and Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) gave barley. 'And Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) used to give Sadaqat-ul-Fitr for every young and old person. He even used to give on behalf of my children. Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) used to give Sadaqat-ul-Fitr to those who had been officially appointed for its collection. People used to give Sadaqat-ul-Fitr (even) a day or two before the 'Id.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) has made Sadaqatul-Fitr obligatory, (and it was), either one Sa' of barley or one Sa' of dates (and its payment was obligatory) on young and old people, and on free men as well as on slaves.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdullah bin Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Al-Fadl (his brother) was riding behind Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) and a woman from the tribe of Khath'am came and Al-Fadl started looking at her and she started looking at him. The Prophet (Peace be upon him) turned Al-Fadl's face to the other side. The woman said, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him)! The obligation of Hajj enjoined by Allah on His devotees has become due on my father and he is old and weak, and he cannot sit firm on the Mount; may I perform Hajj on his behalf?" The Prophet (Peace be upon him) replied, "Yes, you may." That happened during the Hajj-al-Wida (of the Prophet (Peace be upon him)).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I saw that Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) used to ride on his Mount at Dhul Hulaifa and used to start saying, "Labbaik" when the Mount stood upright.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Jabir bin 'Abdullah (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: That Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) started saying, "Labbaik" from Dhul-Hulaifa when his Mount stood upright carrying him.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Thumama bin 'Abdullah bin Anas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) performed the Hajj on a pack-saddle and he was not a miser. Anas said, "Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) performed Hajj on a pack-saddle and the same Mount was carrying his baggage too."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Al-Qasim bin Muhammad (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) said, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him)! You performed 'Umra but I did not." He said, "O 'Abdur-Rahman! Go along with your sister and let her perform 'Umra from Tan'im." 'Abdur-Rahman made her ride over the pack-saddle of a she-camel and she performed 'Umra.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace be upon him) was asked, "Which is the best deed?" He said, "To believe in Allah and His Apostle (Peace be upon him)." He was then asked, "Which is the next (in goodness)?" He said, "To participate in Jihad in Allah's Cause." He was then asked, "Which is the next?" He said, "To perform Hajj-Mabrur."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: (the mother of the faithful believers) I said, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him)! We consider Jihad as the best deed." The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "The best Jihad (for women) is Hajj Mabrur."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "Whoever performs Hajj for Allah's pleasure and does not have sexual relations with his wife, and does not do evil or sins then he will return (after Hajj free from all sins) as if he were born anew."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Zaid bin Jubair (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I went to visit 'Abdullah bin 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) at his house which contained many tents made of cotton cloth and these were encircled with Suradik (part of the tent). I asked him from where, should one assume Ihram for Umra. He said, "Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) had fixed as Miqat (singular of Mawaqit) Qarn for the people of Najd, Dhul-Hulaifa for the people of Medina, and Al-Juhfa for the people of Sham."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The people of Yemen used to come for Hajj and used not to bring enough provisions with them and used to say that they depend on Allah. On their arrival in Medina, they used to beg the people, and so Allah revealed, "And take a provision (with you) for the journey, but the best provision is the fear of Allah." (2.197).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) made Dhul-Hulaifa as the Miqat for the people of Medina; Al-Juhfa for the people of Sham; Qarn-al-Manazil for the people of Najd; and Yalamlam for the people of Yemen; and these Mawaqit are for the people at those very places, and besides them for those who come through those places with the intention of performing Hajj and Umra; and whoever is living within these boundaries can assume Ihram from the place he starts, and the people of Mecca can assume Ihram from Mecca.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Nafi' (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: 'Abdullah bin 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) said, 'The people of Medina should assume Ihram from Dhul-Hulaifa; the people of Sham from Al-Juhfa; and the people of Najd from Qarn." And 'Abdullah added, "I was informed that Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) had said, 'The people of Yemen should assume Ihram from Yalamlam.'"

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) had fixed Dhul Hulaifa as the Miqat for the people of Medina; Al-Juhfa for the people of Sham; and Qarn Ul-Manazil for the people of Najd; and Yalamlam for the people of Yemen. So, these (above mentioned) are the Mawaqit for all those living at those places, and besides them for those who come through those places with the intention of performing Hajj and 'Umra; and whoever is living inside these places can assume Ihram from his own dwelling place, and the people of Mecca can assume Ihram from Mecca.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Salim from his father (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: "The Prophet had fixed the Mawaqit as follows: (No. 603)

hadiths.by: Narrated by Salim bin 'Abdullah from his father (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I heard Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) saying, "The Miqat for the people of Medina is Dhul-Hulaifa; for the people of Sham is Al-Juhfa; and for the people of Najd is Qarn. And said Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him), "They claim, but I did not hear personally, that the Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "The Miqat for the people of Yemen is Yalamlam."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace be upon him) fixed Dhul-Hulaifa as the Miqat for the people of Medina, Al-Juhfa, for the people of Sham, Yalamlam for the people of Yemen, and Qarn for the people of Najd. And these Mawaqit are for those living at those very places, and besides them for those who come through those places with the intention of performing Hajj and Umra; and whoever is living inside these places can assume Ihram from his own dwelling place, and the people of Mecca can assume Ihram from Mecca.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace be upon him) fixed Dhul-Hulaifa as the Miqat for the people of Medina, Al-Juhfa for the people of Sham, Qarn-ul-Manazil for the people of Najd, and Yalamlam for the people of Yemen; and these Mawaqit are for those living at those very places, and besides them for those who come through them with the intention of performing Hajj and Umra; and whoever is living within these Mawaqit should assume Ihram from where he starts, and the people of Mecca can assume Ihram from Mecca.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: When these two towns (Basra and Kufa) were captured, the people went to 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) and said, "O the Chief of the faithful believers! The Prophet (Peace be upon him) fixed Qarn as the Miqat for the people of Najd, it is beyond our way and it is difficult for us to pass through it." He said, "Take as your Miqat a place situated opposite to Qarn on your usual way. So, he fixed Dhatu-Irq (as their Miqat)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Nafi' (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: 'Abdullah bin 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) made his camel sit (i.e. he dismounted) at Al-Batha' in Dhul-Hulaifa and offered the prayer." 'Abdullah bin 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) used to do the same.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) used to go (for Hajj) via Ash-Shajara way and return via Muarras way; and no doubt, whenever Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) went to Mecca, he used to offer the prayer in the Mosque of Ash-Shajara; and on his return, he used to offer the prayer at Dhul-Hulaifa in the middle of the valley, and pass the night there till morning.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: In the valley of Al-'Aqiq I heard Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) saying, "Tonight a messenger came to me from my Lord and asked me to pray in this blessed valley and to assume Ihram for Hajj and 'Umra together."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Musa bin 'Uqba (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Salim bin 'Abdullah's father said, "The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said that while resting in the bottom of the valley at Mu'arras in Dhul-Hulaifa, he had been addressed in a dream: 'You are verily in a blessed valley.' " Salim (May Allah be pleased with him) made us dismount from our camels at the place where 'Abdullah (May Allah be pleased with him) used to dismount, aiming at the place where Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) had rested and it was below the Mosque situated in the middle of the valley in between them (the residence) and the road.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Said bin Jubair (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) used to oil his hair. I told that to Ibrahim who said, "What do you think about this statement: Narrated Aswad from 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her): As if I were now observing the glitter of the scent in the parting of the hair of the Prophet (Peace be upon him) while he was Muhrim?"

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: (the wife of the Prophet (Peace be upon him)) I used to scent Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) when he wanted to assume Ihram and also on finishing Ihram before the Tawaf round the Ka'ba (Tawaf-al-ifada).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Salim from his father (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I heard that Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) assumed Ihram with his hair matted together.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Salim bin 'Abdullah (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I heard my father saying, "Never did Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) assume Ihram except at the Mosque, that is, at the Mosque of Dhul-Hulaifa.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdullah bin 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: A man asked, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him)! What kind of clothes should a Muhrim wear?" Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) replied, "He should not wear a shirt, a turban, trousers, a headcloak or leather socks except if he can find no slippers, he then may wear leather socks after cutting off what might cover the ankles. And he should not wear clothes which are scented with saffron or Wars (kinds of perfumes)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Ubaidullah bin 'Abdullah (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "Usama rode behind Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) from 'Arafat to Al-Muzdalifa; and then Al-Fadl rode behind Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) from Al-Muzdalifa to Mina." Ibn Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him) added, "Both of them said, 'The Prophet kept on reciting Talbiya till he did the Rami of Jamrat-al-'Aqaba.'"

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdullah bin 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Talbiya of Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) was: 'Labbaika Allahumma labbaik, Labbaika la sharika Laka labbaik, Inna-l-hamda wan-ni'mata Laka walmu Lk, La sharika Laka' (I respond to Your call O Allah, I respond to Your call, and I am obedient to Your orders, You have no partner, I respond to Your call. All the praises and blessings are for You, All the sovereignty is for You, And You have no partners with you.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: I know how the Prophet (Peace be upon him) used to say (Talbiya) and it was: 'Labbaika Allahumma Labbaik, Labbaika la sharika Laka labbaik, Inna-l-hamda wan-ni'mata Laka walmu Lk, La sharika Laka'.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) offered four Rakat in Medina and then two Rakat at Dhul-Hulaifa and then passed the night at Dhul-Hulaifa till it was morning and when he mounted his Mount and it stood up, he started to recite Talbiya.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Qilaba (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "The Prophet (Peace be upon him) offered four Rakat of the Zuhr prayer in Medina and two Rakat of the 'Asr prayer at Dhul-Hulaifa and then passed the night there till it was dawn; then he rode, and when he reached Al-Baida', he praised and glorified Allah and said Takbir (i.e. Alhamdu-lillah and Subhanallah) and Allahu-Akbar. Then he and the people along with him recited Talbiya with the intention of performing Hajj and Umra. When we reached (Mecca), he ordered us to finish the Ihram (after performing the Umra) (only those who had no Hadi (animal for sacrifice) with them were asked to do so) till the day of Tarwiya that is 8th Dhul-Hijja when they would assume Ihram for Hajj. The Prophet (Peace be upon him) sacrificed many camels (slaughtering them) with his own hands while standing. While Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) was in Medina, he sacrificed two horned rams black and white in color in the Name of Allah.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdullah bin 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Talbiya of Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) was: 'Labbaika Allahumma labbaik, Labbaika la sharika Laka labbaik, Inna-l-hamda wan-ni'mata Laka walmu Lk, La sharika Laka' (I respond to Your call O Allah, I respond to Your call, and I am obedient to Your orders, You have no partner, I respond to Your call. All the praises and blessings are for You, All the sovereignty is for You, And You have no partners with you.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: I know how the Prophet (Peace be upon him) used to say (Talbiya) and it was: 'Labbaika Allahumma Labbaik, Labbaika la sharika Laka labbaik, Inna-l-hamda wan-ni'mata Laka walmu Lk, La sharika Laka'.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) offered four Rakat of Zuhr prayer at Medina and we were in his company, and two Rakat of the Asr prayer at Dhul-Hulaifa and then passed the night there till it was dawn; then he rode, and when he reached Al-Baida', he praised and glorified Allah and said Takbir (i.e. Alhamdu-lillah and Subhanallah) and Allahu-Akbar. Then he and the people along with him recited Talbiya with the intention of performing Hajj and Umra. When we reached (Mecca), he ordered us to finish the Ihram (after performing the Umra) (only those who had no Hadi (animal for sacrifice) with them were asked to do so) till the day of Tarwiya that is 8th Dhul-Hijja when they would assume Ihram for Hajj. The Prophet (Peace be upon him) sacrificed many camels (slaughtering them) with his own hands while standing. While Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) was in Medina, he sacrificed two horned rams black and white in color in the Name of Allah.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace be upon him) recited Talbiya when he had mounted his Mount and was ready to set out.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Nafi' (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Whenever Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) intended to go to Mecca, he used to oil himself with a sort of oil that had no pleasant smell, then he would go to the Mosque of Al-Hulaita and offer the prayer, and then ride. When he mounted well on his Mount and the Mount stood up straight, he would proclaim the intention of assuming Ihram, and he used to say that he had seen the Prophet (Peace be upon him) doing the same.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Mujahid (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I was in the company of Ibn Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him) and the people talked about Ad-Dajjal and said, "Ad-Dajjal will come with the word Kafir (non-believer) written in between his eyes." On that Ibn Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "I have not heard this from the Prophet (Peace be upon him) but I heard him saying, 'As if I saw Moses just now entering the valley reciting Talbiya.'"

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: We set out with the Prophet (Peace be upon him) in his last Hajj and we assumed Ihram for Umra. The Prophet (Peace be upon him) then said, "Whoever has the Hadi with him should assume Ihram for Hajj along with 'Umra and should not finish the Ihram till he finishes both." I was menstruating when I reached Mecca, and so I neither did Tawaf round the Ka'ba nor Tawaf between Safa and Marwa. I complained about that to the Prophet (Peace be upon him) on which he replied, "Undo and comb your hair, and assume Ihram for Hajj (only) and leave the Umra." So, I did so. When we had performed the Hajj, the Prophet (Peace be upon him) sent me with my brother 'Abdur-Rahman bin Abu Bakr to Tan'im. So I performed the 'Umra. The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said to me, "This 'Umra is instead of your missed one." Those who had assumed Ihram for 'Umra (Hajj-at-Tamattu) performed Tawaf round the Ka'ba and then finished their Ihram. After returning from Mina, they performed another Tawaf (between Safa and Marwa). Those who had assumed Ihram for Hajj and 'Umra together (Hajj-al-Qiran) performed only one Tawaf (between Safa and Marwa).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ata (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Jabir (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "The Prophet (Peace be upon him) ordered Ali (May Allah be pleased with him) to keep on assuming his Ihram." The narrator then informed about the narration of Suraqa.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Ali (May Allah be pleased with him) came to the Prophet (Peace be upon him) from Yemen (to Mecca). The Prophet (Peace be upon him) asked Ali, "With what intention have you assumed Ihram?" Ali (May Allah be pleased with him) replied, "I have assumed Ihram with the same intention as that of the Prophet (Peace be upon him)." The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "If I had not the Hadi with me, I would have finished the Ihram." Muhammad bin Bakr narrated extra from Ibn Juraij, "The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said to Ali, "With what intention have you assumed the Ihram, O Ali?" He replied, "With the same (intention) as that of the Prophet (Peace be upon him)." The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "Have a Hadi and keep your Ihram as it is."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Musa (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace be upon him) sent me to some people in Yemen and when I returned, I found him at Al-Batha. He asked me, "With what intention have you assumed Ihram (i.e. for Hajj or for Umra or for both?)" I replied, "I have assumed Ihram with an intention like that of the Prophet (Peace be upon him)." He asked, "Have you a Hadi with you?" I replied in the negative. He ordered me to perform Tawaf round the Ka'ba and between Safa and Marwa and then to finish my Ihram. I did so and went to a woman from my tribe who combed my hair or washed my head. Then, when Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) came (i.e. became Caliph) he said, "If we follow Allah's Book, it orders us to complete Hajj and Umra; as Allah says: "Perform the Hajj and Umra for Allah." (2.196). And if we follow the tradition of the Prophet (Peace be upon him) who did not finish his Ihram till he sacrificed his Hadi."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Al-Qasim bin Muhammad (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) said, "We set out with Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) in the months of Hajj, and (in) the nights of Hajj, and at the time and places of Hajj and in a state of Hajj. We dismounted at Sarif (a village six miles from Mecca). The Prophet (Peace be upon him) then addressed his companions and said, "Anyone who has not got the Hadi and likes to do Umra instead of Hajj may do so (i.e. Hajj-al-Tamattu) and anyone who has got the Hadi should not finish the Ihram after performing 'Umra (i.e. Hajj-al-Qiran)." Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) added, "The companions of the Prophet (Peace be upon him) obeyed the above (order) and some of them (i.e. who did not have Hadi) finished their Ihram after 'Umra." Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) and some of his companions were resourceful and had the Hadi with them, they could not perform Umra (alone) (but had to perform both Hajj and Umra with one Ihram). Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) added, "Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) came to me and saw me weeping and said, "What makes you weep, O Hantah?" I replied, "I have heard your conversation with your companions and I cannot perform the Umra." He asked, "What is wrong with you?" I replied, "I do not offer the prayers (i.e. I have my menses)." He said, "It will not harm you for you are one of the daughters of Adam, and Allah has written for you (this state) as He has written it for them. Keep on with your intentions for Hajj and Allah may reward you that." Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) further added, "Then we proceeded for Hajj till we reached Mina and I became clean from my menses. Then I went out from Mina and performed Tawaf round the Ka'ba." Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) added, "I went along with the Prophet (Peace be upon him) in his final departure (from Hajj) till he dismounted at Al-Muhassab (a valley outside Mecca), and we too, dismounted with him." He called 'Abdur-Rahman bin Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him) and said to him, 'Take your sister outside the sanctuary of Mecca and let her assume Ihram for 'Umra, and when you had finished 'Umra, return to this place and I will wait for you both till you both return to me.' " Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) added, "So we went out of the sanctuary of Mecca and after finishing from the 'Umra and the Tawaf we returned to the Prophet (Peace be upon him) at dawn. He said, 'Have you performed the 'Umra?' We replied in the affirmative. So he announced the departure amongst his companions and the people set out for the journey, and the Prophet (Peace be upon him) too left for Medina."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Al-Aswad (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) said, We went out with the Prophet (Peace be upon him) from Medina with the intention of performing Hajj only and when we reached Mecca we performed Tawaf round the Kaba and then the Prophet (Peace be upon him) ordered those who had not driven the Hadi along with them to finish their Ihram. So the people who had not driven the Hadi along with them finished their Ihram. The Prophet's wives, too, had not driven the Hadi with them, so they too, finished their Ihram." 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) added, "I got my menses and could not perform Tawaf round the Ka'ba." So when it was the night of Hasba (i.e. when we stopped at Al-Muhassab), I said, 'O Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him)! Everyone is returning after performing Hajj and 'Umra but I am returning after performing Hajj only.' He said, 'Didn't you perform Tawaf round the Ka'ba the night we reached Mecca?' I replied in the negative. He said, 'Go with your brother to Tan'im and assume the Ihram for 'Umra, (and after performing it) come back to such and such a place.' On that Safiya (May Allah be pleased with her) said, 'I feel that I will detain you all.' The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, 'O 'Aqra Halqa! Didn't you perform Tawaf of the Ka'ba on the day of sacrifice? (i.e. Tawaf-al-ifada) Safiya replied in the affirmative. He said, (to Safiya). 'There is no harm for you to proceed on with us.'

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: We set out with Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) to Mecca in the year of the Prophet's last Hajj. Some of us had assumed Ihram for 'Umra only, some for both Hajj and 'Umra, and others for Hajj only. Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) assumed Ihram for Hajj. So whoever had assumed Ihram for Hajj or for both Hajj and 'Umra did not finish the Ihram till the day of sacrifice. (See Hadith No. 631, 636, and 639).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Marwan bin Al-Hakam (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I saw 'Uthman (May Allah be pleased with him) and 'Ali (May Allah be pleased with him). 'Uthman (May Allah be pleased with him) used to forbid people to perform Hajj-at-Tamattu' and Hajj-al-Qiran (Hajj and 'Umra together), and when 'Ali (May Allah be pleased with him) saw (this act of 'Uthman), he assumed Ihram for Hajj and 'Umra together saying, "Lubbaik for 'Umra and Hajj," and said, "I will not leave the tradition of the Prophet (Peace be upon him) on the saying of somebody."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The people (of the Pre-Islamic Period) used to think that to perform 'Umra during the months of Hajj was one of the major sins on earth. And also used to consider the month of Safar as a forbidden (i.e. sacred) month and they said, "When the wounds of the camel's back heal up (after they return from Hajj) and the signs of those wounds vanish and the month of Safar passes away then (at that time) 'Umra is permissible for the one who wishes to perform it." In the morning of the 4th of Dhul-Hijja, the Prophet (Peace be upon him) and his companions reached Mecca, assuming Ihram for Hajj and he ordered his companions to make their intentions of the Ihram for 'Umra only (instead of Hajj) so they considered his order as something great and were puzzled, and said, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him)! What kind (of finishing) of Ihram is allowed?" The Prophet (Peace be upon him) replied, "Finish the Ihram completely like a non-Muhrim (you are allowed everything)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Musa (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I came to the Prophet (Peace be upon him) from Yemen and was assuming Ihram for Hajj and he ordered me to finish the Ihram (after performing the 'Umra).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Hafsa (May Allah be pleased with her), the wife of the Prophet (Peace be upon him), said, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him)! Why have the people finished their Ihram after performing 'Umra but you have not finished your Ihram after performing 'Umra?" He replied, "I have matted my hair and garlanded my Hadi. So I will not finish my Ihram till I have slaughtered (my Hadi)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Shu'ba (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Abu Jamra Nasr bin 'Imran Ad-Duba'i said, "I intended to perform Hajj-at-Tamattu' and the people advised me not to do so. I asked Ibn Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him) regarding it and he ordered me to perform Hajj-at-Tamattu'. Later I saw in a dream someone saying to me, 'Hajj-Mabrur (Hajj performed in accordance with the Prophet's tradition without committing sins and accepted by Allah) and an accepted 'Umra.' So I told that dream to Ibn Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him). He said, 'This is the tradition of Abu-l-Qasim (Peace be upon him).' Then he said to me, 'Stay with me and I shall give you a portion of my property.'" I (Shu'ba) asked, "Why (did he invite you)?" He (Abu Jamra) said, "Because of the dream which I had seen."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Shihab (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I left for Mecca for Hajj-at-Tamattu' assuming Ihram for 'Umra. I reached Mecca three days before the day of Tarwiya (8th Dhul-Hijja). Some people of Mecca said to me, "Your Hajj will be like the Hajj performed by the people of Mecca (i.e. you will lose the superiority of assuming Ihram from the Miqat). So I went to 'Ata' asking him his view about it. He said, "Jabir bin 'Abdullah (May Allah be pleased with him) narrated to me, 'I performed Hajj with Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) on the day when he drove camels with him. The people had assumed Ihram for Hajj-al-Ifrad. The Prophet (Peace be upon him) ordered them to finish their Ihram after Tawaf round the Ka'ba, and between Safa and Marwa and to cut short their hair and then to stay there (in Mecca) as non-Muhrims till the day of Tarwiya (i.e. 8th of Dhul-Hijja) when they would assume Ihram for Hajj and they were ordered to make the Ihram with which they had come as for 'Umra only. They asked, 'How can we make it 'Umra (Tamattu') as we have intended to perform Hajj?' The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, 'Do what I have ordered you. Had I not brought the Hadi with me, I would have done the same, but I cannot finish my Ihram till the Hadi reaches its destination (i.e. is slaughtered).' So, they did (what he ordered them to do)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Said bin Al-Musaiyab (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: 'Ali (May Allah be pleased with him) and 'Uthman (May Allah be pleased with him) differed regarding Hajj-at-Tamattu' while they were at 'Usfan (a familiar place near Mecca). 'Ali (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "I see you want to forbid people to do a thing that the Prophet (Peace be upon him) did?" When 'Ali (May Allah be pleased with him) saw that, he assumed Ihram for both Hajj and 'Umra together saying, "Lubbaik for 'Umra and Hajj," and said, "I will not leave the tradition of the Prophet (Peace be upon him) on the saying of somebody."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Jabir bin 'Abdullah (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: We came with Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) to Mecca and we were saying: 'Labbaika Allahumma Labbaik' for Hajj. Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) ordered us to perform 'Umra with that Ihram (instead of Hajj).

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Imran (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: We performed Hajj-at-Tamattu' in the lifetime of Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) and then the Quran was revealed (regarding Hajj-at-Tamattu') and somebody said what he wished (regarding Hajj-at-Tamattu') according to his own opinion.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Nafi' (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: On reaching the sanctuary of Mecca, Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) used to stop, reciting Talbiya and then he would pass the night at Dhi-Tuwa and then offer the Fajr prayer and take a bath. He used to say that the Prophet (Peace be upon him) used to do the same.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Nafi' (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: 'Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "The Prophet (Peace be upon him) passed the night at Dhi-Tuwa till it was dawn and then he entered Mecca." Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) used to do the same.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) used to enter Mecca from the high Thaniya and used to leave Mecca from the low Thaniya.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) entered Mecca from Kada' from the highest Thaniya which is at Al-Batha' and used to leave Mecca from the low Thaniya.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: When the Prophet (Peace be upon him) came to Mecca he entered from its higher side and left from its lower side.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: In the year of the conquest of Mecca, the Prophet (Peace be upon him) entered Mecca from Kada' and left Mecca from Kuda, from the higher part of Mecca.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: In the year of the conquest of Mecca, the Prophet (Peace be upon him) entered Mecca from Kada' at the higher place of Mecca. (Hisham, a sub-narrator said, "'Urwa used to enter (Mecca) from both Kada' and Kuda and he often entered through Kada' which was nearer to his dwelling place.")

hadiths.by: Narrated by Hisham
hadiths.text: 'Urwa (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "The Prophet (Peace be upon him) entered Mecca in the year of the conquest of Mecca from the side of Kada' which is at the higher part of Mecca." 'Urwa (May Allah be pleased with him) often entered from Kada' which was nearer of the two to his dwelling place.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Hisham from his father (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: In the year of the conquest of Mecca, the Prophet (Peace be upon him) entered Mecca from the side of Kada'. Urwa (May Allah be pleased with him) used to enter through both places and he often entered through Kada' which was nearer of the two to his dwelling place.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Jabir bin 'Abdullah (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: When the Ka'ba was built, the Prophet (Peace be upon him) and Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him) went to bring stones (for its construction). Al Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him) said to the Prophet (Peace be upon him), "Take off your waist sheet and put it on your neck." (When the Prophet (Peace be upon him) took it off) he fell on the ground with his eyes open towards the sky and said, "Give me my waist sheet." And he covered himself with it.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: (the wife of the Prophet) that Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) said to her, "Do you know that when your people (Quraish) rebuilt the Ka'ba, they decreased it from its original foundation laid by Abraham?" I said, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him)! Why don't you rebuild it on its original foundation laid by Abraham?" He replied, "Were it not for the fact that your people are close to the pre-Islamic Period of ignorance (i.e. they have recently become Muslims) I would have done so." The sub-narrator, 'Abdullah (bin 'Umar) stated: 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) must have heard this from Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) for in my opinion Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) had not placed his hand over the two corners of the Ka'ba opposite Al-Hijr only because the Ka'ba was not rebuilt on its original foundations laid by Abraham.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: I asked the Prophet (Peace be upon him) whether the round wall (near Ka'ba) was part of the Ka'ba. The Prophet (Peace be upon him) replied in the affirmative. I further said, "What is wrong with them, why have they not included it in the building of the Ka'ba?" He said, "Don't you see that your people (Quraish) ran short of money (so they could not include it inside the building of Ka'ba)?" I asked, "What about its gate? Why is it so high?" He replied, "Your people did this so as to admit into it whomever they liked and prevent whomever they liked. Were your people not close to the Pre-Islamic Period of ignorance (i.e. they have recently embraced Islam) and were I not afraid that they would dislike it, surely I would have included the (area of the) wall inside the building of the Ka'ba and I would have lowered its gate to the level of the ground."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) said to me, "Were your people not close to the Pre-Islamic period of ignorance, I would have demolished the Ka'ba and would have rebuilt it on its original foundations laid by Abraham (for Quraish had curtailed its building), and I would have built a back door (too)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Yazid bin Ruman from 'Urwa (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her) said that the Prophet (Peace be upon him) said to her, "O Aisha! Were your nation not close to the Pre-Islamic Period of Ignorance, I would have had the Ka'ba demolished and would have included in it the portion which had been left, and would have made it at a level with the ground and would have made two doors for it, one towards the east and the other towards the west, and then by doing this it would have been built on the foundations laid by Abraham." That was what urged Ibn-Az-Zubair to demolish the Ka'ba. Jazz said, "I saw Ibn-Az-Zubair when he demolished and rebuilt the Ka'ba and included in it a portion of Al-Hijr (the unroofed portion of Ka'ba which is at present in the form of a compound towards the north-west of the Ka'ba). I saw the original foundations of Abraham which were of stones resembling the humps of camels." So Jarir asked Yazid, "Where was the place of those stones?" Jazz said, "I will just now show it to you." So Jarir accompanied Yazid and entered Al-Hijr, and Jazz pointed to a place and said, "Here it is." Jarir said, "It appeared to me about six cubits from Al-Hijr or so."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: On the Day of the Conquest of Mecca, Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) said, "Allah has made this town a sanctuary. Its thorny bushes should not be cut, its game should not be chased, and its fallen things should not be picked up except by one who would announce it publicly."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Usama bin Zaid (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I asked, "O Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him)! Where will you stay in Mecca? Will you stay in your house in Mecca?" He replied, "Has 'Aqil left any property or house?" Aqil along with Talib had inherited the property of Abu Talib. Jafar (May Allah be pleased with him) and Ali (May Allah be pleased with him) did not inherit anything as they were Muslims and the other two were non-believers. 'Umar bin Al-Khattab (May Allah be pleased with him) used to say, "A believer cannot inherit (anything from an) infidel." Ibn Shihab, (a sub-narrator) said, "They (Umar and others) derived the above verdict from Allah's Statement: "Verily! those who believed and Emigrated and strove with their life And property in Allah's Cause, And those who helped (the emigrants) And gave them their places to live in, These are (all) allies to one another." (8.72)

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: When Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) intended to enter Mecca he said, "Our destination tomorrow, if Allah wished, will be Khaif Bani Kinana where (the pagans) had taken the oath of Kufr." (Against the Prophet (Peace be upon him) i.e. to be loyal to heathenism by boycotting Bani Hashim, the Prophets folk) (See Hadith No. 221 Vol. 5)

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: On the Day of Nahr at Mina, the Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "Tomorrow we shall stay at Khaif Bani Kinana where the pagans had taken the oath of Kufr (heathenism)." He meant (by that place) Al-Muhassab where the Quraish tribe and Bani Kinana concluded a contract against Bani Hashim and Bani 'Abdul-Muttalib or Bani Al-Muttalib that they would not intermarry with them or deal with them in business until they handed over the Prophet (Peace be upon him) to them.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "Dhus-Suwaiqa-tain (literally: One with two lean legs) from Ethiopia will demolish the Ka'ba."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Aisha (May Allah be pleased with her)
hadiths.text: The people used to fast on 'Ashura (the tenth day of the month of Muharram) before the fasting of Ramadan was made obligatory. And on that day the Ka'ba used to be covered with a cover. When Allah made the fasting of the month of Ramadan compulsory, Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) said, "Whoever wishes to fast (on the day of 'Ashura') may do so; and whoever wishes to leave it can do so."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Said Al-Khudri (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text:
The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "The people will continue performing the Hajj and 'Umra to the Ka'ba even after the appearance of Gog and Magog." 

Narrated Shu'ba extra: 

The Hour (Day of Judgment) will not be established till the Hajj (to the Ka'ba) is abandoned.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Wail (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: (One day) I sat along with Shaiba on the chair inside the Ka'ba. He (Shaiba) said, "No doubt, Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) sat at this place and said, 'I intended not to leave any yellow (i.e. gold) or white (i.e. silver) (inside the Ka'ba) undistributed.' I said (to 'Umar), 'But your two companions (i.e. The Prophet (Peace be upon him) and Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with him)) did not do so.' 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) said, 'They are the two persons whom I always follow.'

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace be upon him) said, "As if I were looking at him, a black person with thin legs plucking the stones of the Ka'ba one after another."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) said, "Dhus-Suwaiqatain (the thin legged man) from Ethiopia will demolish the Ka'ba."

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abis bin Rabia (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) came near the Black Stone and kissed it and said "No doubt, I know that you are a stone and can neither benefit anyone nor harm anyone. Had I not seen Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) kissing you I would not have kissed you."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Salim that his father said (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: "Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him), Usama bin Zaid, Bilal, and 'Uthman bin Abu Talha entered the Ka'ba and then closed its door. When they opened the door I was the first person to enter (the Ka'ba). I met Bilal and asked him, "Did Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) offer a prayer inside (the Ka'ba)?" Bilal replied in the affirmative and said, "(The Prophet (Peace be upon him) offered the prayer) in between the two right pillars."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Nafi' (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Whenever Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) entered the Ka'ba he used to walk straight keeping the door at his back on entering, and used to proceed on till about three cubits from the wall in front of him and then he would offer the prayer there aiming at the place where Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) prayed, as Bilal (May Allah be pleased with him) had told him. There is no harm for any person to offer the prayer at any place inside the Ka'ba.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ishma'li bin Abu Khalid (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: 'Abdullah bin Abu Aufa (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) performed the 'Umra. He performed Tawaf of the Ka'ba and offered two Rakat behind the Maqam (Abraham's place) and was accompanied by those who were screening him from the people." Somebody asked 'Abdullah (May Allah be pleased with him), "Did Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) enter the Ka'ba?" 'Abdullah replied in the negative.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: When Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) came to Mecca, he refused to enter the Ka'ba with idols in it. He ordered (idols to be taken out). So they were taken out. The people took out the pictures of Abraham and Ishmael holding Azlams in their hands. Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) said, "May Allah curse these people. By Allah, both Abraham and Ishmael never did the game of chance with Azlams." Then he entered the Ka'ba and said Takbir at its corners but did not offer the prayer in it.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: When Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) and his companions came to Mecca, the pagans circulated the news that a group of people were coming to them and they had been weakened by the Fever of Yathrib (Medina). So the Prophet (Peace be upon him) ordered his companions to do Ramal in the first three rounds of Tawaf of the Ka'ba and to walk between the two corners (The Black Stone and Yemenite corner). The Prophet (Peace be upon him) did not order them to do Ramal in all the rounds of Tawaf out of pity for them.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Salim that his father said (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: I saw Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) arriving at Mecca; he kissed the Black Stone Corner first while doing Tawaf and did Ramal in the first three rounds of the seven rounds (of Tawaf).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abdullah bin Umar (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace be upon him) did Ramal in the first three rounds (of Tawaf), and walked in the remaining four in Hajj and Umra.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Zaid bin Aslam from his father (May Allah be pleased with him) who said:
hadiths.text: "Umar bin Al-Khattab (May Allah be pleased with him) addressed the Corner (Black Stone) saying, 'By Allah! I know that you are a stone and can neither benefit nor harm. Had I not seen the Prophet (Peace be upon him) touching (and kissing) you, I would never have touched (and kissed) you.' Then he kissed it and said, 'There is no reason for us to do Ramal (in Tawaf) except that we wanted to show off before the pagans, and now Allah has destroyed them.' 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) added, '(Nevertheless), the Prophet (Peace be upon him) did that and we do not want to leave it (i.e. Ramal).'

hadiths.by: Narrated by Nafi' (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "I have never missed the touching of these two stones of Ka'ba (the Black Stone and the Yemenite Corner) both in the presence and absence of crowds, since I saw the Prophet (Peace be upon him) touching them." I asked Nafi': "Did Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) use to walk between the two Corners?" Nafi' replied, "He used to walk in order that it might be easy for him to touch it (the Corner Stone)."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace be upon him) performed Tawaf of the Ka'ba while riding a camel and pointed a bent-headed stick towards the Corner (Black Stone).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Salim bin 'Abdullah that his father said (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: "I heard that Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) assumed Ihram with his hair matted together."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Zaid bin Aslam that his father said (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: "I saw 'Umar bin Al-Khattab (May Allah be pleased with him) kissing the Black Stone and he then said, (to it) 'Had I not seen Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) kissing you, (stone) I would not have kissed you.'"

hadiths.by: Narrated by Az-Zubair bin 'Arabi (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: A man asked Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) about the touching of the Black Stone. Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) said, "I saw Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) touching and kissing it." The questioner said, "But if there were a throng (much rush) round the Ka'ba and the people overpowered me, (what would I do?)" He replied angrily, "Stay in Yemen (as that man was from Yemen). I saw Allah's Apostle (Peace be upon him) touching and kissing it."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Abbas (May Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace be upon him) performed Tawaf of the Ka'ba while riding a camel, and whenever he came in front of the Corner (Black Stone), he pointed towards it (with something).

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Abbas
hadiths.text: The Prophet performed Tawaf of the Ka'ba riding a camel, and every time he came in front of the Corner (having the Black Stone), he pointed towards it with something he had with him and said Takbir.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Urwa
hadiths.text: 'Aisha said, "The first thing the Prophet did on reaching Mecca, was the ablution and then he performed Tawaf of the Ka'ba and that was not 'Umra (alone), (but Hajj-al-Qiran). 'Urwa added: Later Abu Bakr and 'Umar did the same in their Hajj." And I performed the Hajj with my father Az-Zubair, and the first thing he did was Tawaf of the Ka'ba. Later I saw the Muhajirin (Emigrants) and the Ansar doing the same. My mother (Asma') told me that she, her sister ('Aisha), Az-Zubair and such and such persons assumed Ihram for 'Umra, and after they passed their hands over the Black Stone Corner (of the Ka'ba) they finished the Ihram. (i.e. After doing Tawaf of the Ka'ba and Sa'i between Safa-Marwa.

hadiths.by: Narrated by 'Abdullah bin 'Umar
hadiths.text: When Allah's Apostle performed Tawaf of the Ka'ba for Hajj or 'Umra, he used to do Ramal during the first three rounds, and in the last four rounds he used to walk; then after the Tawaf he used to offer two Rakat and then performed Tawaf between Safa and Marwa.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn 'Umar
hadiths.text: When the Prophet performed the Tawaf of the Ka'ba, he did Ramal during the first three rounds and in the last four rounds he used to walk and while doing Tawaf between Safa and Marwa, he used to run in the midst of the rain water passage.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Um Salama
hadiths.text: (the wife of the Prophet) I informed Allah's Apostle that I was ill. So he said, "Perform the Tawaf while riding behind the people." I did so, and at that time the Prophet was praying beside the Ka'ba and reciting Surat-at-Tur.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Abbas
hadiths.text: While the Prophet was performing Tawaf of the Kaba, he passed by a person who had tied his hands to another person with a rope or string or something like that. The Prophet cut it with his own hands and said, "Lead him by the hand."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Abbas
hadiths.text: The Prophet saw a man performing Tawaf of the Kaba tied with a string or something else. So the Prophet cut that string.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Huraira
hadiths.text: In the year prior to the last Hajj of the Prophet when Allah's Apostle made Abu Bakr the leader of the pilgrims, the latter (Abu Bakr) sent me in the company of a group of people to make a public announcement: 'No pagan is allowed to perform Hajj after this year, and no naked person is allowed to perform Tawaf of the Kaba.' (See Hadith No. 365 Vol. 1)

hadiths.by: Narrated by Amr
hadiths.text: We asked Ibn Umar: "May a man have sexual relations with his wife during the Umra before performing Tawaf between Safa and Marwa?" He said, "Allah's Apostle arrived (in Mecca) and circumambulated the Kaba seven times, then offered two Rakat behind Maqam Ibrahim (the station of Abraham), then performed Tawaf between Safa and Marwa." Ibn Umar added, "Verily! In Allah's Apostle you have a good example." And I asked Jabir bin Abdullah (the same question), and he replied, "You should not go near your wives (have sexual relations) till you have finished Tawaf between Safa and Marwa."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Abbas
hadiths.text: The Prophet arrived at Mecca and performed Tawaf of the Kaba and Sa'i between Safa and Marwa, but he did not go near the Kaba after his Tawaf till he returned from Arafat.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Um Salama
hadiths.text: (the wife of the Prophet) I informed Allah's Apostle (about my illness). (Through other sub-narrators, Um Salama narrated that when Allah's Apostle was at Mecca and had just decided to leave (Mecca) while she had not yet done Tawaf of the Kaba (and after listening to her). The Prophet said, "When the morning prayer is established, perform the Tawaf on your camel while the people are in prayer." So she did the same and did not offer the two Rakat of Tawaf until she came out of the Mosque.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Umar
hadiths.text: The Prophet reached Mecca, circumambulated the Kaba seven times and then offered a two Rakat prayer behind Maqam ibrahim. Then he went towards the Safa. Allah has said, "Verily, in Allah's Apostle you have a good example."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Urwa from Aisha
hadiths.text: Some people performed Tawaf (of the Kaba) after the morning prayer and then sat to listen to a preacher till sunrise, and then they stood up for the prayer. Then Aisha commented, "Those people kept on sitting till it was the time in which the prayer is disliked and after that they stood up for the prayer."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abdullah
hadiths.text: Heard the Prophet forbidding the offering of prayers at the time of sunrise and sunset.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abida bin Humaid
hadiths.text: Abdul Aziz bin Rufai said, "I saw Abdullah bin Az-Zubair performing Tawaf of the Kaba after the morning prayer then offering the two Rakat prayer." Abdul Aziz added, "I saw Abdullah bin Az-Zubair offering a two Rakat prayer after the Asr prayer." He informed me that Aisha told him that the Prophet used to offer those two Rakat whenever he entered her house.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Abbas
hadiths.text: Allah's Apostle performed Tawaf (of the Kaba) ending a camel (at that time the Prophet had foot injury). Whenever he came to the Corner (having the Black Stone) he would point out towards it with a thing in his hand and say, "Allahu-Akbar."

hadiths.by: Narrated by Um Salama
hadiths.text: I informed Allah's Apostle that I was sick. He said, "Perform Tawaf (of the Kaba) while riding behind the people." So, I performed the Tawaf while Allah's Apostle was offering the prayer beside the Kaba and was reciting Surat-at-Tur.

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ibn Umar
